Thing.comment: The most generic type of item.

domainIncludes.label: additionalType
domainIncludes.comment: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

domainIncludes.label: alternateName
domainIncludes.comment: An alias for the item.

domainIncludes.label: description
domainIncludes.comment: A description of the item.

domainIncludes.label: disambiguatingDescription
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.

domainIncludes.label: image
domainIncludes.comment: An image of the item. This can be a [[URL]] or a fully described [[ImageObject]].

domainIncludes.label: mainEntityOfPage
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#mainEntityBackground) for details.

domainIncludes.label: name
domainIncludes.comment: The name of the item.

domainIncludes.label: sameAs
domainIncludes.comment: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

domainIncludes.label: url
domainIncludes.comment: URL of the item.

domainIncludes.label: potentialAction
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

domainIncludes.label: identifier
domainIncludes.comment: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of [[Thing]], such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#identifierBg) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: subjectOf
domainIncludes.comment: A CreativeWork or Event about this Thing..

rangeIncludes.label: about
rangeIncludes.comment: The subject matter of the content.

rangeIncludes.label: category
rangeIncludes.comment: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

rangeIncludes.label: collection
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The collection target of the action.

rangeIncludes.label: targetCollection
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The collection target of the action.

rangeIncludes.label: instrument
rangeIncludes.comment: The object that helped the agent perform the action. e.g. John wrote a book with *a pen*.

rangeIncludes.label: itemReviewed
rangeIncludes.comment: The item that is being reviewed/rated.

rangeIncludes.label: mainEntity
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates the primary entity described in some page or other CreativeWork.

rangeIncludes.label: mentions
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.

rangeIncludes.label: object
rangeIncludes.comment: The object upon which the action is carried out, whose state is kept intact or changed. Also known as the semantic roles patient, affected or undergoer (which change their state) or theme (which doesn't). e.g. John read *a book*.

rangeIncludes.label: option
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The options subject to this action.

rangeIncludes.label: actionOption
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The options subject to this action.

rangeIncludes.label: produces
rangeIncludes.comment: The tangible thing generated by the service, e.g. a passport, permit, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: serviceOutput
rangeIncludes.comment: The tangible thing generated by the service, e.g. a passport, permit, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: replacee
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The object that is being replaced.

rangeIncludes.label: replacer
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The object that replaces.

rangeIncludes.label: result
rangeIncludes.comment: The result produced in the action. e.g. John wrote *a book*.

rangeIncludes.label: reservationFor
rangeIncludes.comment: The thing -- flight, event, restaurant,etc. being reserved.

rangeIncludes.label: error
rangeIncludes.comment: For failed actions, more information on the cause of the failure.

rangeIncludes.label: defaultValue
rangeIncludes.comment: The default value of the input.  For properties that expect a literal, the default is a literal value, for properties that expect an object, it's an ID reference to one of the current values.

rangeIncludes.label: itemListElement
rangeIncludes.comment:
For itemListElement values, you can use simple strings (e.g. "Peter", "Paul", "Mary"), existing entities, or use ListItem.

Text values are best if the elements in the list are plain strings. Existing entities are best for a simple, unordered list of existing things in your data. ListItem is used with ordered lists when you want to provide additional context about the element in that list or when the same item might be in different places in different lists.

Note: The order of elements in your mark-up is not sufficient for indicating the order or elements.  Use ListItem with a 'position' property in such cases.

rangeIncludes.label: item
rangeIncludes.comment: An entity represented by an entry in a list or data feed (e.g. an 'artist' in a list of 'artists')’.

rangeIncludes.label: quest
rangeIncludes.comment: The task that a player-controlled character, or group of characters may complete in order to gain a reward.

rangeIncludes.label: gameItem
rangeIncludes.comment: An item is an object within the game world that can be collected by a player or, occasionally, a non-player character.

rangeIncludes.label: characterAttribute
rangeIncludes.comment: A piece of data that represents a particular aspect of a fictional character (skill, power, character points, advantage, disadvantage).

rangeIncludes.label: gamePlatform
rangeIncludes.comment: The electronic systems used to play video games.

rangeIncludes.label: dataFeedElement
rangeIncludes.comment: An item within in a data feed. Data feeds may have many elements.

rangeIncludes.label: requiredCollateral
rangeIncludes.comment: Assets required to secure loan or credit repayments. It may take form of third party pledge, goods, financial instruments (cash, securities, etc.)

CreativeWork.comment: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

domainIncludes.label: schemaVersion
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates (by URL or string) a particular version of a schema used in some CreativeWork. For example, a document could declare a schemaVersion using an URL such as version/2.0/ if precise indication of schema version was required by some application.

domainIncludes.label: about
domainIncludes.comment: The subject matter of the content.

domainIncludes.label: accessibilityAPI
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

domainIncludes.label: accessibilityControl
domainIncludes.comment: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

domainIncludes.label: accessibilityFeature
domainIncludes.comment: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

domainIncludes.label: accessibilityHazard
domainIncludes.comment: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3 ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

domainIncludes.label: accountablePerson
domainIncludes.comment: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.

domainIncludes.label: aggregateRating
domainIncludes.comment: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

domainIncludes.label: alternativeHeadline
domainIncludes.comment: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.

domainIncludes.label: associatedMedia
domainIncludes.comment: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.

domainIncludes.label: audience
domainIncludes.comment: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

domainIncludes.label: audio
domainIncludes.comment: An embedded audio object.

domainIncludes.label: author
domainIncludes.comment: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

domainIncludes.label: award
domainIncludes.comment: An award won by or for this item.

domainIncludes.label: awards
domainIncludes.comment: Awards won by or for this item.

domainIncludes.label: citation
domainIncludes.comment: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

domainIncludes.label: comment
domainIncludes.comment: Comments, typically from users.

domainIncludes.label: contentLocation
domainIncludes.comment: The location depicted or described in the content. For example, the location in a photograph or painting.

domainIncludes.label: locationCreated
domainIncludes.comment: The location where the CreativeWork was created, which may not be the same as the location depicted in the CreativeWork.

domainIncludes.label: contentRating
domainIncludes.comment: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.

domainIncludes.label: contributor
domainIncludes.comment: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

domainIncludes.label: copyrightHolder
domainIncludes.comment: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

domainIncludes.label: copyrightYear
domainIncludes.comment: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

domainIncludes.label: creator
domainIncludes.comment: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

domainIncludes.label: dateCreated
domainIncludes.comment: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

domainIncludes.label: dateModified
domainIncludes.comment: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

domainIncludes.label: datePublished
domainIncludes.comment: Date of first broadcast/publication.

domainIncludes.label: discussionUrl
domainIncludes.comment: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.

domainIncludes.label: editor
domainIncludes.comment: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.

domainIncludes.label: educationalAlignment
domainIncludes.comment: An alignment to an established educational framework.

domainIncludes.label: educationalUse
domainIncludes.comment: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

domainIncludes.label: encoding
domainIncludes.comment: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia.

domainIncludes.label: encodingFormat
domainIncludes.comment:
Media type typically expressed using a MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml) and [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types)) e.g. application/zip for a SoftwareApplication binary, audio/mpeg for .mp3 etc.).

In cases where a [[CreativeWork]] has several media type representations, [[encoding]] can be used to indicate each [[MediaObject]] alongside particular [[encodingFormat]] information.

Unregistered or niche encoding and file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia/Wikidata entry.

domainIncludes.label: encodings
domainIncludes.comment: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork.

domainIncludes.label: expires
domainIncludes.comment: Date the content expires and is no longer useful or available. For example a [[VideoObject]] or [[NewsArticle]] whose availability or relevance is time-limited, or a [[ClaimReview]] fact check whose publisher wants to indicate that it may no longer be relevant (or helpful to highlight) after some date.

domainIncludes.label: fileFormat
domainIncludes.comment: Media type, typically MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml)) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.

domainIncludes.label: isAccessibleForFree
domainIncludes.comment: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

domainIncludes.label: genre
domainIncludes.comment: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

domainIncludes.label: headline
domainIncludes.comment: Headline of the article.

domainIncludes.label: inLanguage
domainIncludes.comment: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

domainIncludes.label: interactivityType
domainIncludes.comment: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

domainIncludes.label: isBasedOnUrl
domainIncludes.comment: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

domainIncludes.label: isBasedOn
domainIncludes.comment: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

domainIncludes.label: isFamilyFriendly
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.

domainIncludes.label: isPartOf
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense), is part of.

domainIncludes.label: keywords
domainIncludes.comment: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

domainIncludes.label: license
domainIncludes.comment: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

domainIncludes.label: learningResourceType
domainIncludes.comment: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

domainIncludes.label: mainEntity
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates the primary entity described in some page or other CreativeWork.

domainIncludes.label: mentions
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.

domainIncludes.label: offers
domainIncludes.comment: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

domainIncludes.label: position
domainIncludes.comment: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

domainIncludes.label: producer
domainIncludes.comment: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).

domainIncludes.label: publication
domainIncludes.comment: A publication event associated with the item.

domainIncludes.label: publisher
domainIncludes.comment: The publisher of the creative work.

domainIncludes.label: publishingPrinciples
domainIncludes.comment:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via [[URL]]) a document describing the editorial principles of an [[Organization]] (or individual e.g. a [[Person]] writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a [[CreativeWork]] (e.g. [[NewsArticle]]) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the [[CreativeWork]].

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a [[funder]]) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

domainIncludes.label: recordedAt
domainIncludes.comment: The Event where the CreativeWork was recorded. The CreativeWork may capture all or part of the event.

domainIncludes.label: review
domainIncludes.comment: A review of the item.

domainIncludes.label: reviews
domainIncludes.comment: Review of the item.

domainIncludes.label: sourceOrganization
domainIncludes.comment: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.

domainIncludes.label: spatial
domainIncludes.comment:
The "spatial" property can be used in cases when more specific properties
(e.g. [[locationCreated]], [[spatialCoverage]], [[contentLocation]]) are not known to be appropriate.

domainIncludes.label: spatialCoverage
domainIncludes.comment:
The spatialCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the place(s) which are the focus of the content. It is a subproperty of
      contentLocation intended primarily for more technical and detailed materials. For example with a Dataset, it indicates
      areas that the dataset describes: a dataset of New York weather would have spatialCoverage which was the place: the state of New York.

domainIncludes.label: sponsor
domainIncludes.comment: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

domainIncludes.label: funder
domainIncludes.comment: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

domainIncludes.label: temporalCoverage
domainIncludes.comment:
The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a DateTime or as a textual string indicating a time period in [ISO 8601 time interval format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Time_intervals). In
      the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written "2011/2012"). Other forms of content e.g. ScholarlyArticle, Book, TVSeries or TVEpisode may indicate their temporalCoverage in broader terms - textually or via well-known URL.
      Written works such as books may sometimes have precise temporal coverage too, e.g. a work set in 1939 - 1945 can be indicated in ISO 8601 interval format format via "1939/1945".

Open-ended date ranges can be written with ".." in place of the end date. For example, "2015-11/.." indicates a range beginning in November 2015 and with no specified final date. This is tentative and might be updated in future when ISO 8601 is officially updated.

domainIncludes.label: temporal
domainIncludes.comment:
The "temporal" property can be used in cases where more specific properties
(e.g. [[temporalCoverage]], [[dateCreated]], [[dateModified]], [[datePublished]]) are not known to be appropriate.

domainIncludes.label: text
domainIncludes.comment: The textual content of this CreativeWork.

domainIncludes.label: thumbnailUrl
domainIncludes.comment: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.

domainIncludes.label: timeRequired
domainIncludes.comment: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. 'PT30M', 'PT1H25M'.

domainIncludes.label: typicalAgeRange
domainIncludes.comment: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

domainIncludes.label: version
domainIncludes.comment: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

domainIncludes.label: video
domainIncludes.comment: An embedded video object.

domainIncludes.label: provider
domainIncludes.comment: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

domainIncludes.label: commentCount
domainIncludes.comment: The number of comments this CreativeWork (e.g. Article, Question or Answer) has received. This is most applicable to works published in Web sites with commenting system; additional comments may exist elsewhere.

domainIncludes.label: hasPart
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that is part of this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense).

domainIncludes.label: workExample
domainIncludes.comment: Example/instance/realization/derivation of the concept of this creative work. eg. The paperback edition, first edition, or eBook.

domainIncludes.label: exampleOfWork
domainIncludes.comment: A creative work that this work is an example/instance/realization/derivation of.

domainIncludes.label: character
domainIncludes.comment: Fictional person connected with a creative work.

domainIncludes.label: translator
domainIncludes.comment: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

domainIncludes.label: releasedEvent
domainIncludes.comment: The place and time the release was issued, expressed as a PublicationEvent.

domainIncludes.label: material
domainIncludes.comment: A material that something is made from, e.g. leather, wool, cotton, paper.

domainIncludes.label: interactionStatistic
domainIncludes.comment: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.

domainIncludes.label: accessMode
domainIncludes.comment: The human sensory perceptual system or cognitive faculty through which a person may process or perceive information. Expected values include: auditory, tactile, textual, visual, colorDependent, chartOnVisual, chemOnVisual, diagramOnVisual, mathOnVisual, musicOnVisual, textOnVisual.

domainIncludes.label: accessModeSufficient
domainIncludes.comment: A list of single or combined accessModes that are sufficient to understand all the intellectual content of a resource. Expected values include:  auditory, tactile, textual, visual.

domainIncludes.label: accessibilitySummary
domainIncludes.comment: A human-readable summary of specific accessibility features or deficiencies, consistent with the other accessibility metadata but expressing subtleties such as "short descriptions are present but long descriptions will be needed for non-visual users" or "short descriptions are present and no long descriptions are needed."

rangeIncludes.label: citation
rangeIncludes.comment: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: discusses
rangeIncludes.comment: Specifies the CreativeWork associated with the UserComment.

rangeIncludes.label: encodesCreativeWork
rangeIncludes.comment: The CreativeWork encoded by this media object.

rangeIncludes.label: isBasedOnUrl
rangeIncludes.comment: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

rangeIncludes.label: isBasedOn
rangeIncludes.comment: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

rangeIncludes.label: isPartOf
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense), is part of.

rangeIncludes.label: license
rangeIncludes.comment: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

rangeIncludes.label: mainEntityOfPage
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#mainEntityBackground) for details.

rangeIncludes.label: publishingPrinciples
rangeIncludes.comment:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via [[URL]]) a document describing the editorial principles of an [[Organization]] (or individual e.g. a [[Person]] writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a [[CreativeWork]] (e.g. [[NewsArticle]]) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the [[CreativeWork]].

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a [[funder]]) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

rangeIncludes.label: recordedIn
rangeIncludes.comment: The CreativeWork that captured all or part of this Event.

rangeIncludes.label: workPerformed
rangeIncludes.comment: A work performed in some event, for example a play performed in a TheaterEvent.

rangeIncludes.label: workFeatured
rangeIncludes.comment:
A work featured in some event, e.g. exhibited in an ExhibitionEvent.
       Specific subproperties are available for workPerformed (e.g. a play), or a workPresented (a Movie at a ScreeningEvent).

rangeIncludes.label: hasPart
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that is part of this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense).

rangeIncludes.label: workExample
rangeIncludes.comment: Example/instance/realization/derivation of the concept of this creative work. eg. The paperback edition, first edition, or eBook.

rangeIncludes.label: exampleOfWork
rangeIncludes.comment: A creative work that this work is an example/instance/realization/derivation of.

rangeIncludes.label: cheatCode
rangeIncludes.comment: Cheat codes to the game.

rangeIncludes.label: softwareHelp
rangeIncludes.comment: Software application help.

rangeIncludes.label: gameTip
rangeIncludes.comment: Links to tips, tactics, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: sharedContent
rangeIncludes.comment: A CreativeWork such as an image, video, or audio clip shared as part of this posting.

rangeIncludes.label: lyrics
rangeIncludes.comment: The words in the song.

rangeIncludes.label: recipeInstructions
rangeIncludes.comment: A step in making the recipe, in the form of a single item (document, video, etc.) or an ordered list with HowToStep and/or HowToSection items.

rangeIncludes.label: messageAttachment
rangeIncludes.comment: A CreativeWork attached to the message.

rangeIncludes.label: step
rangeIncludes.comment: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection.

rangeIncludes.label: steps
rangeIncludes.comment: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection (originally misnamed 'steps'; 'step' is preferred).

rangeIncludes.label: subjectOf
rangeIncludes.comment: A CreativeWork or Event about this Thing..

WebPage.comment: A web page. Every web page is implicitly assumed to be declared to be of type WebPage, so the various properties about that webpage, such as breadcrumb may be used. We recommend explicit declaration if these properties are specified, but if they are found outside of an itemscope, they will be assumed to be about the page.

domainIncludes.label: breadcrumb
domainIncludes.comment: A set of links that can help a user understand and navigate a website hierarchy.

domainIncludes.label: lastReviewed
domainIncludes.comment: Date on which the content on this web page was last reviewed for accuracy and/or completeness.

domainIncludes.label: mainContentOfPage
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates if this web page element is the main subject of the page.

domainIncludes.label: primaryImageOfPage
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates the main image on the page.

domainIncludes.label: relatedLink
domainIncludes.comment: A link related to this web page, for example to other related web pages.

domainIncludes.label: reviewedBy
domainIncludes.comment: People or organizations that have reviewed the content on this web page for accuracy and/or completeness.

domainIncludes.label: significantLink
domainIncludes.comment: One of the more significant URLs on the page. Typically, these are the non-navigation links that are clicked on the most.

domainIncludes.label: significantLinks
domainIncludes.comment: The most significant URLs on the page. Typically, these are the non-navigation links that are clicked on the most.

domainIncludes.label: specialty
domainIncludes.comment: One of the domain specialities to which this web page's content applies.

domainIncludes.label: speakable
domainIncludes.comment:
Indicates sections of a Web page that are particularly 'speakable' in the sense of being highlighted as being especially appropriate for text-to-speech conversion. Other sections of a page may also be usefully spoken in particular circumstances; the 'speakable' property serves to indicate the parts most likely to be generally useful for speech.

The *speakable* property can be repeated an arbitrary number of times, with three kinds of possible 'content-locator' values:

1.) *id-value* URL references - uses *id-value* of an element in the page being annotated. The simplest use of *speakable* has (potentially relative) URL values, referencing identified sections of the document concerned.

2.) CSS Selectors - addresses content in the annotated page, eg. via class attribute. Use the [[cssSelector]] property.

3.)  XPaths - addresses content via XPaths (assuming an XML view of the content). Use the [[xpath]] property.


For more sophisticated markup of speakable sections beyond simple ID references, either CSS selectors or XPath expressions to pick out document section(s) as speakable. For this
we define a supporting type, [[SpeakableSpecification]]  which is defined to be a possible value of the *speakable* property.

Organization.comment: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

domainIncludes.label: hasOfferCatalog
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

domainIncludes.label: address
domainIncludes.comment: Physical address of the item.

domainIncludes.label: aggregateRating
domainIncludes.comment: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

domainIncludes.label: areaServed
domainIncludes.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

domainIncludes.label: award
domainIncludes.comment: An award won by or for this item.

domainIncludes.label: awards
domainIncludes.comment: Awards won by or for this item.

domainIncludes.label: parentOrganization
domainIncludes.comment: The larger organization that this organization is a [[subOrganization]] of, if any.

domainIncludes.label: brand
domainIncludes.comment: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

domainIncludes.label: contactPoint
domainIncludes.comment: A contact point for a person or organization.

domainIncludes.label: contactPoints
domainIncludes.comment: A contact point for a person or organization.

domainIncludes.label: department
domainIncludes.comment: A relationship between an organization and a department of that organization, also described as an organization (allowing different urls, logos, opening hours). For example: a store with a pharmacy, or a bakery with a cafe.

domainIncludes.label: duns
domainIncludes.comment: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

domainIncludes.label: email
domainIncludes.comment: Email address.

domainIncludes.label: employee
domainIncludes.comment: Someone working for this organization.

domainIncludes.label: employees
domainIncludes.comment: People working for this organization.

domainIncludes.label: event
domainIncludes.comment: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

domainIncludes.label: events
domainIncludes.comment: Upcoming or past events associated with this place or organization.

domainIncludes.label: faxNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The fax number.

domainIncludes.label: founder
domainIncludes.comment: A person who founded this organization.

domainIncludes.label: founders
domainIncludes.comment: A person who founded this organization.

domainIncludes.label: dissolutionDate
domainIncludes.comment: The date that this organization was dissolved.

domainIncludes.label: foundingDate
domainIncludes.comment: The date that this organization was founded.

domainIncludes.label: globalLocationNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The [Global Location Number](http://www.gs1.org/gln) (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

domainIncludes.label: hasPOS
domainIncludes.comment: Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

domainIncludes.label: isicV4
domainIncludes.comment: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

domainIncludes.label: legalName
domainIncludes.comment: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

domainIncludes.label: location
domainIncludes.comment: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

domainIncludes.label: logo
domainIncludes.comment: An associated logo.

domainIncludes.label: makesOffer
domainIncludes.comment: A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person.

domainIncludes.label: offeredBy
domainIncludes.comment: A pointer to the organization or person making the offer.

domainIncludes.label: member
domainIncludes.comment: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals.

domainIncludes.label: memberOf
domainIncludes.comment: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs.

domainIncludes.label: members
domainIncludes.comment: A member of this organization.

domainIncludes.label: naics
domainIncludes.comment: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfEmployees
domainIncludes.comment: The number of employees in an organization e.g. business.

domainIncludes.label: owns
domainIncludes.comment: Products owned by the organization or person.

domainIncludes.label: publishingPrinciples
domainIncludes.comment:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via [[URL]]) a document describing the editorial principles of an [[Organization]] (or individual e.g. a [[Person]] writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a [[CreativeWork]] (e.g. [[NewsArticle]]) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the [[CreativeWork]].

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a [[funder]]) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

domainIncludes.label: review
domainIncludes.comment: A review of the item.

domainIncludes.label: reviews
domainIncludes.comment: Review of the item.

domainIncludes.label: slogan
domainIncludes.comment: A slogan or motto associated with the item.

domainIncludes.label: seeks
domainIncludes.comment: A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

domainIncludes.label: serviceArea
domainIncludes.comment: The geographic area where the service is provided.

domainIncludes.label: sponsor
domainIncludes.comment: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

domainIncludes.label: funder
domainIncludes.comment: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

domainIncludes.label: subOrganization
domainIncludes.comment: A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary. See also: the more specific 'department' property.

domainIncludes.label: taxID
domainIncludes.comment: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

domainIncludes.label: telephone
domainIncludes.comment: The telephone number.

domainIncludes.label: vatID
domainIncludes.comment: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

domainIncludes.label: foundingLocation
domainIncludes.comment: The place where the Organization was founded.

domainIncludes.label: leiCode
domainIncludes.comment: An organization identifier that uniquely identifies a legal entity as defined in ISO 17442.

rangeIncludes.label: acquiredFrom
rangeIncludes.comment: The organization or person from which the product was acquired.

rangeIncludes.label: affiliation
rangeIncludes.comment: An organization that this person is affiliated with. For example, a school/university, a club, or a team.

rangeIncludes.label: agent
rangeIncludes.comment: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). e.g. *John* wrote a book.

rangeIncludes.label: organizer
rangeIncludes.comment: An organizer of an Event.

rangeIncludes.label: attendee
rangeIncludes.comment: A person or organization attending the event.

rangeIncludes.label: attendees
rangeIncludes.comment: A person attending the event.

rangeIncludes.label: author
rangeIncludes.comment: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

rangeIncludes.label: bccRecipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of recipient. The recipient blind copied on a message.

rangeIncludes.label: branchOf
rangeIncludes.comment: The larger organization that this local business is a branch of, if any. Not to be confused with (anatomical)[[branch]].

rangeIncludes.label: parentOrganization
rangeIncludes.comment: The larger organization that this organization is a [[subOrganization]] of, if any.

rangeIncludes.label: brand
rangeIncludes.comment: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

rangeIncludes.label: broadcaster
rangeIncludes.comment: The organization owning or operating the broadcast service.

rangeIncludes.label: carrier
rangeIncludes.comment: 'carrier' is an out-dated term indicating the 'provider' for parcel delivery and flights.

rangeIncludes.label: ccRecipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of recipient. The recipient copied on a message.

rangeIncludes.label: contributor
rangeIncludes.comment: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

rangeIncludes.label: copyrightHolder
rangeIncludes.comment: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

rangeIncludes.label: creator
rangeIncludes.comment: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

rangeIncludes.label: customer
rangeIncludes.comment: Party placing the order or paying the invoice.

rangeIncludes.label: department
rangeIncludes.comment: A relationship between an organization and a department of that organization, also described as an organization (allowing different urls, logos, opening hours). For example: a store with a pharmacy, or a bakery with a cafe.

rangeIncludes.label: endorsee
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The person/organization being supported.

rangeIncludes.label: followee
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The person or organization being followed.

rangeIncludes.label: hiringOrganization
rangeIncludes.comment: Organization offering the job position.

rangeIncludes.label: landlord
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The owner of the real estate property.

rangeIncludes.label: lender
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The person that lends the object being borrowed.

rangeIncludes.label: member
rangeIncludes.comment: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals.

rangeIncludes.label: memberOf
rangeIncludes.comment: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs.

rangeIncludes.label: members
rangeIncludes.comment: A member of this organization.

rangeIncludes.label: merchant
rangeIncludes.comment: 'merchant' is an out-dated term for 'seller'.

rangeIncludes.label: manufacturer
rangeIncludes.comment: The manufacturer of the product.

rangeIncludes.label: participant
rangeIncludes.comment: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. e.g. John wrote a book with *Steve*.

rangeIncludes.label: performer
rangeIncludes.comment: A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor.

rangeIncludes.label: performers
rangeIncludes.comment: The main performer or performers of the event—for example, a presenter, musician, or actor.

rangeIncludes.label: producer
rangeIncludes.comment: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).

rangeIncludes.label: productionCompany
rangeIncludes.comment: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

rangeIncludes.label: publisher
rangeIncludes.comment: The publisher of the creative work.

rangeIncludes.label: recipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

rangeIncludes.label: reviewedBy
rangeIncludes.comment: People or organizations that have reviewed the content on this web page for accuracy and/or completeness.

rangeIncludes.label: seller
rangeIncludes.comment: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.

rangeIncludes.label: sender
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the sending end of the action.

rangeIncludes.label: serviceOperator
rangeIncludes.comment: The operating organization, if different from the provider.  This enables the representation of services that are provided by an organization, but operated by another organization like a subcontractor.

rangeIncludes.label: sourceOrganization
rangeIncludes.comment: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.

rangeIncludes.label: sponsor
rangeIncludes.comment: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

rangeIncludes.label: funder
rangeIncludes.comment: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

rangeIncludes.label: subOrganization
rangeIncludes.comment: A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary. See also: the more specific 'department' property.

rangeIncludes.label: toRecipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of recipient. The recipient who was directly sent the message.

rangeIncludes.label: vendor
rangeIncludes.comment: 'vendor' is an earlier term for 'seller'.

rangeIncludes.label: worksFor
rangeIncludes.comment: Organizations that the person works for.

rangeIncludes.label: underName
rangeIncludes.comment: The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.

rangeIncludes.label: provider
rangeIncludes.comment: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

rangeIncludes.label: bookingAgent
rangeIncludes.comment: 'bookingAgent' is an out-dated term indicating a 'broker' that serves as a booking agent.

rangeIncludes.label: hostingOrganization
rangeIncludes.comment: The organization (airline, travelers' club, etc.) the membership is made with.

rangeIncludes.label: issuedBy
rangeIncludes.comment: The organization issuing the ticket or permit.

rangeIncludes.label: broker
rangeIncludes.comment: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

rangeIncludes.label: translator
rangeIncludes.comment: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

rangeIncludes.label: composer
rangeIncludes.comment: The person or organization who wrote a composition, or who is the composer of a work performed at some event.

rangeIncludes.label: creditedTo
rangeIncludes.comment: The group the release is credited to if different than the byArtist. For example, Red and Blue is credited to "Stefani Germanotta Band", but by Lady Gaga.

rangeIncludes.label: recordLabel
rangeIncludes.comment: The label that issued the release.

rangeIncludes.label: broadcastAffiliateOf
rangeIncludes.comment: The media network(s) whose content is broadcast on this station.

rangeIncludes.label: grantee
rangeIncludes.comment: The person, organization, contact point, or audience that has been granted this permission.

rangeIncludes.label: authenticator
rangeIncludes.comment: The Organization responsible for authenticating the user's subscription. For example, many media apps require a cable/satellite provider to authenticate your subscription before playing media.

Place.comment: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

domainIncludes.label: address
domainIncludes.comment: Physical address of the item.

domainIncludes.label: aggregateRating
domainIncludes.comment: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

domainIncludes.label: branchCode
domainIncludes.comment: A short textual code (also called "store code") that uniquely identifies a place of business. The code is typically assigned by the parentOrganization and used in structured URLs.\n\nFor example, in the URL http://www.starbucks.co.uk/store-locator/etc/detail/3047 the code "3047" is a branchCode for a particular branch.

domainIncludes.label: containedInPlace
domainIncludes.comment: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

domainIncludes.label: containsPlace
domainIncludes.comment: The basic containment relation between a place and another that it contains.

domainIncludes.label: containedIn
domainIncludes.comment: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

domainIncludes.label: event
domainIncludes.comment: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

domainIncludes.label: events
domainIncludes.comment: Upcoming or past events associated with this place or organization.

domainIncludes.label: faxNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The fax number.

domainIncludes.label: isAccessibleForFree
domainIncludes.comment: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

domainIncludes.label: publicAccess
domainIncludes.comment: A flag to signal that the [[Place]] is open to public visitors.  If this property is omitted there is no assumed default boolean value

domainIncludes.label: geo
domainIncludes.comment: The geo coordinates of the place.

domainIncludes.label: globalLocationNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The [Global Location Number](http://www.gs1.org/gln) (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

domainIncludes.label: isicV4
domainIncludes.comment: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

domainIncludes.label: logo
domainIncludes.comment: An associated logo.

domainIncludes.label: hasMap
domainIncludes.comment: A URL to a map of the place.

domainIncludes.label: map
domainIncludes.comment: A URL to a map of the place.

domainIncludes.label: maps
domainIncludes.comment: A URL to a map of the place.

domainIncludes.label: maximumAttendeeCapacity
domainIncludes.comment: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.

domainIncludes.label: openingHoursSpecification
domainIncludes.comment: The opening hours of a certain place.

domainIncludes.label: specialOpeningHoursSpecification
domainIncludes.comment: The special opening hours of a certain place.\n\nUse this to explicitly override general opening hours brought in scope by [[openingHoursSpecification]] or [[openingHours]].

domainIncludes.label: photo
domainIncludes.comment: A photograph of this place.

domainIncludes.label: photos
domainIncludes.comment: Photographs of this place.

domainIncludes.label: review
domainIncludes.comment: A review of the item.

domainIncludes.label: reviews
domainIncludes.comment: Review of the item.

domainIncludes.label: slogan
domainIncludes.comment: A slogan or motto associated with the item.

domainIncludes.label: telephone
domainIncludes.comment: The telephone number.

domainIncludes.label: additionalProperty
domainIncludes.comment: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. width, color, gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

domainIncludes.label: amenityFeature
domainIncludes.comment: An amenity feature (e.g. a characteristic or service) of the Accommodation. This generic property does not make a statement about whether the feature is included in an offer for the main accommodation or available at extra costs.

domainIncludes.label: smokingAllowed
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates whether it is allowed to smoke in the place, e.g. in the restaurant, hotel or hotel room.

rangeIncludes.label: area
rangeIncludes.comment: The area within which users can expect to reach the broadcast service.

rangeIncludes.label: areaServed
rangeIncludes.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

rangeIncludes.label: availableAtOrFrom
rangeIncludes.comment: The place(s) from which the offer can be obtained (e.g. store locations).

rangeIncludes.label: containedInPlace
rangeIncludes.comment: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

rangeIncludes.label: containsPlace
rangeIncludes.comment: The basic containment relation between a place and another that it contains.

rangeIncludes.label: containedIn
rangeIncludes.comment: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

rangeIncludes.label: contentLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: The location depicted or described in the content. For example, the location in a photograph or painting.

rangeIncludes.label: locationCreated
rangeIncludes.comment: The location where the CreativeWork was created, which may not be the same as the location depicted in the CreativeWork.

rangeIncludes.label: course
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The course where this action was taken.

rangeIncludes.label: exerciseCourse
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The course where this action was taken.

rangeIncludes.label: eligibleRegion
rangeIncludes.comment: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.\n\nSee also [[ineligibleRegion]].

rangeIncludes.label: ineligibleRegion
rangeIncludes.comment: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

rangeIncludes.label: fromLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The original location of the object or the agent before the action.

rangeIncludes.label: hasPOS
rangeIncludes.comment: Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

rangeIncludes.label: homeLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: A contact location for a person's residence.

rangeIncludes.label: jobLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: A (typically single) geographic location associated with the job position.

rangeIncludes.label: location
rangeIncludes.comment: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

rangeIncludes.label: serviceArea
rangeIncludes.comment: The geographic area where the service is provided.

rangeIncludes.label: serviceLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: The location (e.g. civic structure, local business, etc.) where a person can go to access the service.

rangeIncludes.label: spatial
rangeIncludes.comment:
The "spatial" property can be used in cases when more specific properties
(e.g. [[locationCreated]], [[spatialCoverage]], [[contentLocation]]) are not known to be appropriate.

rangeIncludes.label: spatialCoverage
rangeIncludes.comment:
The spatialCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the place(s) which are the focus of the content. It is a subproperty of
      contentLocation intended primarily for more technical and detailed materials. For example with a Dataset, it indicates
      areas that the dataset describes: a dataset of New York weather would have spatialCoverage which was the place: the state of New York.

rangeIncludes.label: toLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

rangeIncludes.label: workLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: A contact location for a person's place of work.

rangeIncludes.label: pickupLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: Where a taxi will pick up a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

rangeIncludes.label: dropoffLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: Where a rental car can be dropped off.

rangeIncludes.label: gameLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: Real or fictional location of the game (or part of game).

rangeIncludes.label: regionsAllowed
rangeIncludes.comment: The regions where the media is allowed. If not specified, then it's assumed to be allowed everywhere. Specify the countries in [ISO 3166 format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166).

rangeIncludes.label: foundingLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: The place where the Organization was founded.

rangeIncludes.label: birthPlace
rangeIncludes.comment: The place where the person was born.

rangeIncludes.label: deathPlace
rangeIncludes.comment: The place where the person died.

LocalBusiness.comment: A particular physical business or branch of an organization. Examples of LocalBusiness include a restaurant, a particular branch of a restaurant chain, a branch of a bank, a medical practice, a club, a bowling alley, etc.

domainIncludes.label: branchOf
domainIncludes.comment: The larger organization that this local business is a branch of, if any. Not to be confused with (anatomical)[[branch]].

domainIncludes.label: currenciesAccepted
domainIncludes.comment: The currency accepted.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

domainIncludes.label: openingHours
domainIncludes.comment: The general opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'. * Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: ```Mo```, ```Tu```, ```We```, ```Th```, ```Fr```, ```Sa```, ```Su```. * Times are specified using 24:00 time. For example, 3pm is specified as ```15:00```. * Here is an example: <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</time>. * If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</time>.

domainIncludes.label: paymentAccepted
domainIncludes.comment: Cash, Credit Card, Cryptocurrency, Local Exchange Tradings System, etc.

domainIncludes.label: priceRange
domainIncludes.comment: The price range of the business, for example ```$$$```.

MedicalOrganization.comment: A medical organization (physical or not), such as hospital, institution or clinic.

domainIncludes.label: feesAndCommissionsSpecification
domainIncludes.comment: Description of fees, commissions, and other terms applied either to a class of financial product, or by a financial service organization.

ProfessionalService.comment:
Original definition: "provider of professional services."\n\nThe general [[ProfessionalService]] type for local businesses was deprecated due to confusion with [[Service]]. For reference, the types that it included were: [[Dentist]],
        [[AccountingService]], [[Attorney]], [[Notary]], as well as types for several kinds of [[HomeAndConstructionBusiness]]: [[Electrician]], [[GeneralContractor]],
        [[HousePainter]], [[Locksmith]], [[Plumber]], [[RoofingContractor]]. [[LegalService]] was introduced as a more inclusive supertype of [[Attorney]].

LegalService.comment: A LegalService is a business that provides legally-oriented services, advice and representation, e.g. law firms.\n\nAs a [[LocalBusiness]] it can be described as a [[provider]] of one or more [[Service]]\(s).

AccountingService.comment: Accountancy business.\n\nAs a [[LocalBusiness]] it can be described as a [[provider]] of one or more [[Service]]\(s).

AdministrativeArea.comment: A geographical region, typically under the jurisdiction of a particular government.

rangeIncludes.label: areaServed
rangeIncludes.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

rangeIncludes.label: geographicArea
rangeIncludes.comment: The geographic area associated with the audience.

rangeIncludes.label: serviceArea
rangeIncludes.comment: The geographic area where the service is provided.

rangeIncludes.label: validIn
rangeIncludes.comment: The geographic area where a permit or similar thing is valid.

rangeIncludes.label: occupationLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: The region/country for which this occupational description is appropriate. Note that educational requirements and qualifications can vary between jurisdictions.

rangeIncludes.label: entertainmentBusiness
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The entertainment business where the action occurred.

Intangible.comment: A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things such as quantities, structured values, etc.

Offer.comment: An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service — for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book.\n\nFor [GTIN](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin)-related fields, see [Check Digit calculator](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/support/check_digit_calculator) and [validation guide](http://www.gs1us.org/resources/standards/gtin-validation-guide) from [GS1](http://www.gs1.org/).

domainIncludes.label: acceptedPaymentMethod
domainIncludes.comment: The payment method(s) accepted by seller for this offer.

domainIncludes.label: addOn
domainIncludes.comment: An additional offer that can only be obtained in combination with the first base offer (e.g. supplements and extensions that are available for a surcharge).

domainIncludes.label: advanceBookingRequirement
domainIncludes.comment: The amount of time that is required between accepting the offer and the actual usage of the resource or service.

domainIncludes.label: aggregateRating
domainIncludes.comment: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

domainIncludes.label: areaServed
domainIncludes.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

domainIncludes.label: availability
domainIncludes.comment: The availability of this item—for example In stock, Out of stock, Pre-order, etc.

domainIncludes.label: availabilityEnds
domainIncludes.comment: The end of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

domainIncludes.label: availabilityStarts
domainIncludes.comment: The beginning of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

domainIncludes.label: availableAtOrFrom
domainIncludes.comment: The place(s) from which the offer can be obtained (e.g. store locations).

domainIncludes.label: availableDeliveryMethod
domainIncludes.comment: The delivery method(s) available for this offer.

domainIncludes.label: businessFunction
domainIncludes.comment: The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.

domainIncludes.label: category
domainIncludes.comment: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

domainIncludes.label: deliveryLeadTime
domainIncludes.comment: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods either leaving the warehouse or being prepared for pickup, in case the delivery method is on site pickup.

domainIncludes.label: eligibleCustomerType
domainIncludes.comment: The type(s) of customers for which the given offer is valid.

domainIncludes.label: eligibleDuration
domainIncludes.comment: The duration for which the given offer is valid.

domainIncludes.label: eligibleQuantity
domainIncludes.comment: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

domainIncludes.label: eligibleRegion
domainIncludes.comment: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.\n\nSee also [[ineligibleRegion]].

domainIncludes.label: ineligibleRegion
domainIncludes.comment: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

domainIncludes.label: eligibleTransactionVolume
domainIncludes.comment: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

domainIncludes.label: gtin12
domainIncludes.comment: The GTIN-12 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: gtin13
domainIncludes.comment: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: gtin14
domainIncludes.comment: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: gtin8
domainIncludes.comment: The [GTIN-8](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-8.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: includesObject
domainIncludes.comment: This links to a node or nodes indicating the exact quantity of the products included in the offer.

domainIncludes.label: inventoryLevel
domainIncludes.comment: The current approximate inventory level for the item or items.

domainIncludes.label: itemCondition
domainIncludes.comment: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition or a textual description of the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer.

domainIncludes.label: itemOffered
domainIncludes.comment: The item being offered.

domainIncludes.label: mpn
domainIncludes.comment: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

domainIncludes.label: price
domainIncludes.comment:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

* Use the [[priceCurrency]] property (with standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR") instead of including [ambiguous symbols](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollar_sign#Currencies_that_use_the_dollar_or_peso_sign) such as '$' in the value.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
* Note that both [RDFa](http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-rdfa-primer/#using-the-content-attribute) and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

domainIncludes.label: priceSpecification
domainIncludes.comment: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

domainIncludes.label: priceValidUntil
domainIncludes.comment: The date after which the price is no longer available.

domainIncludes.label: review
domainIncludes.comment: A review of the item.

domainIncludes.label: reviews
domainIncludes.comment: Review of the item.

domainIncludes.label: seller
domainIncludes.comment: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.

domainIncludes.label: serialNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.

domainIncludes.label: sku
domainIncludes.comment: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

domainIncludes.label: validFrom
domainIncludes.comment: The date when the item becomes valid.

domainIncludes.label: validThrough
domainIncludes.comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

domainIncludes.label: warranty
domainIncludes.comment: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

domainIncludes.label: priceCurrency
domainIncludes.comment: The currency of the price, or a price component when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

rangeIncludes.label: acceptedOffer
rangeIncludes.comment: The offer(s) -- e.g., product, quantity and price combinations -- included in the order.

rangeIncludes.label: addOn
rangeIncludes.comment: An additional offer that can only be obtained in combination with the first base offer (e.g. supplements and extensions that are available for a surcharge).

rangeIncludes.label: expectsAcceptanceOf
rangeIncludes.comment: An Offer which must be accepted before the user can perform the Action. For example, the user may need to buy a movie before being able to watch it.

rangeIncludes.label: makesOffer
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person.

rangeIncludes.label: offeredBy
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer to the organization or person making the offer.

rangeIncludes.label: offers
rangeIncludes.comment: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

AggregateOffer.comment: When a single product is associated with multiple offers (for example, the same pair of shoes is offered by different merchants), then AggregateOffer can be used.

domainIncludes.label: highPrice
domainIncludes.comment:
The highest price of all offers available.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

domainIncludes.label: lowPrice
domainIncludes.comment:
The lowest price of all offers available.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

domainIncludes.label: offerCount
domainIncludes.comment: The number of offers for the product.

domainIncludes.label: offers
domainIncludes.comment: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

Rating.comment: A rating is an evaluation on a numeric scale, such as 1 to 5 stars.

domainIncludes.label: author
domainIncludes.comment: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

domainIncludes.label: bestRating
domainIncludes.comment: The highest value allowed in this rating system. If bestRating is omitted, 5 is assumed.

domainIncludes.label: ratingValue
domainIncludes.comment:
The rating for the content.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

domainIncludes.label: worstRating
domainIncludes.comment: The lowest value allowed in this rating system. If worstRating is omitted, 1 is assumed.

domainIncludes.label: reviewAspect
domainIncludes.comment: This Review or Rating is relevant to this part or facet of the itemReviewed.

rangeIncludes.label: contentRating
rangeIncludes.comment: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.

rangeIncludes.label: reviewRating
rangeIncludes.comment: The rating given in this review. Note that reviews can themselves be rated. The ```reviewRating``` applies to rating given by the review. The [[aggregateRating]] property applies to the review itself, as a creative work.

rangeIncludes.label: starRating
rangeIncludes.comment: An official rating for a lodging business or food establishment, e.g. from national associations or standards bodies. Use the author property to indicate the rating organization, e.g. as an Organization with name such as (e.g. HOTREC, DEHOGA, WHR, or Hotelstars).

AggregateRating.comment: The average rating based on multiple ratings or reviews.

domainIncludes.label: itemReviewed
domainIncludes.comment: The item that is being reviewed/rated.

domainIncludes.label: ratingCount
domainIncludes.comment: The count of total number of ratings.

domainIncludes.label: reviewCount
domainIncludes.comment: The count of total number of reviews.

rangeIncludes.label: aggregateRating
rangeIncludes.comment: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

CivicStructure.comment: A public structure, such as a town hall or concert hall.

domainIncludes.label: openingHours
domainIncludes.comment: The general opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'. * Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: ```Mo```, ```Tu```, ```We```, ```Th```, ```Fr```, ```Sa```, ```Su```. * Times are specified using 24:00 time. For example, 3pm is specified as ```15:00```. * Here is an example: <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</time>. * If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</time>.

domainIncludes.label: iataCode
domainIncludes.comment: IATA identifier for an airline or airport.

domainIncludes.label: icaoCode
domainIncludes.comment: ICAO identifier for an airport.

rangeIncludes.label: departureAirport
rangeIncludes.comment: The airport where the flight originates.

rangeIncludes.label: arrivalAirport
rangeIncludes.comment: The airport where the flight terminates.

Residence.comment: The place where a person lives.

Article.comment: An article, such as a news article or piece of investigative report. Newspapers and magazines have articles of many different types and this is intended to cover them all.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

domainIncludes.label: articleBody
domainIncludes.comment: The actual body of the article.

domainIncludes.label: articleSection
domainIncludes.comment: Articles may belong to one or more 'sections' in a magazine or newspaper, such as Sports, Lifestyle, etc.

domainIncludes.label: wordCount
domainIncludes.comment: The number of words in the text of the Article.

domainIncludes.label: pageEnd
domainIncludes.comment: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

domainIncludes.label: pageStart
domainIncludes.comment: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

domainIncludes.label: pagination
domainIncludes.comment: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

domainIncludes.label: speakable
domainIncludes.comment:
Indicates sections of a Web page that are particularly 'speakable' in the sense of being highlighted as being especially appropriate for text-to-speech conversion. Other sections of a page may also be usefully spoken in particular circumstances; the 'speakable' property serves to indicate the parts most likely to be generally useful for speech.

The *speakable* property can be repeated an arbitrary number of times, with three kinds of possible 'content-locator' values:

1.) *id-value* URL references - uses *id-value* of an element in the page being annotated. The simplest use of *speakable* has (potentially relative) URL values, referencing identified sections of the document concerned.

2.) CSS Selectors - addresses content in the annotated page, eg. via class attribute. Use the [[cssSelector]] property.

3.)  XPaths - addresses content via XPaths (assuming an XML view of the content). Use the [[xpath]] property.


For more sophisticated markup of speakable sections beyond simple ID references, either CSS selectors or XPath expressions to pick out document section(s) as speakable. For this
we define a supporting type, [[SpeakableSpecification]]  which is defined to be a possible value of the *speakable* property.

Attorney.comment: Professional service: Attorney. \n\nThis type is deprecated - [[LegalService]] is more inclusive and less ambiguous.

Audience.comment: Intended audience for an item, i.e. the group for whom the item was created.

domainIncludes.label: audienceType
domainIncludes.comment: The target group associated with a given audience (e.g. veterans, car owners, musicians, etc.).

domainIncludes.label: geographicArea
domainIncludes.comment: The geographic area associated with the audience.

rangeIncludes.label: touristType
rangeIncludes.comment: Attraction suitable for type(s) of tourist. eg. Children, visitors from a particular country, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: audience
rangeIncludes.comment: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

rangeIncludes.label: permitAudience
rangeIncludes.comment: The target audience for this permit.

rangeIncludes.label: recipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

rangeIncludes.label: sender
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the sending end of the action.

rangeIncludes.label: serviceAudience
rangeIncludes.comment: The audience eligible for this service.

rangeIncludes.label: toRecipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of recipient. The recipient who was directly sent the message.

rangeIncludes.label: grantee
