rangeIncludes.comment: The person, organization, contact point, or audience that has been granted this permission.

MediaObject.comment: A media object, such as an image, video, or audio object embedded in a web page or a downloadable dataset i.e. DataDownload. Note that a creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio stream (2 AudioObject's).

domainIncludes.label: associatedArticle
domainIncludes.comment: A NewsArticle associated with the Media Object.

domainIncludes.label: bitrate
domainIncludes.comment: The bitrate of the media object.

domainIncludes.label: contentSize
domainIncludes.comment: File size in (mega/kilo) bytes.

domainIncludes.label: contentUrl
domainIncludes.comment: Actual bytes of the media object, for example the image file or video file.

domainIncludes.label: duration
domainIncludes.comment: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

domainIncludes.label: embedUrl
domainIncludes.comment: A URL pointing to a player for a specific video. In general, this is the information in the ```src``` element of an ```embed``` tag and should not be the same as the content of the ```loc``` tag.

domainIncludes.label: encodesCreativeWork
domainIncludes.comment: The CreativeWork encoded by this media object.

domainIncludes.label: encodingFormat
domainIncludes.comment:
Media type typically expressed using a MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml) and [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types)) e.g. application/zip for a SoftwareApplication binary, audio/mpeg for .mp3 etc.).

In cases where a [[CreativeWork]] has several media type representations, [[encoding]] can be used to indicate each [[MediaObject]] alongside particular [[encodingFormat]] information.

Unregistered or niche encoding and file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia/Wikidata entry.

domainIncludes.label: endTime
domainIncludes.comment: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the end of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

domainIncludes.label: height
domainIncludes.comment: The height of the item.

domainIncludes.label: playerType
domainIncludes.comment: Player type required—for example, Flash or Silverlight.

domainIncludes.label: productionCompany
domainIncludes.comment: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

domainIncludes.label: requiresSubscription
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates if use of the media require a subscription  (either paid or free). Allowed values are ```true``` or ```false``` (note that an earlier version had 'yes', 'no').

domainIncludes.label: startTime
domainIncludes.comment: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the start of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

domainIncludes.label: uploadDate
domainIncludes.comment: Date when this media object was uploaded to this site.

domainIncludes.label: width
domainIncludes.comment: The width of the item.

domainIncludes.label: regionsAllowed
domainIncludes.comment: The regions where the media is allowed. If not specified, then it's assumed to be allowed everywhere. Specify the countries in [ISO 3166 format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166).

rangeIncludes.label: associatedMedia
rangeIncludes.comment: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.

rangeIncludes.label: caption
rangeIncludes.comment: The caption for this object. For downloadable machine formats (closed caption, subtitles etc.) use MediaObject and indicate the [[encodingFormat]].

rangeIncludes.label: encoding
rangeIncludes.comment: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia.

rangeIncludes.label: encodings
rangeIncludes.comment: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork.

rangeIncludes.label: afterMedia
rangeIncludes.comment: A media object representing the circumstances after performing this direction.

rangeIncludes.label: beforeMedia
rangeIncludes.comment: A media object representing the circumstances before performing this direction.

rangeIncludes.label: duringMedia
rangeIncludes.comment: A media object representing the circumstances while performing this direction.

domainIncludes.label: caption
domainIncludes.comment: The caption for this object. For downloadable machine formats (closed caption, subtitles etc.) use MediaObject and indicate the [[encodingFormat]].

domainIncludes.label: transcript
domainIncludes.comment: If this MediaObject is an AudioObject or VideoObject, the transcript of that object.

rangeIncludes.label: audio
rangeIncludes.comment: An embedded audio object.

domainIncludes.label: acceptsReservations
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates whether a FoodEstablishment accepts reservations. Values can be Boolean, an URL at which reservations can be made or (for backwards compatibility) the strings ```Yes``` or ```No```.

domainIncludes.label: hasMenu
domainIncludes.comment: Either the actual menu as a structured representation, as text, or a URL of the menu.

domainIncludes.label: menu
domainIncludes.comment: Either the actual menu as a structured representation, as text, or a URL of the menu.

domainIncludes.label: servesCuisine
domainIncludes.comment: The cuisine of the restaurant.

domainIncludes.label: starRating
domainIncludes.comment: An official rating for a lodging business or food establishment, e.g. from national associations or standards bodies. Use the author property to indicate the rating organization, e.g. as an Organization with name such as (e.g. HOTREC, DEHOGA, WHR, or Hotelstars).

Barcode.comment: An image of a visual machine-readable code such as a barcode or QR code.

LodgingBusiness.comment: A lodging business, such as a motel, hotel, or inn.

domainIncludes.label: audience
domainIncludes.comment: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

domainIncludes.label: availableLanguage
domainIncludes.comment: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]]

domainIncludes.label: checkinTime
domainIncludes.comment: The earliest someone may check into a lodging establishment.

domainIncludes.label: checkoutTime
domainIncludes.comment: The latest someone may check out of a lodging establishment.

domainIncludes.label: amenityFeature
domainIncludes.comment: An amenity feature (e.g. a characteristic or service) of the Accommodation. This generic property does not make a statement about whether the feature is included in an offer for the main accommodation or available at extra costs.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfRooms
domainIncludes.comment:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

domainIncludes.label: petsAllowed
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates whether pets are allowed to enter the accommodation or lodging business. More detailed information can be put in a text value.

domainIncludes.label: starRating
domainIncludes.comment: An official rating for a lodging business or food establishment, e.g. from national associations or standards bodies. Use the author property to indicate the rating organization, e.g. as an Organization with name such as (e.g. HOTREC, DEHOGA, WHR, or Hotelstars).

BedAndBreakfast.comment:
Bed and breakfast.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

domainIncludes.label: blogPost
domainIncludes.comment: A posting that is part of this blog.

domainIncludes.label: blogPosts
domainIncludes.comment: The postings that are part of this blog.

domainIncludes.label: issn
domainIncludes.comment: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

rangeIncludes.label: blogPost
rangeIncludes.comment: A posting that is part of this blog.

rangeIncludes.label: blogPosts
rangeIncludes.comment: The postings that are part of this blog.

rangeIncludes.label: liveBlogUpdate
rangeIncludes.comment: An update to the LiveBlog.

Landform.comment: A landform or physical feature.  Landform elements include mountains, plains, lakes, rivers, seascape and oceanic waterbody interface features such as bays, peninsulas, seas and so forth, including sub-aqueous terrain features such as submersed mountain ranges, volcanoes, and the great ocean basins.

BodyOfWater.comment: A body of water, such as a sea, ocean, or lake.

domainIncludes.label: bookEdition
domainIncludes.comment: The edition of the book.

domainIncludes.label: bookFormat
domainIncludes.comment: The format of the book.

domainIncludes.label: illustrator
domainIncludes.comment: The illustrator of the book.

domainIncludes.label: isbn
domainIncludes.comment: The ISBN of the book.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfPages
domainIncludes.comment: The number of pages in the book.

BookFormatType.comment: The publication format of the book.

rangeIncludes.label: bookFormat
rangeIncludes.comment: The format of the book.

DataType.comment: The basic data types such as Integers, Strings, etc.

SportsActivityLocation.comment: A sports location, such as a playing field.

rangeIncludes.label: sportsActivityLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The sports activity location where this action occurred.

PlaceOfWorship.comment: Place of worship, such as a church, synagogue, or mosque.

rangeIncludes.label: departureBusStop
rangeIncludes.comment: The stop or station from which the bus departs.

rangeIncludes.label: arrivalBusStop
rangeIncludes.comment: The stop or station from which the bus arrives.

rangeIncludes.label: departureBusStop
rangeIncludes.comment: The stop or station from which the bus departs.

rangeIncludes.label: arrivalBusStop
rangeIncludes.comment: The stop or station from which the bus arrives.

Event.comment: An event happening at a certain time and location, such as a concert, lecture, or festival. Ticketing information may be added via the [[offers]] property. Repeated events may be structured as separate Event objects.

domainIncludes.label: about
domainIncludes.comment: The subject matter of the content.

domainIncludes.label: actor
domainIncludes.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: aggregateRating
domainIncludes.comment: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

domainIncludes.label: organizer
domainIncludes.comment: An organizer of an Event.

domainIncludes.label: attendee
domainIncludes.comment: A person or organization attending the event.

domainIncludes.label: attendees
domainIncludes.comment: A person attending the event.

domainIncludes.label: audience
domainIncludes.comment: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

domainIncludes.label: contributor
domainIncludes.comment: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

domainIncludes.label: director
domainIncludes.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: doorTime
domainIncludes.comment: The time admission will commence.

domainIncludes.label: duration
domainIncludes.comment: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

domainIncludes.label: endDate
domainIncludes.comment: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

domainIncludes.label: eventStatus
domainIncludes.comment: An eventStatus of an event represents its status; particularly useful when an event is cancelled or rescheduled.

domainIncludes.label: isAccessibleForFree
domainIncludes.comment: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

domainIncludes.label: inLanguage
domainIncludes.comment: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

domainIncludes.label: location
domainIncludes.comment: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

domainIncludes.label: maximumAttendeeCapacity
domainIncludes.comment: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.

domainIncludes.label: remainingAttendeeCapacity
domainIncludes.comment: The number of attendee places for an event that remain unallocated.

domainIncludes.label: offers
domainIncludes.comment: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

domainIncludes.label: performer
domainIncludes.comment: A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor.

domainIncludes.label: performers
domainIncludes.comment: The main performer or performers of the event—for example, a presenter, musician, or actor.

domainIncludes.label: previousStartDate
domainIncludes.comment: Used in conjunction with eventStatus for rescheduled or cancelled events. This property contains the previously scheduled start date. For rescheduled events, the startDate property should be used for the newly scheduled start date. In the (rare) case of an event that has been postponed and rescheduled multiple times, this field may be repeated.

domainIncludes.label: recordedIn
domainIncludes.comment: The CreativeWork that captured all or part of this Event.

domainIncludes.label: review
domainIncludes.comment: A review of the item.

domainIncludes.label: sponsor
domainIncludes.comment: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

domainIncludes.label: funder
domainIncludes.comment: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

domainIncludes.label: startDate
domainIncludes.comment: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

domainIncludes.label: subEvent
domainIncludes.comment: An Event that is part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each of which is a subEvent of the conference.

domainIncludes.label: subEvents
domainIncludes.comment: Events that are a part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each subEvents of the conference.

domainIncludes.label: superEvent
domainIncludes.comment: An event that this event is a part of. For example, a collection of individual music performances might each have a music festival as their superEvent.

domainIncludes.label: typicalAgeRange
domainIncludes.comment: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

domainIncludes.label: workPerformed
domainIncludes.comment: A work performed in some event, for example a play performed in a TheaterEvent.

domainIncludes.label: workFeatured
domainIncludes.comment:
A work featured in some event, e.g. exhibited in an ExhibitionEvent.
       Specific subproperties are available for workPerformed (e.g. a play), or a workPresented (a Movie at a ScreeningEvent).

domainIncludes.label: translator
domainIncludes.comment: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

domainIncludes.label: composer
domainIncludes.comment: The person or organization who wrote a composition, or who is the composer of a work performed at some event.

rangeIncludes.label: event
rangeIncludes.comment: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

rangeIncludes.label: events
rangeIncludes.comment: Upcoming or past events associated with this place or organization.

rangeIncludes.label: performerIn
rangeIncludes.comment: Event that this person is a performer or participant in.

rangeIncludes.label: recordedAt
rangeIncludes.comment: The Event where the CreativeWork was recorded. The CreativeWork may capture all or part of the event.

rangeIncludes.label: subEvent
rangeIncludes.comment: An Event that is part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each of which is a subEvent of the conference.

rangeIncludes.label: subEvents
rangeIncludes.comment: Events that are a part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each subEvents of the conference.

rangeIncludes.label: superEvent
rangeIncludes.comment: An event that this event is a part of. For example, a collection of individual music performances might each have a music festival as their superEvent.

rangeIncludes.label: firstPerformance
rangeIncludes.comment: The date and place the work was first performed.

rangeIncludes.label: broadcastOfEvent
rangeIncludes.comment: The event being broadcast such as a sporting event or awards ceremony.

rangeIncludes.label: subjectOf
rangeIncludes.comment: A CreativeWork or Event about this Thing..

Campground.comment:
A camping site, campsite, or [[Campground]] is a place used for overnight stay in the outdoors, typically containing individual [[CampingPitch]] locations. \n\n
In British English a campsite is an area, usually divided into a number of pitches, where people can camp overnight using tents or camper vans or caravans; this British English use of the word is synonymous with the American English expression campground. In American English the term campsite generally means an area where an individual, family, group, or military unit can pitch a tent or park a camper; a campground may contain many campsites (Source: Wikipedia see [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campsite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campsite)).\n\n

See also the dedicated [document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations](/docs/hotels.html).

Canal.comment: A canal, like the Panama Canal.

domainIncludes.label: alumni
domainIncludes.comment: Alumni of an organization.

domainIncludes.label: alumni
domainIncludes.comment: Alumni of an organization.

rangeIncludes.label: alumniOf
rangeIncludes.comment: An organization that the person is an alumni of.

rangeIncludes.label: alumniOf
rangeIncludes.comment: An organization that the person is an alumni of.

CollegeOrUniversity.comment: A college, university, or other third-level educational institution.

Comment.comment: A comment on an item - for example, a comment on a blog post. The comment's content is expressed via the [[text]] property, and its topic via [[about]], properties shared with all CreativeWorks.

domainIncludes.label: upvoteCount
domainIncludes.comment: The number of upvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

domainIncludes.label: downvoteCount
domainIncludes.comment: The number of downvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

domainIncludes.label: parentItem
domainIncludes.comment: The parent of a question, answer or item in general.

rangeIncludes.label: comment
rangeIncludes.comment: Comments, typically from users.

rangeIncludes.label: resultComment
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of result. The Comment created or sent as a result of this action.

StructuredValue.comment: Structured values are used when the value of a property has a more complex structure than simply being a textual value or a reference to another thing.

rangeIncludes.label: value
rangeIncludes.comment:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

rangeIncludes.label: valueReference
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.

ContactPoint.comment: A contact point—for example, a Customer Complaints department.

domainIncludes.label: areaServed
domainIncludes.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

domainIncludes.label: availableLanguage
domainIncludes.comment: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]]

domainIncludes.label: contactOption
domainIncludes.comment: An option available on this contact point (e.g. a toll-free number or support for hearing-impaired callers).

domainIncludes.label: contactType
domainIncludes.comment: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

domainIncludes.label: email
domainIncludes.comment: Email address.

domainIncludes.label: faxNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The fax number.

domainIncludes.label: hoursAvailable
domainIncludes.comment: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

domainIncludes.label: productSupported
domainIncludes.comment: The product or service this support contact point is related to (such as product support for a particular product line). This can be a specific product or product line (e.g. "iPhone") or a general category of products or services (e.g. "smartphones").

domainIncludes.label: serviceArea
domainIncludes.comment: The geographic area where the service is provided.

domainIncludes.label: telephone
domainIncludes.comment: The telephone number.

rangeIncludes.label: bccRecipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of recipient. The recipient blind copied on a message.

rangeIncludes.label: ccRecipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of recipient. The recipient copied on a message.

rangeIncludes.label: contactPoint
rangeIncludes.comment: A contact point for a person or organization.

rangeIncludes.label: contactPoints
rangeIncludes.comment: A contact point for a person or organization.

rangeIncludes.label: homeLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: A contact location for a person's residence.

rangeIncludes.label: recipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

rangeIncludes.label: servicePhone
rangeIncludes.comment: The phone number to use to access the service.

rangeIncludes.label: serviceSmsNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The number to access the service by text message.

rangeIncludes.label: toRecipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of recipient. The recipient who was directly sent the message.

rangeIncludes.label: workLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: A contact location for a person's place of work.

rangeIncludes.label: grantee
rangeIncludes.comment: The person, organization, contact point, or audience that has been granted this permission.

Continent.comment: One of the continents (for example, Europe or Africa).

domainIncludes.label: tickerSymbol
domainIncludes.comment: The exchange traded instrument associated with a Corporation object. The tickerSymbol is expressed as an exchange and an instrument name separated by a space character. For the exchange component of the tickerSymbol attribute, we recommend using the controlled vocabulary of Market Identifier Codes (MIC) specified in ISO15022.

rangeIncludes.label: addressCountry
rangeIncludes.comment: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

rangeIncludes.label: countryOfOrigin
rangeIncludes.comment: The country of the principal offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie or program.

rangeIncludes.label: nationality
rangeIncludes.comment: Nationality of the person.

PerformingGroup.comment: A performance group, such as a band, an orchestra, or a circus.

DanceGroup.comment: A dance group—for example, the Alvin Ailey Dance Theater or Riverdance.

DefenceEstablishment.comment: A defence establishment, such as an army or navy base.

Quantity.comment: Quantities such as distance, time, mass, weight, etc. Particular instances of say Mass are entities like '3 Kg' or '4 milligrams'.

Distance.comment: Properties that take Distances as values are of the form '<Number> <Length unit of measure>'. E.g., '7 ft'.

rangeIncludes.label: geoRadius
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates the approximate radius of a GeoCircle (metres unless indicated otherwise via Distance notation).

rangeIncludes.label: depth
rangeIncludes.comment: The depth of the item.

rangeIncludes.label: distance
rangeIncludes.comment: The distance travelled, e.g. exercising or travelling.

rangeIncludes.label: height
rangeIncludes.comment: The height of the item.

rangeIncludes.label: width
rangeIncludes.comment: The width of the item.

rangeIncludes.label: flightDistance
rangeIncludes.comment: The distance of the flight.

rangeIncludes.label: duration
rangeIncludes.comment: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

rangeIncludes.label: processingTime
rangeIncludes.comment: Estimated processing time for the service using this channel.

rangeIncludes.label: timeRequired
rangeIncludes.comment: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. 'PT30M', 'PT1H25M'.

rangeIncludes.label: validFor
rangeIncludes.comment: The duration of validity of a permit or similar thing.

rangeIncludes.label: estimatedFlightDuration
rangeIncludes.comment: The estimated time the flight will take.

rangeIncludes.label: billingPeriod
rangeIncludes.comment: The time interval used to compute the invoice.

rangeIncludes.label: cookTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The time it takes to actually cook the dish, in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

rangeIncludes.label: performTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The length of time it takes to perform instructions or a direction (not including time to prepare the supplies), in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

rangeIncludes.label: prepTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The length of time it takes to prepare the items to be used in instructions or a direction, in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

rangeIncludes.label: totalTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The total time required to perform instructions or a direction (including time to prepare the supplies), in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

HomeAndConstructionBusiness.comment:
A construction business.

A HomeAndConstructionBusiness is a [[LocalBusiness]] that provides services around homes and buildings.

As a [[LocalBusiness]] it can be described as a [[provider]] of one or more [[Service]]\(s).

EmergencyService.comment: An emergency service, such as a fire station or ER.

Energy.comment: Properties that take Energy as values are of the form '<Number> <Energy unit of measure>'.

rangeIncludes.label: calories
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of calories.

rangeIncludes.label: foodEvent
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The specific food event where the action occurred.

GeoCoordinates.comment: The geographic coordinates of a place or event.

domainIncludes.label: address
domainIncludes.comment: Physical address of the item.

domainIncludes.label: addressCountry
domainIncludes.comment: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

domainIncludes.label: elevation
domainIncludes.comment: The elevation of a location ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)). Values may be of the form 'NUMBER UNIT_OF_MEASUREMENT' (e.g., '1,000 m', '3,200 ft') while numbers alone should be assumed to be a value in meters.

domainIncludes.label: latitude
domainIncludes.comment: The latitude of a location. For example ```37.42242``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

domainIncludes.label: longitude
domainIncludes.comment: The longitude of a location. For example ```-122.08585``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

domainIncludes.label: postalCode
domainIncludes.comment: The postal code. For example, 94043.

rangeIncludes.label: geoMidpoint
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates the GeoCoordinates at the centre of a GeoShape e.g. GeoCircle.

rangeIncludes.label: geo
rangeIncludes.comment: The geo coordinates of the place.

GeoShape.comment: The geographic shape of a place. A GeoShape can be described using several properties whose values are based on latitude/longitude pairs. Either whitespace or commas can be used to separate latitude and longitude; whitespace should be used when writing a list of several such points.

domainIncludes.label: geoMidpoint
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates the GeoCoordinates at the centre of a GeoShape e.g. GeoCircle.

domainIncludes.label: address
domainIncludes.comment: Physical address of the item.

domainIncludes.label: addressCountry
domainIncludes.comment: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

domainIncludes.label: box
domainIncludes.comment: A box is the area enclosed by the rectangle formed by two points. The first point is the lower corner, the second point is the upper corner. A box is expressed as two points separated by a space character.

domainIncludes.label: circle
domainIncludes.comment: A circle is the circular region of a specified radius centered at a specified latitude and longitude. A circle is expressed as a pair followed by a radius in meters.

domainIncludes.label: elevation
domainIncludes.comment: The elevation of a location ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)). Values may be of the form 'NUMBER UNIT_OF_MEASUREMENT' (e.g., '1,000 m', '3,200 ft') while numbers alone should be assumed to be a value in meters.

domainIncludes.label: line
domainIncludes.comment: A line is a point-to-point path consisting of two or more points. A line is expressed as a series of two or more point objects separated by space.

domainIncludes.label: polygon
domainIncludes.comment: A polygon is the area enclosed by a point-to-point path for which the starting and ending points are the same. A polygon is expressed as a series of four or more space delimited points where the first and final points are identical.

domainIncludes.label: postalCode
domainIncludes.comment: The postal code. For example, 94043.

rangeIncludes.label: areaServed
rangeIncludes.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

rangeIncludes.label: eligibleRegion
rangeIncludes.comment: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.\n\nSee also [[ineligibleRegion]].

rangeIncludes.label: ineligibleRegion
rangeIncludes.comment: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

rangeIncludes.label: geo
rangeIncludes.comment: The geo coordinates of the place.

rangeIncludes.label: serviceArea
rangeIncludes.comment: The geographic area where the service is provided.

GeoCircle.comment:
A GeoCircle is a GeoShape representing a circular geographic area. As it is a GeoShape
          it provides the simple textual property 'circle', but also allows the combination of postalCode alongside geoRadius.
          The center of the circle can be indicated via the 'geoMidpoint' property, or more approximately using 'address', 'postalCode'.

domainIncludes.label: geoRadius
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates the approximate radius of a GeoCircle (metres unless indicated otherwise via Distance notation).

rangeIncludes.label: geoRadius
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates the approximate radius of a GeoCircle (metres unless indicated otherwise via Distance notation).

rangeIncludes.label: touristType
rangeIncludes.comment: Attraction suitable for type(s) of tourist. eg. Children, visitors from a particular country, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: orderItemNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The identifier of the order item.

rangeIncludes.label: schemaVersion
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates (by URL or string) a particular version of a schema used in some CreativeWork. For example, a document could declare a schemaVersion using an URL such as version/2.0/ if precise indication of schema version was required by some application.

rangeIncludes.label: acceptsReservations
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates whether a FoodEstablishment accepts reservations. Values can be Boolean, an URL at which reservations can be made or (for backwards compatibility) the strings ```Yes``` or ```No```.

rangeIncludes.label: accessCode
rangeIncludes.comment: Password, PIN, or access code needed for delivery (e.g. from a locker).

rangeIncludes.label: accessibilityAPI
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

rangeIncludes.label: accessibilityControl
rangeIncludes.comment: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

rangeIncludes.label: accessibilityFeature
rangeIncludes.comment: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

rangeIncludes.label: accessibilityHazard
rangeIncludes.comment: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3 ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

rangeIncludes.label: additionalName
rangeIncludes.comment: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.

rangeIncludes.label: address
rangeIncludes.comment: Physical address of the item.

rangeIncludes.label: addressCountry
rangeIncludes.comment: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

rangeIncludes.label: addressLocality
rangeIncludes.comment: The locality. For example, Mountain View.

rangeIncludes.label: addressRegion
rangeIncludes.comment: The region. For example, CA.

rangeIncludes.label: alignmentType
rangeIncludes.comment: A category of alignment between the learning resource and the framework node. Recommended values include: 'assesses', 'teaches', 'requires', 'textComplexity', 'readingLevel', 'educationalSubject', and 'educationalLevel'.

rangeIncludes.label: alternateName
rangeIncludes.comment: An alias for the item.

rangeIncludes.label: alternativeHeadline
rangeIncludes.comment: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.

rangeIncludes.label: applicationCategory
rangeIncludes.comment: Type of software application, e.g. 'Game, Multimedia'.

rangeIncludes.label: applicationSubCategory
rangeIncludes.comment: Subcategory of the application, e.g. 'Arcade Game'.

rangeIncludes.label: applicationSuite
rangeIncludes.comment: The name of the application suite to which the application belongs (e.g. Excel belongs to Office).

rangeIncludes.label: areaServed
rangeIncludes.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

rangeIncludes.label: articleBody
rangeIncludes.comment: The actual body of the article.

rangeIncludes.label: articleSection
rangeIncludes.comment: Articles may belong to one or more 'sections' in a magazine or newspaper, such as Sports, Lifestyle, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: assembly
rangeIncludes.comment: Library file name e.g., mscorlib.dll, system.web.dll.

rangeIncludes.label: executableLibraryName
rangeIncludes.comment: Library file name e.g., mscorlib.dll, system.web.dll.

rangeIncludes.label: assemblyVersion
rangeIncludes.comment: Associated product/technology version. e.g., .NET Framework 4.5.

rangeIncludes.label: audienceType
rangeIncludes.comment: The target group associated with a given audience (e.g. veterans, car owners, musicians, etc.).

rangeIncludes.label: availableLanguage
rangeIncludes.comment: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]]

rangeIncludes.label: award
rangeIncludes.comment: An award won by or for this item.

rangeIncludes.label: awards
rangeIncludes.comment: Awards won by or for this item.

rangeIncludes.label: benefits
rangeIncludes.comment: Description of benefits associated with the job.

rangeIncludes.label: jobBenefits
rangeIncludes.comment: Description of benefits associated with the job.

rangeIncludes.label: bestRating
rangeIncludes.comment: The highest value allowed in this rating system. If bestRating is omitted, 5 is assumed.

rangeIncludes.label: bitrate
rangeIncludes.comment: The bitrate of the media object.

rangeIncludes.label: bookEdition
rangeIncludes.comment: The edition of the book.

rangeIncludes.label: box
rangeIncludes.comment: A box is the area enclosed by the rectangle formed by two points. The first point is the lower corner, the second point is the upper corner. A box is expressed as two points separated by a space character.

rangeIncludes.label: branchCode
rangeIncludes.comment: A short textual code (also called "store code") that uniquely identifies a place of business. The code is typically assigned by the parentOrganization and used in structured URLs.\n\nFor example, in the URL http://www.starbucks.co.uk/store-locator/etc/detail/3047 the code "3047" is a branchCode for a particular branch.

rangeIncludes.label: breadcrumb
rangeIncludes.comment: A set of links that can help a user understand and navigate a website hierarchy.

rangeIncludes.label: browserRequirements
rangeIncludes.comment: Specifies browser requirements in human-readable text. For example, 'requires HTML5 support'.

rangeIncludes.label: caption
rangeIncludes.comment: The caption for this object. For downloadable machine formats (closed caption, subtitles etc.) use MediaObject and indicate the [[encodingFormat]].

rangeIncludes.label: carrierRequirements
rangeIncludes.comment: Specifies specific carrier(s) requirements for the application (e.g. an application may only work on a specific carrier network).

rangeIncludes.label: category
rangeIncludes.comment: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

rangeIncludes.label: circle
rangeIncludes.comment: A circle is the circular region of a specified radius centered at a specified latitude and longitude. A circle is expressed as a pair followed by a radius in meters.

rangeIncludes.label: citation
rangeIncludes.comment: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: clipNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: Position of the clip within an ordered group of clips.

rangeIncludes.label: color
rangeIncludes.comment: The color of the product.

rangeIncludes.label: commentText
rangeIncludes.comment: The text of the UserComment.

rangeIncludes.label: confirmationNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: A number that confirms the given order or payment has been received.

rangeIncludes.label: contactType
rangeIncludes.comment: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

rangeIncludes.label: contentRating
rangeIncludes.comment: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.

rangeIncludes.label: contentSize
rangeIncludes.comment: File size in (mega/kilo) bytes.

rangeIncludes.label: countriesNotSupported
rangeIncludes.comment: Countries for which the application is not supported. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

rangeIncludes.label: countriesSupported
rangeIncludes.comment: Countries for which the application is supported. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

rangeIncludes.label: currenciesAccepted
rangeIncludes.comment: The currency accepted.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

rangeIncludes.label: dateline
rangeIncludes.comment:
A [dateline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dateline) is a brief piece of text included in news articles that describes where and when the story was written or filed though the date is often omitted. Sometimes only a placename is provided.

Structured representations of dateline-related information can also be expressed more explicitly using [[locationCreated]] (which represents where a work was created e.g. where a news report was written).  For location depicted or described in the content, use [[contentLocation]].

Dateline summaries are oriented more towards human readers than towards automated processing, and can vary substantially. Some examples: "BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 2.", "Paris, France", "December 19, 2017 11:43AM Reporting from Washington", "Beijing/Moscow", "QUEZON CITY, Philippines".

rangeIncludes.label: dependencies
rangeIncludes.comment: Prerequisites needed to fulfill steps in article.

rangeIncludes.label: description
rangeIncludes.comment: A description of the item.

rangeIncludes.label: device
rangeIncludes.comment: Device required to run the application. Used in cases where a specific make/model is required to run the application.

rangeIncludes.label: availableOnDevice
rangeIncludes.comment: Device required to run the application. Used in cases where a specific make/model is required to run the application.

rangeIncludes.label: disambiguatingDescription
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.

rangeIncludes.label: discount
rangeIncludes.comment: Any discount applied (to an Order).

rangeIncludes.label: discountCode
rangeIncludes.comment: Code used to redeem a discount.

rangeIncludes.label: discountCurrency
rangeIncludes.comment: The currency of the discount.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

rangeIncludes.label: duns
rangeIncludes.comment: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

rangeIncludes.label: educationalFramework
rangeIncludes.comment: The framework to which the resource being described is aligned.

rangeIncludes.label: educationalRole
rangeIncludes.comment: An educationalRole of an EducationalAudience.

rangeIncludes.label: educationalUse
rangeIncludes.comment: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

rangeIncludes.label: elevation
rangeIncludes.comment: The elevation of a location ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)). Values may be of the form 'NUMBER UNIT_OF_MEASUREMENT' (e.g., '1,000 m', '3,200 ft') while numbers alone should be assumed to be a value in meters.

rangeIncludes.label: eligibleRegion
rangeIncludes.comment: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.\n\nSee also [[ineligibleRegion]].

rangeIncludes.label: ineligibleRegion
rangeIncludes.comment: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

rangeIncludes.label: email
rangeIncludes.comment: Email address.

rangeIncludes.label: employmentType
rangeIncludes.comment: Type of employment (e.g. full-time, part-time, contract, temporary, seasonal, internship).

rangeIncludes.label: encodingFormat
rangeIncludes.comment:
Media type typically expressed using a MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml) and [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types)) e.g. application/zip for a SoftwareApplication binary, audio/mpeg for .mp3 etc.).

In cases where a [[CreativeWork]] has several media type representations, [[encoding]] can be used to indicate each [[MediaObject]] alongside particular [[encodingFormat]] information.

Unregistered or niche encoding and file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia/Wikidata entry.

rangeIncludes.label: episodeNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: Position of the episode within an ordered group of episodes.

rangeIncludes.label: exifData
rangeIncludes.comment: exif data for this object.

rangeIncludes.label: familyName
rangeIncludes.comment: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.

rangeIncludes.label: faxNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The fax number.

rangeIncludes.label: featureList
rangeIncludes.comment: Features or modules provided by this application (and possibly required by other applications).

rangeIncludes.label: fileFormat
rangeIncludes.comment: Media type, typically MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml)) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.

rangeIncludes.label: fileSize
rangeIncludes.comment: Size of the application / package (e.g. 18MB). In the absence of a unit (MB, KB etc.), KB will be assumed.

rangeIncludes.label: gender
rangeIncludes.comment: Gender of the person. While Male and Female may be used, text strings are also acceptable for people who do not identify as a binary gender.

rangeIncludes.label: genre
rangeIncludes.comment: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

rangeIncludes.label: givenName
rangeIncludes.comment: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.

rangeIncludes.label: globalLocationNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The [Global Location Number](http://www.gs1.org/gln) (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

rangeIncludes.label: gtin12
rangeIncludes.comment: The GTIN-12 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

rangeIncludes.label: gtin13
rangeIncludes.comment: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

rangeIncludes.label: gtin14
rangeIncludes.comment: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

rangeIncludes.label: gtin8
rangeIncludes.comment: The [GTIN-8](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-8.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

rangeIncludes.label: headline
rangeIncludes.comment: Headline of the article.

rangeIncludes.label: highPrice
rangeIncludes.comment:
The highest price of all offers available.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

rangeIncludes.label: honorificPrefix
rangeIncludes.comment: An honorific prefix preceding a Person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.

rangeIncludes.label: honorificSuffix
rangeIncludes.comment: An honorific suffix preceding a Person's name such as M.D. /PhD/MSCSW.

rangeIncludes.label: incentives
rangeIncludes.comment: Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job.

rangeIncludes.label: incentiveCompensation
rangeIncludes.comment: Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job.

rangeIncludes.label: industry
rangeIncludes.comment: The industry associated with the job position.

rangeIncludes.label: inLanguage
rangeIncludes.comment: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

rangeIncludes.label: interactivityType
rangeIncludes.comment: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

rangeIncludes.label: isbn
rangeIncludes.comment: The ISBN of the book.

rangeIncludes.label: isicV4
rangeIncludes.comment: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

rangeIncludes.label: itemListOrder
rangeIncludes.comment: Type of ordering (e.g. Ascending, Descending, Unordered).

rangeIncludes.label: jobTitle
rangeIncludes.comment: The job title of the person (for example, Financial Manager).

rangeIncludes.label: keywords
rangeIncludes.comment: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

rangeIncludes.label: latitude
rangeIncludes.comment: The latitude of a location. For example ```37.42242``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

rangeIncludes.label: learningResourceType
rangeIncludes.comment: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

rangeIncludes.label: legalName
rangeIncludes.comment: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

rangeIncludes.label: line
rangeIncludes.comment: A line is a point-to-point path consisting of two or more points. A line is expressed as a series of two or more point objects separated by space.

rangeIncludes.label: location
rangeIncludes.comment: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

rangeIncludes.label: longitude
rangeIncludes.comment: The longitude of a location. For example ```-122.08585``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

rangeIncludes.label: lowPrice
rangeIncludes.comment:
The lowest price of all offers available.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

rangeIncludes.label: memoryRequirements
rangeIncludes.comment: Minimum memory requirements.

rangeIncludes.label: hasMenu
rangeIncludes.comment: Either the actual menu as a structured representation, as text, or a URL of the menu.

rangeIncludes.label: menu
rangeIncludes.comment: Either the actual menu as a structured representation, as text, or a URL of the menu.

rangeIncludes.label: model
rangeIncludes.comment: The model of the product. Use with the URL of a ProductModel or a textual representation of the model identifier. The URL of the ProductModel can be from an external source. It is recommended to additionally provide strong product identifiers via the gtin8/gtin13/gtin14 and mpn properties.

rangeIncludes.label: mpn
rangeIncludes.comment: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

rangeIncludes.label: naics
rangeIncludes.comment: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

rangeIncludes.label: name
rangeIncludes.comment: The name of the item.

rangeIncludes.label: occupationalCategory
rangeIncludes.comment: Category or categories describing the job. Use BLS O*NET-SOC taxonomy: http://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy.html. Ideally includes textual label and formal code, with the property repeated for each applicable value.

rangeIncludes.label: openingHours
rangeIncludes.comment: The general opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'. * Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: ```Mo```, ```Tu```, ```We```, ```Th```, ```Fr```, ```Sa```, ```Su```. * Times are specified using 24:00 time. For example, 3pm is specified as ```15:00```. * Here is an example: <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</time>. * If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</time>.

rangeIncludes.label: operatingSystem
rangeIncludes.comment: Operating systems supported (Windows 7, OSX 10.6, Android 1.6).

rangeIncludes.label: option
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The options subject to this action.

rangeIncludes.label: actionOption
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The options subject to this action.

rangeIncludes.label: orderNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The identifier of the transaction.

rangeIncludes.label: paymentAccepted
rangeIncludes.comment: Cash, Credit Card, Cryptocurrency, Local Exchange Tradings System, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: paymentMethodId
rangeIncludes.comment: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

rangeIncludes.label: permissions
rangeIncludes.comment: Permission(s) required to run the app (for example, a mobile app may require full internet access or may run only on wifi).

rangeIncludes.label: playerType
rangeIncludes.comment: Player type required—for example, Flash or Silverlight.

rangeIncludes.label: polygon
rangeIncludes.comment: A polygon is the area enclosed by a point-to-point path for which the starting and ending points are the same. A polygon is expressed as a series of four or more space delimited points where the first and final points are identical.

rangeIncludes.label: position
rangeIncludes.comment: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

rangeIncludes.label: postalCode
rangeIncludes.comment: The postal code. For example, 94043.

rangeIncludes.label: postOfficeBoxNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The post office box number for PO box addresses.

rangeIncludes.label: price
rangeIncludes.comment:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

* Use the [[priceCurrency]] property (with standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR") instead of including [ambiguous symbols](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollar_sign#Currencies_that_use_the_dollar_or_peso_sign) such as '$' in the value.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
* Note that both [RDFa](http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-rdfa-primer/#using-the-content-attribute) and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

rangeIncludes.label: priceRange
rangeIncludes.comment: The price range of the business, for example ```$$$```.

rangeIncludes.label: priceType
rangeIncludes.comment: A short text or acronym indicating multiple price specifications for the same offer, e.g. SRP for the suggested retail price or INVOICE for the invoice price, mostly used in the car industry.

rangeIncludes.label: printColumn
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of the column in which the NewsArticle appears in the print edition.

rangeIncludes.label: printEdition
rangeIncludes.comment: The edition of the print product in which the NewsArticle appears.

rangeIncludes.label: printPage
rangeIncludes.comment: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the name of the page on which the article is found. Please note that this field is intended for the exact page name (e.g. A5, B18).

rangeIncludes.label: printSection
rangeIncludes.comment: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the print section in which the article appeared.

rangeIncludes.label: processorRequirements
rangeIncludes.comment: Processor architecture required to run the application (e.g. IA64).

rangeIncludes.label: productID
rangeIncludes.comment: The product identifier, such as ISBN. For example: ``` meta itemprop="productID" content="isbn:123-456-789" ```.

rangeIncludes.label: productSupported
rangeIncludes.comment: The product or service this support contact point is related to (such as product support for a particular product line). This can be a specific product or product line (e.g. "iPhone") or a general category of products or services (e.g. "smartphones").

rangeIncludes.label: proficiencyLevel
rangeIncludes.comment: Proficiency needed for this content; expected values: 'Beginner', 'Expert'.

rangeIncludes.label: programmingLanguage
rangeIncludes.comment: The computer programming language.

rangeIncludes.label: programmingModel
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates whether API is managed or unmanaged.

rangeIncludes.label: query
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. The query used on this action.

rangeIncludes.label: ratingValue
rangeIncludes.comment:
The rating for the content.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

rangeIncludes.label: releaseNotes
rangeIncludes.comment: Description of what changed in this version.

rangeIncludes.label: requiredGender
rangeIncludes.comment: Audiences defined by a person's gender.

rangeIncludes.label: requirements
rangeIncludes.comment: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

rangeIncludes.label: softwareRequirements
rangeIncludes.comment: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

rangeIncludes.label: reviewBody
rangeIncludes.comment: The actual body of the review.

rangeIncludes.label: runtime
rangeIncludes.comment: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (Example - Java v1, Python2.3, .Net Framework 3.0).

rangeIncludes.label: runtimePlatform
rangeIncludes.comment: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (Example - Java v1, Python2.3, .Net Framework 3.0).

rangeIncludes.label: salaryCurrency
rangeIncludes.comment: The currency (coded using [ISO 4217](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) ) used for the main salary information in this job posting or for this employee.

rangeIncludes.label: sampleType
rangeIncludes.comment: What type of code sample: full (compile ready) solution, code snippet, inline code, scripts, template.

rangeIncludes.label: codeSampleType
rangeIncludes.comment: What type of code sample: full (compile ready) solution, code snippet, inline code, scripts, template.

rangeIncludes.label: slogan
rangeIncludes.comment: A slogan or motto associated with the item.

rangeIncludes.label: videoFormat
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of screening or video broadcast used (e.g. IMAX, 3D, SD, HD, etc.).

rangeIncludes.label: seasonNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: Position of the season within an ordered group of seasons.

rangeIncludes.label: serialNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.

rangeIncludes.label: servesCuisine
rangeIncludes.comment: The cuisine of the restaurant.

rangeIncludes.label: serviceType
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of service being offered, e.g. veterans' benefits, emergency relief, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: sku
rangeIncludes.comment: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

rangeIncludes.label: softwareVersion
rangeIncludes.comment: Version of the software instance.

rangeIncludes.label: specialCommitments
rangeIncludes.comment: Any special commitments associated with this job posting. Valid entries include VeteranCommit, MilitarySpouseCommit, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: storageRequirements
rangeIncludes.comment: Storage requirements (free space required).

rangeIncludes.label: streetAddress
rangeIncludes.comment: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

rangeIncludes.label: subtitleLanguage
rangeIncludes.comment: Languages in which subtitles/captions are available, in [IETF BCP 47 standard format](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47).

rangeIncludes.label: suggestedGender
rangeIncludes.comment: The gender of the person or audience.

rangeIncludes.label: targetDescription
rangeIncludes.comment: The description of a node in an established educational framework.

rangeIncludes.label: targetName
rangeIncludes.comment: The name of a node in an established educational framework.

rangeIncludes.label: targetPlatform
rangeIncludes.comment: Type of app development: phone, Metro style, desktop, XBox, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: taxID
rangeIncludes.comment: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

rangeIncludes.label: telephone
rangeIncludes.comment: The telephone number.

rangeIncludes.label: temporalCoverage
rangeIncludes.comment:
The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a DateTime or as a textual string indicating a time period in [ISO 8601 time interval format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Time_intervals). In
      the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written "2011/2012"). Other forms of content e.g. ScholarlyArticle, Book, TVSeries or TVEpisode may indicate their temporalCoverage in broader terms - textually or via well-known URL.
      Written works such as books may sometimes have precise temporal coverage too, e.g. a work set in 1939 - 1945 can be indicated in ISO 8601 interval format format via "1939/1945".

Open-ended date ranges can be written with ".." in place of the end date. For example, "2015-11/.." indicates a range beginning in November 2015 and with no specified final date. This is tentative and might be updated in future when ISO 8601 is officially updated.

rangeIncludes.label: temporal
rangeIncludes.comment:
The "temporal" property can be used in cases where more specific properties
(e.g. [[temporalCoverage]], [[dateCreated]], [[dateModified]], [[datePublished]]) are not known to be appropriate.

rangeIncludes.label: text
rangeIncludes.comment: The textual content of this CreativeWork.

rangeIncludes.label: tickerSymbol
rangeIncludes.comment: The exchange traded instrument associated with a Corporation object. The tickerSymbol is expressed as an exchange and an instrument name separated by a space character. For the exchange component of the tickerSymbol attribute, we recommend using the controlled vocabulary of Market Identifier Codes (MIC) specified in ISO15022.

rangeIncludes.label: title
rangeIncludes.comment: The title of the job.

rangeIncludes.label: trackingNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: Shipper tracking number.

rangeIncludes.label: transcript
rangeIncludes.comment: If this MediaObject is an AudioObject or VideoObject, the transcript of that object.

rangeIncludes.label: typicalAgeRange
rangeIncludes.comment: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

rangeIncludes.label: unitCode
rangeIncludes.comment: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

rangeIncludes.label: value
rangeIncludes.comment:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

rangeIncludes.label: vatID
rangeIncludes.comment: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

rangeIncludes.label: version
rangeIncludes.comment: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

rangeIncludes.label: videoFrameSize
rangeIncludes.comment: The frame size of the video.

rangeIncludes.label: videoQuality
rangeIncludes.comment: The quality of the video.

rangeIncludes.label: paymentMethodId
rangeIncludes.comment: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

rangeIncludes.label: workHours
rangeIncludes.comment: The typical working hours for this job (e.g. 1st shift, night shift, 8am-5pm).

rangeIncludes.label: worstRating
rangeIncludes.comment: The lowest value allowed in this rating system. If worstRating is omitted, 1 is assumed.

rangeIncludes.label: reservationId
rangeIncludes.comment: A unique identifier for the reservation.

rangeIncludes.label: providerMobility
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates the mobility of a provided service (e.g. 'static', 'dynamic').

rangeIncludes.label: totalPrice
rangeIncludes.comment:
The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

rangeIncludes.label: priceCurrency
rangeIncludes.comment: The currency of the price, or a price component when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

rangeIncludes.label: membershipNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: A unique identifier for the membership.

rangeIncludes.label: programName
rangeIncludes.comment: The program providing the membership.

rangeIncludes.label: ticketNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The unique identifier for the ticket.

rangeIncludes.label: ticketToken
rangeIncludes.comment: Reference to an asset (e.g., Barcode, QR code image or PDF) usable for entrance.

rangeIncludes.label: seatNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The location of the reserved seat (e.g., 27).

rangeIncludes.label: seatRow
rangeIncludes.comment: The row location of the reserved seat (e.g., B).

rangeIncludes.label: seatSection
rangeIncludes.comment: The section location of the reserved seat (e.g. Orchestra).

rangeIncludes.label: seatingType
rangeIncludes.comment: The type/class of the seat.

rangeIncludes.label: boardingGroup
rangeIncludes.comment: The airline-specific indicator of boarding order / preference.

rangeIncludes.label: passengerSequenceNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The passenger's sequence number as assigned by the airline.

rangeIncludes.label: securityScreening
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of security screening the passenger is subject to.

rangeIncludes.label: passengerPriorityStatus
rangeIncludes.comment: The priority status assigned to a passenger for security or boarding (e.g. FastTrack or Priority).

rangeIncludes.label: flightNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The unique identifier for a flight including the airline IATA code. For example, if describing United flight 110, where the IATA code for United is 'UA', the flightNumber is 'UA110'.

rangeIncludes.label: departureGate
rangeIncludes.comment: Identifier of the flight's departure gate.

rangeIncludes.label: arrivalGate
rangeIncludes.comment: Identifier of the flight's arrival gate.

rangeIncludes.label: departureTerminal
rangeIncludes.comment: Identifier of the flight's departure terminal.

rangeIncludes.label: arrivalTerminal
rangeIncludes.comment: Identifier of the flight's arrival terminal.

rangeIncludes.label: aircraft
rangeIncludes.comment: The kind of aircraft (e.g., "Boeing 747").

rangeIncludes.label: mealService
rangeIncludes.comment: Description of the meals that will be provided or available for purchase.

rangeIncludes.label: estimatedFlightDuration
rangeIncludes.comment: The estimated time the flight will take.

rangeIncludes.label: flightDistance
rangeIncludes.comment: The distance of the flight.

rangeIncludes.label: iataCode
rangeIncludes.comment: IATA identifier for an airline or airport.

rangeIncludes.label: icaoCode
rangeIncludes.comment: ICAO identifier for an airport.

rangeIncludes.label: trainNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The unique identifier for the train.

rangeIncludes.label: trainName
rangeIncludes.comment: The name of the train (e.g. The Orient Express).

rangeIncludes.label: departurePlatform
rangeIncludes.comment: The platform from which the train departs.

rangeIncludes.label: arrivalPlatform
rangeIncludes.comment: The platform where the train arrives.

rangeIncludes.label: busNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The unique identifier for the bus.

rangeIncludes.label: busName
rangeIncludes.comment: The name of the bus (e.g. Bolt Express).

rangeIncludes.label: lodgingUnitType
rangeIncludes.comment: Textual description of the unit type (including suite vs. room, size of bed, etc.).

rangeIncludes.label: lodgingUnitDescription
rangeIncludes.comment: A full description of the lodging unit.

rangeIncludes.label: httpMethod
rangeIncludes.comment: An HTTP method that specifies the appropriate HTTP method for a request to an HTTP EntryPoint. Values are capitalized strings as used in HTTP.

rangeIncludes.label: encodingType
rangeIncludes.comment: The supported encoding type(s) for an EntryPoint request.

rangeIncludes.label: contentType
rangeIncludes.comment: The supported content type(s) for an EntryPoint response.

rangeIncludes.label: urlTemplate
rangeIncludes.comment: An url template (RFC6570) that will be used to construct the target of the execution of the action.

rangeIncludes.label: valueName
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates the name of the PropertyValueSpecification to be used in URL templates and form encoding in a manner analogous to HTML's input@name.

rangeIncludes.label: defaultValue
rangeIncludes.comment: The default value of the input.  For properties that expect a literal, the default is a literal value, for properties that expect an object, it's an ID reference to one of the current values.

rangeIncludes.label: valuePattern
rangeIncludes.comment: Specifies a regular expression for testing literal values according to the HTML spec.

rangeIncludes.label: characterName
rangeIncludes.comment: The name of a character played in some acting or performing role, i.e. in a PerformanceRole.

rangeIncludes.label: namedPosition
rangeIncludes.comment: A position played, performed or filled by a person or organization, as part of an organization. For example, an athlete in a SportsTeam might play in the position named 'Quarterback'.

rangeIncludes.label: roleName
rangeIncludes.comment: A role played, performed or filled by a person or organization. For example, the team of creators for a comic book might fill the roles named 'inker', 'penciller', and 'letterer'; or an athlete in a SportsTeam might play in the position named 'Quarterback'.

rangeIncludes.label: issn
rangeIncludes.comment: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

rangeIncludes.label: issueNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: Identifies the issue of publication; for example, "iii" or "2".

rangeIncludes.label: pageEnd
rangeIncludes.comment: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

rangeIncludes.label: pageStart
rangeIncludes.comment: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

rangeIncludes.label: pagination
rangeIncludes.comment: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

rangeIncludes.label: volumeNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: Identifies the volume of publication or multi-part work; for example, "iii" or "2".

rangeIncludes.label: itemListElement
rangeIncludes.comment:
For itemListElement values, you can use simple strings (e.g. "Peter", "Paul", "Mary"), existing entities, or use ListItem.

Text values are best if the elements in the list are plain strings. Existing entities are best for a simple, unordered list of existing things in your data. ListItem is used with ordered lists when you want to provide additional context about the element in that list or when the same item might be in different places in different lists.

Note: The order of elements in your mark-up is not sufficient for indicating the order or elements.  Use ListItem with a 'position' property in such cases.

rangeIncludes.label: gamePlatform
rangeIncludes.comment: The electronic systems used to play video games.

rangeIncludes.label: iswcCode
rangeIncludes.comment: The International Standard Musical Work Code for the composition.

rangeIncludes.label: musicCompositionForm
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of composition (e.g. overture, sonata, symphony, etc.).

rangeIncludes.label: musicalKey
rangeIncludes.comment: The key, mode, or scale this composition uses.

rangeIncludes.label: isrcCode
rangeIncludes.comment: The International Standard Recording Code for the recording.

rangeIncludes.label: catalogNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The catalog number for the release.

rangeIncludes.label: sport
rangeIncludes.comment: A type of sport (e.g. Baseball).

rangeIncludes.label: currency
