rangeIncludes.comment: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

rangeIncludes.label: artform
rangeIncludes.comment: e.g. Painting, Drawing, Sculpture, Print, Photograph, Assemblage, Collage, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: material
rangeIncludes.comment: A material that something is made from, e.g. leather, wool, cotton, paper.

rangeIncludes.label: artMedium
rangeIncludes.comment: The material used. (e.g. Oil, Watercolour, Acrylic, Linoprint, Marble, Cyanotype, Digital, Lithograph, DryPoint, Intaglio, Pastel, Woodcut, Pencil, Mixed Media, etc.)

rangeIncludes.label: surface
rangeIncludes.comment: A material used as a surface in some artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: artworkSurface
rangeIncludes.comment: The supporting materials for the artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: artEdition
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of copies when multiple copies of a piece of artwork are produced - e.g. for a limited edition of 20 prints, 'artEdition' refers to the total number of copies (in this example "20").

rangeIncludes.label: accountId
rangeIncludes.comment: The identifier for the account the payment will be applied to.

rangeIncludes.label: paymentStatus
rangeIncludes.comment: The status of payment; whether the invoice has been paid or not.

rangeIncludes.label: unitText
rangeIncludes.comment: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

rangeIncludes.label: propertyID
rangeIncludes.comment:
A commonly used identifier for the characteristic represented by the property, e.g. a manufacturer or a standard code for a property. propertyID can be
(1) a prefixed string, mainly meant to be used with standards for product properties; (2) a site-specific, non-prefixed string (e.g. the primary key of the property or the vendor-specific id of the property), or (3)
a URL indicating the type of the property, either pointing to an external vocabulary, or a Web resource that describes the property (e.g. a glossary entry).
Standards bodies should promote a standard prefix for the identifiers of properties from their standards.

rangeIncludes.label: broadcastDisplayName
rangeIncludes.comment: The name displayed in the channel guide. For many US affiliates, it is the network name.

rangeIncludes.label: broadcastTimezone
rangeIncludes.comment: The timezone in [ISO 8601 format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) for which the service bases its broadcasts

rangeIncludes.label: broadcastChannelId
rangeIncludes.comment: The unique address by which the BroadcastService can be identified in a provider lineup. In US, this is typically a number.

rangeIncludes.label: broadcastServiceTier
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of service required to have access to the channel (e.g. Standard or Premium).

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfAirbags
rangeIncludes.comment: The number or type of airbags in the vehicle.

rangeIncludes.label: vehicleIdentificationNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) is a unique serial number used by the automotive industry to identify individual motor vehicles.

rangeIncludes.label: vehicleConfiguration
rangeIncludes.comment: A short text indicating the configuration of the vehicle, e.g. '5dr hatchback ST 2.5 MT 225 hp' or 'limited edition'.

rangeIncludes.label: knownVehicleDamages
rangeIncludes.comment: A textual description of known damages, both repaired and unrepaired.

rangeIncludes.label: driveWheelConfiguration
rangeIncludes.comment: The drive wheel configuration, i.e. which roadwheels will receive torque from the vehicle's engine via the drivetrain.

rangeIncludes.label: fuelType
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

rangeIncludes.label: vehicleInteriorColor
rangeIncludes.comment: The color or color combination of the interior of the vehicle.

rangeIncludes.label: vehicleInteriorType
rangeIncludes.comment: The type or material of the interior of the vehicle (e.g. synthetic fabric, leather, wood, etc.). While most interior types are characterized by the material used, an interior type can also be based on vehicle usage or target audience.

rangeIncludes.label: vehicleTransmission
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of component used for transmitting the power from a rotating power source to the wheels or other relevant component(s) ("gearbox" for cars).

rangeIncludes.label: vehicleSpecialUsage
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates whether the vehicle has been used for special purposes, like commercial rental, driving school, or as a taxi. The legislation in many countries requires this information to be revealed when offering a car for sale.

rangeIncludes.label: reportNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: The number or other unique designator assigned to a Report by the publishing organization.

rangeIncludes.label: servingSize
rangeIncludes.comment: The serving size, in terms of the number of volume or mass.

rangeIncludes.label: recipeCategory
rangeIncludes.comment: The category of the recipe—for example, appetizer, entree, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: ingredients
rangeIncludes.comment: A single ingredient used in the recipe, e.g. sugar, flour or garlic.

rangeIncludes.label: recipeInstructions
rangeIncludes.comment: A step in making the recipe, in the form of a single item (document, video, etc.) or an ordered list with HowToStep and/or HowToSection items.

rangeIncludes.label: dataFeedElement
rangeIncludes.comment: An item within in a data feed. Data feeds may have many elements.

rangeIncludes.label: leiCode
rangeIncludes.comment: An organization identifier that uniquely identifies a legal entity as defined in ISO 17442.

rangeIncludes.label: feesAndCommissionsSpecification
rangeIncludes.comment: Description of fees, commissions, and other terms applied either to a class of financial product, or by a financial service organization.

rangeIncludes.label: requiredCollateral
rangeIncludes.comment: Assets required to secure loan or credit repayments. It may take form of third party pledge, goods, financial instruments (cash, securities, etc.)

rangeIncludes.label: typeOfBed
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of bed to which the BedDetail refers, i.e. the type of bed available in the quantity indicated by quantity.

rangeIncludes.label: bed
rangeIncludes.comment:
The type of bed or beds included in the accommodation. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you use bed directly with a text.
      If you want to indicate the quantity of a certain kind of bed, use an instance of BedDetails. For more detailed information, use the amenityFeature property.

rangeIncludes.label: permittedUsage
rangeIncludes.comment: Indications regarding the permitted usage of the accommodation.

rangeIncludes.label: petsAllowed
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates whether pets are allowed to enter the accommodation or lodging business. More detailed information can be put in a text value.

rangeIncludes.label: estimatedCost
rangeIncludes.comment: The estimated cost of the supply or supplies consumed when performing instructions.

rangeIncludes.label: supply
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub-property of instrument. A supply consumed when performing instructions or a direction.

rangeIncludes.label: step
rangeIncludes.comment: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection.

rangeIncludes.label: steps
rangeIncludes.comment: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection (originally misnamed 'steps'; 'step' is preferred).

rangeIncludes.label: tool
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. An object used (but not consumed) when performing instructions or a direction.

rangeIncludes.label: yield
rangeIncludes.comment: The quantity that results by performing instructions. For example, a paper airplane, 10 personalized candles.

rangeIncludes.label: requiredQuantity
rangeIncludes.comment: The required quantity of the item(s).

rangeIncludes.label: courseCode
rangeIncludes.comment: The identifier for the [[Course]] used by the course [[provider]] (e.g. CS101 or 6.001).

rangeIncludes.label: coursePrerequisites
rangeIncludes.comment: Requirements for taking the Course. May be completion of another [[Course]] or a textual description like "permission of instructor". Requirements may be a pre-requisite competency, referenced using [[AlignmentObject]].

rangeIncludes.label: courseMode
rangeIncludes.comment: The medium or means of delivery of the course instance or the mode of study, either as a text label (e.g. "online", "onsite" or "blended"; "synchronous" or "asynchronous"; "full-time" or "part-time") or as a URL reference to a term from a controlled vocabulary (e.g. https://ceds.ed.gov/element/001311#Asynchronous ).

rangeIncludes.label: identifier
rangeIncludes.comment: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of [[Thing]], such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#identifierBg) for more details.

rangeIncludes.label: claimReviewed
rangeIncludes.comment: A short summary of the specific claims reviewed in a ClaimReview.

rangeIncludes.label: accessMode
rangeIncludes.comment: The human sensory perceptual system or cognitive faculty through which a person may process or perceive information. Expected values include: auditory, tactile, textual, visual, colorDependent, chartOnVisual, chemOnVisual, diagramOnVisual, mathOnVisual, musicOnVisual, textOnVisual.

rangeIncludes.label: accessModeSufficient
rangeIncludes.comment: A list of single or combined accessModes that are sufficient to understand all the intellectual content of a resource. Expected values include:  auditory, tactile, textual, visual.

rangeIncludes.label: accessibilitySummary
rangeIncludes.comment: A human-readable summary of specific accessibility features or deficiencies, consistent with the other accessibility metadata but expressing subtleties such as "short descriptions are present but long descriptions will be needed for non-visual users" or "short descriptions are present and no long descriptions are needed."

rangeIncludes.label: broadcastFrequency
rangeIncludes.comment: The frequency used for over-the-air broadcasts. Numeric values or simple ranges e.g. 87-99. In addition a shortcut idiom is supported for frequences of AM and FM radio channels, e.g. "87 FM".

rangeIncludes.label: reviewAspect
rangeIncludes.comment: This Review or Rating is relevant to this part or facet of the itemReviewed.

rangeIncludes.label: educationRequirements
rangeIncludes.comment: Educational background needed for the position or Occupation.

rangeIncludes.label: experienceRequirements
rangeIncludes.comment: Description of skills and experience needed for the position or Occupation.

rangeIncludes.label: occupationalCategory
rangeIncludes.comment: Category or categories describing the job. Use BLS O*NET-SOC taxonomy: http://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy.html. Ideally includes textual label and formal code, with the property repeated for each applicable value.

rangeIncludes.label: qualifications
rangeIncludes.comment: Specific qualifications required for this role or Occupation.

rangeIncludes.label: responsibilities
rangeIncludes.comment: Responsibilities associated with this role or Occupation.

rangeIncludes.label: skills
rangeIncludes.comment: Skills required to fulfill this role or in this Occupation.

rangeIncludes.label: geoRadius
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates the approximate radius of a GeoCircle (metres unless indicated otherwise via Distance notation).

rangeIncludes.label: orderQuantity
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of the item ordered. If the property is not set, assume the quantity is one.

rangeIncludes.label: additionalNumberOfGuests
rangeIncludes.comment: If responding yes, the number of guests who will attend in addition to the invitee.

rangeIncludes.label: amountOfThisGood
rangeIncludes.comment: The quantity of the goods included in the offer.

rangeIncludes.label: baseSalary
rangeIncludes.comment: The base salary of the job or of an employee in an EmployeeRole.

rangeIncludes.label: bestRating
rangeIncludes.comment: The highest value allowed in this rating system. If bestRating is omitted, 5 is assumed.

rangeIncludes.label: billingIncrement
rangeIncludes.comment: This property specifies the minimal quantity and rounding increment that will be the basis for the billing. The unit of measurement is specified by the unitCode property.

rangeIncludes.label: childMaxAge
rangeIncludes.comment: Maximal age of the child.

rangeIncludes.label: childMinAge
rangeIncludes.comment: Minimal age of the child.

rangeIncludes.label: copyrightYear
rangeIncludes.comment: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

rangeIncludes.label: discount
rangeIncludes.comment: Any discount applied (to an Order).

rangeIncludes.label: elevation
rangeIncludes.comment: The elevation of a location ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)). Values may be of the form 'NUMBER UNIT_OF_MEASUREMENT' (e.g., '1,000 m', '3,200 ft') while numbers alone should be assumed to be a value in meters.

rangeIncludes.label: highPrice
rangeIncludes.comment:
The highest price of all offers available.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

rangeIncludes.label: latitude
rangeIncludes.comment: The latitude of a location. For example ```37.42242``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

rangeIncludes.label: longitude
rangeIncludes.comment: The longitude of a location. For example ```-122.08585``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

rangeIncludes.label: lowPrice
rangeIncludes.comment:
The lowest price of all offers available.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

rangeIncludes.label: maxPrice
rangeIncludes.comment: The highest price if the price is a range.

rangeIncludes.label: maxValue
rangeIncludes.comment: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

rangeIncludes.label: minPrice
rangeIncludes.comment: The lowest price if the price is a range.

rangeIncludes.label: minValue
rangeIncludes.comment: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

rangeIncludes.label: price
rangeIncludes.comment:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

* Use the [[priceCurrency]] property (with standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR") instead of including [ambiguous symbols](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollar_sign#Currencies_that_use_the_dollar_or_peso_sign) such as '$' in the value.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
* Note that both [RDFa](http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-rdfa-primer/#using-the-content-attribute) and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

rangeIncludes.label: ratingValue
rangeIncludes.comment:
The rating for the content.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

rangeIncludes.label: screenCount
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of screens in the movie theater.

rangeIncludes.label: suggestedMaxAge
rangeIncludes.comment: Maximal age recommended for viewing content.

rangeIncludes.label: suggestedMinAge
rangeIncludes.comment: Minimal age recommended for viewing content.

rangeIncludes.label: value
rangeIncludes.comment:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

rangeIncludes.label: version
rangeIncludes.comment: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

rangeIncludes.label: worstRating
rangeIncludes.comment: The lowest value allowed in this rating system. If worstRating is omitted, 1 is assumed.

rangeIncludes.label: totalPrice
rangeIncludes.comment:
The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

rangeIncludes.label: valueMinLength
rangeIncludes.comment: Specifies the minimum allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

rangeIncludes.label: valueMaxLength
rangeIncludes.comment: Specifies the allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

rangeIncludes.label: stepValue
rangeIncludes.comment: The stepValue attribute indicates the granularity that is expected (and required) of the value in a PropertyValueSpecification.

rangeIncludes.label: numberedPosition
rangeIncludes.comment: A number associated with a role in an organization, for example, the number on an athlete's jersey.

rangeIncludes.label: amount
rangeIncludes.comment: The amount of money.

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfDoors
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of doors.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfAirbags
rangeIncludes.comment: The number or type of airbags in the vehicle.

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfAxles
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of axles.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfForwardGears
rangeIncludes.comment: The total number of forward gears available for the transmission system of the vehicle.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfPreviousOwners
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of owners of the vehicle, including the current one.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

rangeIncludes.label: vehicleSeatingCapacity
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of passengers that can be seated in the vehicle, both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62 for persons.

rangeIncludes.label: annualPercentageRate
rangeIncludes.comment: The annual rate that is charged for borrowing (or made by investing), expressed as a single percentage number that represents the actual yearly cost of funds over the term of a loan. This includes any fees or additional costs associated with the transaction.

rangeIncludes.label: interestRate
rangeIncludes.comment: The interest rate, charged or paid, applicable to the financial product. Note: This is different from the calculated annualPercentageRate.

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfRooms
rangeIncludes.comment:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfBeds
rangeIncludes.comment: The quantity of the given bed type available in the HotelRoom, Suite, House, or Apartment.

rangeIncludes.label: requiredQuantity
rangeIncludes.comment: The required quantity of the item(s).

rangeIncludes.label: broadcastFrequencyValue
rangeIncludes.comment: The frequency in MHz for a particular broadcast.

rangeIncludes.label: percentile10
rangeIncludes.comment: The 10th percentile value.

rangeIncludes.label: percentile25
rangeIncludes.comment: The 25th percentile value.

rangeIncludes.label: median
rangeIncludes.comment: The median value.

rangeIncludes.label: percentile75
rangeIncludes.comment: The 75th percentile value.

rangeIncludes.label: percentile90
rangeIncludes.comment: The 90th percentile value.

GovernmentOffice.comment: A government office—for example, an IRS or DMV office.

HVACBusiness.comment: A business that provide Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning services.

HobbyShop.comment: A store that sells materials useful or necessary for various hobbies.

Hostel.comment:
A hostel - cheap accommodation, often in shared dormitories.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

Hotel.comment:
A hotel is an establishment that provides lodging paid on a short-term basis (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hotel).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

ImageGallery.comment: Web page type: Image gallery page.

domainIncludes.label: caption
domainIncludes.comment: The caption for this object. For downloadable machine formats (closed caption, subtitles etc.) use MediaObject and indicate the [[encodingFormat]].

domainIncludes.label: exifData
domainIncludes.comment: exif data for this object.

domainIncludes.label: representativeOfPage
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates whether this image is representative of the content of the page.

domainIncludes.label: thumbnail
domainIncludes.comment: Thumbnail image for an image or video.

rangeIncludes.label: image
rangeIncludes.comment: An image of the item. This can be a [[URL]] or a fully described [[ImageObject]].

rangeIncludes.label: logo
rangeIncludes.comment: An associated logo.

rangeIncludes.label: photo
rangeIncludes.comment: A photograph of this place.

rangeIncludes.label: photos
rangeIncludes.comment: Photographs of this place.

rangeIncludes.label: primaryImageOfPage
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates the main image on the page.

rangeIncludes.label: screenshot
rangeIncludes.comment: A link to a screenshot image of the app.

rangeIncludes.label: thumbnail
rangeIncludes.comment: Thumbnail image for an image or video.

rangeIncludes.label: clipNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: Position of the clip within an ordered group of clips.

rangeIncludes.label: episodeNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: Position of the episode within an ordered group of episodes.

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfItems
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of items in an ItemList. Note that some descriptions might not fully describe all items in a list (e.g., multi-page pagination); in such cases, the numberOfItems would be for the entire list.

rangeIncludes.label: maximumAttendeeCapacity
rangeIncludes.comment: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.

rangeIncludes.label: remainingAttendeeCapacity
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of attendee places for an event that remain unallocated.

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfEpisodes
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of episodes in this season or series.

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfPages
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of pages in the book.

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfSeasons
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of seasons in this series.

rangeIncludes.label: numTracks
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of tracks in this album or playlist.

rangeIncludes.label: offerCount
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of offers for the product.

rangeIncludes.label: position
rangeIncludes.comment: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

rangeIncludes.label: ratingCount
rangeIncludes.comment: The count of total number of ratings.

rangeIncludes.label: requiredMaxAge
rangeIncludes.comment: Audiences defined by a person's maximum age.

rangeIncludes.label: requiredMinAge
rangeIncludes.comment: Audiences defined by a person's minimum age.

rangeIncludes.label: reviewCount
rangeIncludes.comment: The count of total number of reviews.

rangeIncludes.label: seasonNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: Position of the season within an ordered group of seasons.

rangeIncludes.label: wordCount
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of words in the text of the Article.

rangeIncludes.label: partySize
rangeIncludes.comment: Number of people the reservation should accommodate.

rangeIncludes.label: numAdults
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of adults staying in the unit.

rangeIncludes.label: numChildren
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of children staying in the unit.

rangeIncludes.label: upvoteCount
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of upvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

rangeIncludes.label: downvoteCount
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of downvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

rangeIncludes.label: answerCount
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of answers this question has received.

rangeIncludes.label: commentCount
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of comments this CreativeWork (e.g. Article, Question or Answer) has received. This is most applicable to works published in Web sites with commenting system; additional comments may exist elsewhere.

rangeIncludes.label: issueNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: Identifies the issue of publication; for example, "iii" or "2".

rangeIncludes.label: pageEnd
rangeIncludes.comment: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

rangeIncludes.label: pageStart
rangeIncludes.comment: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

rangeIncludes.label: volumeNumber
rangeIncludes.comment: Identifies the volume of publication or multi-part work; for example, "iii" or "2".

rangeIncludes.label: playersOnline
rangeIncludes.comment: Number of players on the server.

rangeIncludes.label: artEdition
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of copies when multiple copies of a piece of artwork are produced - e.g. for a limited edition of 20 prints, 'artEdition' refers to the total number of copies (in this example "20").

rangeIncludes.label: userInteractionCount
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication.

ItemAvailability.comment: A list of possible product availability options.

rangeIncludes.label: availability
rangeIncludes.comment: The availability of this item—for example In stock, Out of stock, Pre-order, etc.

ItemList.comment: A list of items of any sort—for example, Top 10 Movies About Weathermen, or Top 100 Party Songs. Not to be confused with HTML lists, which are often used only for formatting.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfItems
domainIncludes.comment: The number of items in an ItemList. Note that some descriptions might not fully describe all items in a list (e.g., multi-page pagination); in such cases, the numberOfItems would be for the entire list.

domainIncludes.label: itemListOrder
domainIncludes.comment: Type of ordering (e.g. Ascending, Descending, Unordered).

domainIncludes.label: itemListElement
domainIncludes.comment:
For itemListElement values, you can use simple strings (e.g. "Peter", "Paul", "Mary"), existing entities, or use ListItem.

Text values are best if the elements in the list are plain strings. Existing entities are best for a simple, unordered list of existing things in your data. ListItem is used with ordered lists when you want to provide additional context about the element in that list or when the same item might be in different places in different lists.

Note: The order of elements in your mark-up is not sufficient for indicating the order or elements.  Use ListItem with a 'position' property in such cases.

rangeIncludes.label: acceptedAnswer
rangeIncludes.comment: The answer(s) that has been accepted as best, typically on a Question/Answer site. Sites vary in their selection mechanisms, e.g. drawing on community opinion and/or the view of the Question author.

rangeIncludes.label: suggestedAnswer
rangeIncludes.comment: An answer (possibly one of several, possibly incorrect) to a Question, e.g. on a Question/Answer site.

rangeIncludes.label: track
rangeIncludes.comment: A music recording (track)—usually a single song. If an ItemList is given, the list should contain items of type MusicRecording.

rangeIncludes.label: recipeInstructions
rangeIncludes.comment: A step in making the recipe, in the form of a single item (document, video, etc.) or an ordered list with HowToStep and/or HowToSection items.

rangeIncludes.label: steps
rangeIncludes.comment: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection (originally misnamed 'steps'; 'step' is preferred).

BreadcrumbList.comment: A BreadcrumbList is an ItemList consisting of a chain of linked Web pages, typically described using at least their URL and their name, and typically ending with the current page.\n\nThe [[position]] property is used to reconstruct the order of the items in a BreadcrumbList The convention is that a breadcrumb list has an [[itemListOrder]] of [[ItemListOrderAscending]] (lower values listed first), and that the first items in this list correspond to the "top" or beginning of the breadcrumb trail, e.g. with a site or section homepage. The specific values of 'position' are not assigned meaning for a BreadcrumbList, but they should be integers, e.g. beginning with '1' for the first item in the list.

rangeIncludes.label: breadcrumb
rangeIncludes.comment: A set of links that can help a user understand and navigate a website hierarchy.

OfferCatalog.comment: An OfferCatalog is an ItemList that contains related Offers and/or further OfferCatalogs that are offeredBy the same provider.

rangeIncludes.label: hasOfferCatalog
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

domainIncludes.label: hasOfferCatalog
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

domainIncludes.label: additionalName
domainIncludes.comment: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.

domainIncludes.label: address
domainIncludes.comment: Physical address of the item.

domainIncludes.label: affiliation
domainIncludes.comment: An organization that this person is affiliated with. For example, a school/university, a club, or a team.

domainIncludes.label: alumniOf
domainIncludes.comment: An organization that the person is an alumni of.

domainIncludes.label: award
domainIncludes.comment: An award won by or for this item.

domainIncludes.label: awards
domainIncludes.comment: Awards won by or for this item.

domainIncludes.label: birthDate
domainIncludes.comment: Date of birth.

domainIncludes.label: brand
domainIncludes.comment: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

domainIncludes.label: children
domainIncludes.comment: A child of the person.

domainIncludes.label: colleague
domainIncludes.comment: A colleague of the person.

domainIncludes.label: colleagues
domainIncludes.comment: A colleague of the person.

domainIncludes.label: contactPoint
domainIncludes.comment: A contact point for a person or organization.

domainIncludes.label: contactPoints
domainIncludes.comment: A contact point for a person or organization.

domainIncludes.label: deathDate
domainIncludes.comment: Date of death.

domainIncludes.label: duns
domainIncludes.comment: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

domainIncludes.label: email
domainIncludes.comment: Email address.

domainIncludes.label: familyName
domainIncludes.comment: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.

domainIncludes.label: faxNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The fax number.

domainIncludes.label: follows
domainIncludes.comment: The most generic uni-directional social relation.

domainIncludes.label: gender
domainIncludes.comment: Gender of the person. While Male and Female may be used, text strings are also acceptable for people who do not identify as a binary gender.

domainIncludes.label: givenName
domainIncludes.comment: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.

domainIncludes.label: globalLocationNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The [Global Location Number](http://www.gs1.org/gln) (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

domainIncludes.label: hasPOS
domainIncludes.comment: Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

domainIncludes.label: height
domainIncludes.comment: The height of the item.

domainIncludes.label: homeLocation
domainIncludes.comment: A contact location for a person's residence.

domainIncludes.label: honorificPrefix
domainIncludes.comment: An honorific prefix preceding a Person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.

domainIncludes.label: honorificSuffix
domainIncludes.comment: An honorific suffix preceding a Person's name such as M.D. /PhD/MSCSW.

domainIncludes.label: isicV4
domainIncludes.comment: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

domainIncludes.label: jobTitle
domainIncludes.comment: The job title of the person (for example, Financial Manager).

domainIncludes.label: knows
domainIncludes.comment: The most generic bi-directional social/work relation.

domainIncludes.label: makesOffer
domainIncludes.comment: A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person.

domainIncludes.label: memberOf
domainIncludes.comment: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs.

domainIncludes.label: naics
domainIncludes.comment: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

domainIncludes.label: nationality
domainIncludes.comment: Nationality of the person.

domainIncludes.label: netWorth
domainIncludes.comment: The total financial value of the person as calculated by subtracting assets from liabilities.

domainIncludes.label: owns
domainIncludes.comment: Products owned by the organization or person.

domainIncludes.label: parent
domainIncludes.comment: A parent of this person.

domainIncludes.label: parents
domainIncludes.comment: A parents of the person.

domainIncludes.label: performerIn
domainIncludes.comment: Event that this person is a performer or participant in.

domainIncludes.label: publishingPrinciples
domainIncludes.comment:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via [[URL]]) a document describing the editorial principles of an [[Organization]] (or individual e.g. a [[Person]] writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a [[CreativeWork]] (e.g. [[NewsArticle]]) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the [[CreativeWork]].

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a [[funder]]) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

domainIncludes.label: relatedTo
domainIncludes.comment: The most generic familial relation.

domainIncludes.label: seeks
domainIncludes.comment: A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

domainIncludes.label: sibling
domainIncludes.comment: A sibling of the person.

domainIncludes.label: siblings
domainIncludes.comment: A sibling of the person.

domainIncludes.label: sponsor
domainIncludes.comment: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

domainIncludes.label: funder
domainIncludes.comment: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

domainIncludes.label: spouse
domainIncludes.comment: The person's spouse.

domainIncludes.label: taxID
domainIncludes.comment: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

domainIncludes.label: telephone
domainIncludes.comment: The telephone number.

domainIncludes.label: vatID
domainIncludes.comment: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

domainIncludes.label: weight
domainIncludes.comment: The weight of the product or person.

domainIncludes.label: workLocation
domainIncludes.comment: A contact location for a person's place of work.

domainIncludes.label: worksFor
domainIncludes.comment: Organizations that the person works for.

domainIncludes.label: birthPlace
domainIncludes.comment: The place where the person was born.

domainIncludes.label: deathPlace
domainIncludes.comment: The place where the person died.

domainIncludes.label: hasOccupation
domainIncludes.comment: The Person's occupation. For past professions, use Role for expressing dates.

Person.comment: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

rangeIncludes.label: accountablePerson
rangeIncludes.comment: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.

rangeIncludes.label: acquiredFrom
rangeIncludes.comment: The organization or person from which the product was acquired.

rangeIncludes.label: actor
rangeIncludes.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

rangeIncludes.label: actors
rangeIncludes.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

rangeIncludes.label: agent
rangeIncludes.comment: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). e.g. *John* wrote a book.

rangeIncludes.label: alumni
rangeIncludes.comment: Alumni of an organization.

rangeIncludes.label: organizer
rangeIncludes.comment: An organizer of an Event.

rangeIncludes.label: attendee
rangeIncludes.comment: A person or organization attending the event.

rangeIncludes.label: attendees
rangeIncludes.comment: A person attending the event.

rangeIncludes.label: author
rangeIncludes.comment: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

rangeIncludes.label: bccRecipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of recipient. The recipient blind copied on a message.

rangeIncludes.label: borrower
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The person that borrows the object being lent.

rangeIncludes.label: buyer
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant/person/organization that bought the object.

rangeIncludes.label: byArtist
rangeIncludes.comment: The artist that performed this album or recording.

rangeIncludes.label: candidate
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The candidate subject of this action.

rangeIncludes.label: ccRecipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of recipient. The recipient copied on a message.

rangeIncludes.label: children
rangeIncludes.comment: A child of the person.

rangeIncludes.label: colleague
rangeIncludes.comment: A colleague of the person.

rangeIncludes.label: colleagues
rangeIncludes.comment: A colleague of the person.

rangeIncludes.label: contributor
rangeIncludes.comment: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

rangeIncludes.label: copyrightHolder
rangeIncludes.comment: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

rangeIncludes.label: creator
rangeIncludes.comment: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

rangeIncludes.label: customer
rangeIncludes.comment: Party placing the order or paying the invoice.

rangeIncludes.label: director
rangeIncludes.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

rangeIncludes.label: directors
rangeIncludes.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

rangeIncludes.label: editor
rangeIncludes.comment: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.

rangeIncludes.label: employee
rangeIncludes.comment: Someone working for this organization.

rangeIncludes.label: employees
rangeIncludes.comment: People working for this organization.

rangeIncludes.label: endorsee
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The person/organization being supported.

rangeIncludes.label: followee
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The person or organization being followed.

rangeIncludes.label: follows
rangeIncludes.comment: The most generic uni-directional social relation.

rangeIncludes.label: founder
rangeIncludes.comment: A person who founded this organization.

rangeIncludes.label: founders
rangeIncludes.comment: A person who founded this organization.

rangeIncludes.label: illustrator
rangeIncludes.comment: The illustrator of the book.

rangeIncludes.label: knows
rangeIncludes.comment: The most generic bi-directional social/work relation.

rangeIncludes.label: landlord
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The owner of the real estate property.

rangeIncludes.label: lender
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The person that lends the object being borrowed.

rangeIncludes.label: loser
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The loser of the action.

rangeIncludes.label: offeredBy
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer to the organization or person making the offer.

rangeIncludes.label: member
rangeIncludes.comment: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals.

rangeIncludes.label: members
rangeIncludes.comment: A member of this organization.

rangeIncludes.label: merchant
rangeIncludes.comment: 'merchant' is an out-dated term for 'seller'.

rangeIncludes.label: musicBy
rangeIncludes.comment: The composer of the soundtrack.

rangeIncludes.label: musicGroupMember
rangeIncludes.comment: A member of a music group—for example, John, Paul, George, or Ringo.

rangeIncludes.label: opponent
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The opponent on this action.

rangeIncludes.label: parent
rangeIncludes.comment: A parent of this person.

rangeIncludes.label: parents
rangeIncludes.comment: A parents of the person.

rangeIncludes.label: participant
rangeIncludes.comment: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. e.g. John wrote a book with *Steve*.

rangeIncludes.label: performer
rangeIncludes.comment: A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor.

rangeIncludes.label: performers
rangeIncludes.comment: The main performer or performers of the event—for example, a presenter, musician, or actor.

rangeIncludes.label: producer
rangeIncludes.comment: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).

rangeIncludes.label: publisher
rangeIncludes.comment: The publisher of the creative work.

rangeIncludes.label: recipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

rangeIncludes.label: relatedTo
rangeIncludes.comment: The most generic familial relation.

rangeIncludes.label: reviewedBy
rangeIncludes.comment: People or organizations that have reviewed the content on this web page for accuracy and/or completeness.

rangeIncludes.label: seller
rangeIncludes.comment: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.

rangeIncludes.label: sender
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the sending end of the action.

rangeIncludes.label: sibling
rangeIncludes.comment: A sibling of the person.

rangeIncludes.label: siblings
rangeIncludes.comment: A sibling of the person.

rangeIncludes.label: sponsor
rangeIncludes.comment: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

rangeIncludes.label: funder
rangeIncludes.comment: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

rangeIncludes.label: spouse
rangeIncludes.comment: The person's spouse.

rangeIncludes.label: toRecipient
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of recipient. The recipient who was directly sent the message.

rangeIncludes.label: vendor
rangeIncludes.comment: 'vendor' is an earlier term for 'seller'.

rangeIncludes.label: winner
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The winner of the action.

rangeIncludes.label: underName
rangeIncludes.comment: The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.

rangeIncludes.label: provider
rangeIncludes.comment: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

rangeIncludes.label: bookingAgent
rangeIncludes.comment: 'bookingAgent' is an out-dated term indicating a 'broker' that serves as a booking agent.

rangeIncludes.label: broker
rangeIncludes.comment: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

rangeIncludes.label: character
rangeIncludes.comment: Fictional person connected with a creative work.

rangeIncludes.label: translator
rangeIncludes.comment: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

rangeIncludes.label: composer
rangeIncludes.comment: The person or organization who wrote a composition, or who is the composer of a work performed at some event.

rangeIncludes.label: lyricist
rangeIncludes.comment: The person who wrote the words.

rangeIncludes.label: creditedTo
rangeIncludes.comment: The group the release is credited to if different than the byArtist. For example, Red and Blue is credited to "Stefani Germanotta Band", but by Lady Gaga.

rangeIncludes.label: coach
rangeIncludes.comment: A person that acts in a coaching role for a sports team.

rangeIncludes.label: athlete
rangeIncludes.comment: A person that acts as performing member of a sports team; a player as opposed to a coach.

rangeIncludes.label: homeTeam
rangeIncludes.comment: The home team in a sports event.

rangeIncludes.label: awayTeam
rangeIncludes.comment: The away team in a sports event.

rangeIncludes.label: competitor
rangeIncludes.comment: A competitor in a sports event.

rangeIncludes.label: grantee
rangeIncludes.comment: The person, organization, contact point, or audience that has been granted this permission.

rangeIncludes.label: instructor
rangeIncludes.comment: A person assigned to instruct or provide instructional assistance for the [[CourseInstance]].

domainIncludes.label: hasOfferCatalog
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

domainIncludes.label: aggregateRating
domainIncludes.comment: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

domainIncludes.label: areaServed
domainIncludes.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

domainIncludes.label: audience
domainIncludes.comment: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

domainIncludes.label: availableChannel
domainIncludes.comment: A means of accessing the service (e.g. a phone bank, a web site, a location, etc.).

domainIncludes.label: award
domainIncludes.comment: An award won by or for this item.

domainIncludes.label: brand
domainIncludes.comment: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

domainIncludes.label: category
domainIncludes.comment: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

domainIncludes.label: hoursAvailable
domainIncludes.comment: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

domainIncludes.label: isRelatedTo
domainIncludes.comment: A pointer to another, somehow related product (or multiple products).

domainIncludes.label: isSimilarTo
domainIncludes.comment: A pointer to another, functionally similar product (or multiple products).

domainIncludes.label: logo
domainIncludes.comment: An associated logo.

domainIncludes.label: offers
domainIncludes.comment: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

domainIncludes.label: produces
domainIncludes.comment: The tangible thing generated by the service, e.g. a passport, permit, etc.

domainIncludes.label: serviceOutput
domainIncludes.comment: The tangible thing generated by the service, e.g. a passport, permit, etc.

domainIncludes.label: review
domainIncludes.comment: A review of the item.

domainIncludes.label: slogan
domainIncludes.comment: A slogan or motto associated with the item.

domainIncludes.label: serviceArea
domainIncludes.comment: The geographic area where the service is provided.

domainIncludes.label: serviceAudience
domainIncludes.comment: The audience eligible for this service.

domainIncludes.label: serviceType
domainIncludes.comment: The type of service being offered, e.g. veterans' benefits, emergency relief, etc.

domainIncludes.label: provider
domainIncludes.comment: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

domainIncludes.label: providerMobility
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates the mobility of a provided service (e.g. 'static', 'dynamic').

domainIncludes.label: broker
domainIncludes.comment: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

Service.comment: A service provided by an organization, e.g. delivery service, print services, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: isRelatedTo
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer to another, somehow related product (or multiple products).

rangeIncludes.label: isSimilarTo
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer to another, functionally similar product (or multiple products).

rangeIncludes.label: issuedThrough
rangeIncludes.comment: The service through with the permit was granted.

rangeIncludes.label: itemOffered
rangeIncludes.comment: The item being offered.

rangeIncludes.label: orderedItem
rangeIncludes.comment: The item ordered.

rangeIncludes.label: providesService
rangeIncludes.comment: The service provided by this channel.

rangeIncludes.label: typeOfGood
rangeIncludes.comment: The product that this structured value is referring to.

ItemPage.comment: A page devoted to a single item, such as a particular product or hotel.

JobPosting.comment: A listing that describes a job opening in a certain organization.

domainIncludes.label: baseSalary
domainIncludes.comment: The base salary of the job or of an employee in an EmployeeRole.

domainIncludes.label: benefits
domainIncludes.comment: Description of benefits associated with the job.

domainIncludes.label: jobBenefits
domainIncludes.comment: Description of benefits associated with the job.

domainIncludes.label: datePosted
domainIncludes.comment: Publication date for the job posting.

domainIncludes.label: employmentType
domainIncludes.comment: Type of employment (e.g. full-time, part-time, contract, temporary, seasonal, internship).

domainIncludes.label: hiringOrganization
domainIncludes.comment: Organization offering the job position.

domainIncludes.label: incentives
domainIncludes.comment: Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job.

domainIncludes.label: incentiveCompensation
domainIncludes.comment: Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job.

domainIncludes.label: industry
domainIncludes.comment: The industry associated with the job position.

domainIncludes.label: jobLocation
domainIncludes.comment: A (typically single) geographic location associated with the job position.

domainIncludes.label: occupationalCategory
domainIncludes.comment: Category or categories describing the job. Use BLS O*NET-SOC taxonomy: http://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy.html. Ideally includes textual label and formal code, with the property repeated for each applicable value.

domainIncludes.label: salaryCurrency
domainIncludes.comment: The currency (coded using [ISO 4217](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) ) used for the main salary information in this job posting or for this employee.

domainIncludes.label: specialCommitments
domainIncludes.comment: Any special commitments associated with this job posting. Valid entries include VeteranCommit, MilitarySpouseCommit, etc.

domainIncludes.label: title
domainIncludes.comment: The title of the job.

domainIncludes.label: validThrough
domainIncludes.comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

domainIncludes.label: workHours
domainIncludes.comment: The typical working hours for this job (e.g. 1st shift, night shift, 8am-5pm).

domainIncludes.label: educationRequirements
domainIncludes.comment: Educational background needed for the position or Occupation.

domainIncludes.label: estimatedSalary
domainIncludes.comment: An estimated salary for a job posting or occupation, based on a variety of variables including, but not limited to industry, job title, and location. Estimated salaries  are often computed by outside organizations rather than the hiring organization, who may not have committed to the estimated value.

domainIncludes.label: experienceRequirements
domainIncludes.comment: Description of skills and experience needed for the position or Occupation.

domainIncludes.label: occupationalCategory
domainIncludes.comment: Category or categories describing the job. Use BLS O*NET-SOC taxonomy: http://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy.html. Ideally includes textual label and formal code, with the property repeated for each applicable value.

domainIncludes.label: qualifications
domainIncludes.comment: Specific qualifications required for this role or Occupation.

domainIncludes.label: responsibilities
domainIncludes.comment: Responsibilities associated with this role or Occupation.

domainIncludes.label: skills
domainIncludes.comment: Skills required to fulfill this role or in this Occupation.

domainIncludes.label: relevantOccupation
domainIncludes.comment: The Occupation for the JobPosting.

Language.comment: Natural languages such as Spanish, Tamil, Hindi, English, etc. Formal language code tags expressed in [BCP 47](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) can be used via the [[alternateName]] property. The Language type previously also covered programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, which are now best represented using [[ComputerLanguage]].

rangeIncludes.label: availableLanguage
rangeIncludes.comment: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]]

rangeIncludes.label: inLanguage
rangeIncludes.comment: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

rangeIncludes.label: language
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. The language used on this action.

rangeIncludes.label: subtitleLanguage
rangeIncludes.comment: Languages in which subtitles/captions are available, in [IETF BCP 47 standard format](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47).

ComputerLanguage.comment: This type covers computer programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, as well as other language-like computer representations. Natural languages are best represented with the [[Language]] type.

rangeIncludes.label: programmingLanguage
rangeIncludes.comment: The computer programming language.

LegislativeBuilding.comment: A legislative building—for example, the state capitol.

LiquorStore.comment: A shop that sells alcoholic drinks such as wine, beer, whisky and other spirits.

domainIncludes.label: mapType
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates the kind of Map, from the MapCategoryType Enumeration.

rangeIncludes.label: hasMap
rangeIncludes.comment: A URL to a map of the place.

MapCategoryType.comment: An enumeration of several kinds of Map.

rangeIncludes.label: mapType
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates the kind of Map, from the MapCategoryType Enumeration.

Mass.comment: Properties that take Mass as values are of the form '<Number> <Mass unit of measure>'. E.g., '7 kg'.

PeopleAudience.comment: A set of characteristics belonging to people, e.g. who compose an item's target audience.

domainIncludes.label: requiredGender
domainIncludes.comment: Audiences defined by a person's gender.

domainIncludes.label: requiredMaxAge
domainIncludes.comment: Audiences defined by a person's maximum age.

domainIncludes.label: requiredMinAge
domainIncludes.comment: Audiences defined by a person's minimum age.

domainIncludes.label: suggestedGender
domainIncludes.comment: The gender of the person or audience.

domainIncludes.label: suggestedMaxAge
domainIncludes.comment: Maximal age recommended for viewing content.

domainIncludes.label: suggestedMinAge
domainIncludes.comment: Minimal age recommended for viewing content.

Specialty.comment: Any branch of a field in which people typically develop specific expertise, usually after significant study, time, and effort.

NewsArticle.comment:
A NewsArticle is an article whose content reports news, or provides background context and supporting materials for understanding the news.

A more detailed overview of [schema.org News markup](/docs/news.html) is also available.

domainIncludes.label: dateline
domainIncludes.comment:
A [dateline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dateline) is a brief piece of text included in news articles that describes where and when the story was written or filed though the date is often omitted. Sometimes only a placename is provided.

Structured representations of dateline-related information can also be expressed more explicitly using [[locationCreated]] (which represents where a work was created e.g. where a news report was written).  For location depicted or described in the content, use [[contentLocation]].

Dateline summaries are oriented more towards human readers than towards automated processing, and can vary substantially. Some examples: "BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 2.", "Paris, France", "December 19, 2017 11:43AM Reporting from Washington", "Beijing/Moscow", "QUEZON CITY, Philippines".

domainIncludes.label: printColumn
domainIncludes.comment: The number of the column in which the NewsArticle appears in the print edition.

domainIncludes.label: printEdition
domainIncludes.comment: The edition of the print product in which the NewsArticle appears.

domainIncludes.label: printPage
domainIncludes.comment: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the name of the page on which the article is found. Please note that this field is intended for the exact page name (e.g. A5, B18).

domainIncludes.label: printSection
domainIncludes.comment: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the print section in which the article appeared.

rangeIncludes.label: associatedArticle
rangeIncludes.comment: A NewsArticle associated with the Media Object.

Product.comment: Any offered product or service. For example: a pair of shoes; a concert ticket; the rental of a car; a haircut; or an episode of a TV show streamed online.

domainIncludes.comment: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

domainIncludes.label: gtin12
domainIncludes.comment: The GTIN-12 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: gtin13
domainIncludes.comment: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: gtin14
domainIncludes.comment: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: gtin8
domainIncludes.comment: The [GTIN-8](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-8.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: height

domainIncludes.comment: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition or a textual description of the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer.

domainIncludes.comment: The model of the product. Use with the URL of a ProductModel or a textual representation of the model identifier. The URL of the ProductModel can be from an external source. It is recommended to additionally provide strong product identifiers via the gtin8/gtin13/gtin14 and mpn properties.

domainIncludes.comment: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. width, color, gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

domainIncludes.comment:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

domainIncludes.label: occupancy
domainIncludes.comment:
The allowed total occupancy for the accommodation in persons (including infants etc). For individual accommodations, this is not necessarily the legal maximum but defines the permitted usage as per the contractual agreement (e.g. a double room used by a single person).
Typical unit code(s): C62 for person

domainIncludes.comment: Position of the season within an ordered group of seasons.

domainIncludes.label: startDate
domainIncludes.comment: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

domainIncludes.label: trailer
domainIncludes.comment: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: partOfSeason
rangeIncludes.comment: The season to which this episode belongs.

rangeIncludes.label: season
rangeIncludes.comment: A season in a media series.

rangeIncludes.label: containsSeason
rangeIncludes.comment: A season that is part of the media series.

rangeIncludes.label: seasons
rangeIncludes.comment: A season in a media series.

TVSeason.comment: Season dedicated to TV broadcast and associated online delivery.

domainIncludes.label: countryOfOrigin
domainIncludes.comment: The country of the principal offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie or program.

domainIncludes.label: partOfTVSeries
domainIncludes.comment: The TV series to which this episode or season belongs.

Series.comment: A Series in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind. See also [[CreativeWorkSeries]], [[EventSeries]].

domainIncludes.label: director
domainIncludes.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

CreativeWorkSeries.comment:
A CreativeWorkSeries in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind. CreativeWorkSeries are usually organized into some order, often chronological. Unlike [[ItemList]] which is a general purpose data structure for lists of things, the emphasis with CreativeWorkSeries is on published materials (written e.g. books and periodicals, or media such as tv, radio and games).

Specific subtypes are available for describing [[TVSeries]], [[RadioSeries]], [[MovieSeries]], [[BookSeries]], [[Periodical]] and [[VideoGameSeries]]. In each case, the [[hasPart]] / [[isPartOf]] properties can be used to relate the CreativeWorkSeries to its parts. The general CreativeWorkSeries type serves largely just to organize these more specific and practical subtypes.

It is common for properties applicable to an item from the series to be usefully applied to the containing group. Schema.org attempts to anticipate some of these cases, but publishers should be free to apply properties of the series parts to the series as a whole wherever they seem appropriate.

domainIncludes.label: endDate
domainIncludes.comment: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

domainIncludes.label: startDate
domainIncludes.comment: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

domainIncludes.label: issn
domainIncludes.comment: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

rangeIncludes.label: partOfSeries

domainIncludes.label: numberOfPlayers
domainIncludes.comment: Indicate how many people can play this game (minimum, maximum, or range).

domainIncludes.label: quest
domainIncludes.comment: The task that a player-controlled character, or group of characters may complete in order to gain a reward.

domainIncludes.label: gameItem
domainIncludes.comment: An item is an object within the game world that can be collected by a player or, occasionally, a non-player character.

domainIncludes.label: characterAttribute
domainIncludes.comment: A piece of data that represents a particular aspect of a fictional character (skill, power, character points, advantage, disadvantage).

domainIncludes.label: playMode
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates whether this game is multi-player, co-op or single-player.  The game can be marked as multi-player, co-op and single-player at the same time.

domainIncludes.label: cheatCode
domainIncludes.comment: Cheat codes to the game.

domainIncludes.label: gamePlatform
domainIncludes.comment: The electronic systems used to play video games.

domainIncludes.label: gameLocation
domainIncludes.comment: Real or fictional location of the game (or part of game).

Table.comment: A table on a Web page.

TheaterGroup.comment: A theater group or company, for example, the Royal Shakespeare Company or Druid Theatre.

TouristAttraction.comment: A tourist attraction.  In principle any Thing can be a [[TouristAttraction]], from a [[Mountain]] and [[LandmarksOrHistoricalBuildings]] to a [[LocalBusiness]].  This Type can be used on its own to describe a general [[TouristAttraction]], or be used as an [[additionalType]] to add tourist attraction properties to any other type.  (See examples below)

domainIncludes.label: touristType
domainIncludes.comment: Attraction suitable for type(s) of tourist. eg. Children, visitors from a particular country, etc.

domainIncludes.label: availableLanguage
domainIncludes.comment: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]]

rangeIncludes.label: departureStation
rangeIncludes.comment: The station from which the train departs.

rangeIncludes.label: arrivalStation
rangeIncludes.comment: The station where the train trip ends.

rangeIncludes.label: schemaVersion
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates (by URL or string) a particular version of a schema used in some CreativeWork. For example, a document could declare a schemaVersion using an URL such as version/2.0/ if precise indication of schema version was required by some application.

rangeIncludes.label: acceptsReservations
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates whether a FoodEstablishment accepts reservations. Values can be Boolean, an URL at which reservations can be made or (for backwards compatibility) the strings ```Yes``` or ```No```.

rangeIncludes.label: additionalType
rangeIncludes.comment: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

rangeIncludes.label: applicationCategory
rangeIncludes.comment: Type of software application, e.g. 'Game, Multimedia'.

rangeIncludes.label: applicationSubCategory
rangeIncludes.comment: Subcategory of the application, e.g. 'Arcade Game'.

rangeIncludes.label: codeRepository
rangeIncludes.comment: Link to the repository where the un-compiled, human readable code and related code is located (SVN, github, CodePlex).

rangeIncludes.label: colleague
rangeIncludes.comment: A colleague of the person.

rangeIncludes.label: contentUrl
rangeIncludes.comment: Actual bytes of the media object, for example the image file or video file.

rangeIncludes.label: discussionUrl
rangeIncludes.comment: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.

rangeIncludes.label: downloadUrl
rangeIncludes.comment: If the file can be downloaded, URL to download the binary.

rangeIncludes.label: embedUrl
rangeIncludes.comment: A URL pointing to a player for a specific video. In general, this is the information in the ```src``` element of an ```embed``` tag and should not be the same as the content of the ```loc``` tag.

rangeIncludes.label: encodingFormat
rangeIncludes.comment:
Media type typically expressed using a MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml) and [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types)) e.g. application/zip for a SoftwareApplication binary, audio/mpeg for .mp3 etc.).

In cases where a [[CreativeWork]] has several media type representations, [[encoding]] can be used to indicate each [[MediaObject]] alongside particular [[encodingFormat]] information.

Unregistered or niche encoding and file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia/Wikidata entry.

rangeIncludes.label: featureList
rangeIncludes.comment: Features or modules provided by this application (and possibly required by other applications).

rangeIncludes.label: fileFormat
rangeIncludes.comment: Media type, typically MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml)) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.

rangeIncludes.label: genre
rangeIncludes.comment: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

rangeIncludes.label: image
rangeIncludes.comment: An image of the item. This can be a [[URL]] or a fully described [[ImageObject]].

rangeIncludes.label: installUrl
rangeIncludes.comment: URL at which the app may be installed, if different from the URL of the item.

rangeIncludes.label: isBasedOnUrl
rangeIncludes.comment: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

rangeIncludes.label: isBasedOn
rangeIncludes.comment: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

rangeIncludes.label: license
rangeIncludes.comment: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

rangeIncludes.label: logo
rangeIncludes.comment: An associated logo.

rangeIncludes.label: mainEntityOfPage
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#mainEntityBackground) for details.

rangeIncludes.label: hasMap
rangeIncludes.comment: A URL to a map of the place.

rangeIncludes.label: map
rangeIncludes.comment: A URL to a map of the place.

rangeIncludes.label: maps
rangeIncludes.comment: A URL to a map of the place.

rangeIncludes.label: memoryRequirements
rangeIncludes.comment: Minimum memory requirements.

rangeIncludes.label: hasMenu
rangeIncludes.comment: Either the actual menu as a structured representation, as text, or a URL of the menu.

rangeIncludes.label: menu
rangeIncludes.comment: Either the actual menu as a structured representation, as text, or a URL of the menu.

rangeIncludes.label: paymentUrl
rangeIncludes.comment: The URL for sending a payment.

rangeIncludes.label: publishingPrinciples
rangeIncludes.comment:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via [[URL]]) a document describing the editorial principles of an [[Organization]] (or individual e.g. a [[Person]] writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a [[CreativeWork]] (e.g. [[NewsArticle]]) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the [[CreativeWork]].

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a [[funder]]) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

rangeIncludes.label: relatedLink
rangeIncludes.comment: A link related to this web page, for example to other related web pages.

rangeIncludes.label: releaseNotes
rangeIncludes.comment: Description of what changed in this version.

rangeIncludes.label: replyToUrl
rangeIncludes.comment: The URL at which a reply may be posted to the specified UserComment.

rangeIncludes.label: requirements
rangeIncludes.comment: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

rangeIncludes.label: softwareRequirements
rangeIncludes.comment: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

rangeIncludes.label: sameAs
rangeIncludes.comment: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

rangeIncludes.label: screenshot
rangeIncludes.comment: A link to a screenshot image of the app.

rangeIncludes.label: serviceUrl
rangeIncludes.comment: The website to access the service.

rangeIncludes.label: significantLink
rangeIncludes.comment: One of the more significant URLs on the page. Typically, these are the non-navigation links that are clicked on the most.

rangeIncludes.label: significantLinks
rangeIncludes.comment: The most significant URLs on the page. Typically, these are the non-navigation links that are clicked on the most.

rangeIncludes.label: storageRequirements
rangeIncludes.comment: Storage requirements (free space required).

rangeIncludes.label: targetUrl
rangeIncludes.comment: The URL of a node in an established educational framework.

rangeIncludes.label: temporalCoverage
rangeIncludes.comment:
The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a DateTime or as a textual string indicating a time period in [ISO 8601 time interval format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Time_intervals). In
      the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written "2011/2012"). Other forms of content e.g. ScholarlyArticle, Book, TVSeries or TVEpisode may indicate their temporalCoverage in broader terms - textually or via well-known URL.
