      Written works such as books may sometimes have precise temporal coverage too, e.g. a work set in 1939 - 1945 can be indicated in ISO 8601 interval format format via "1939/1945".

Open-ended date ranges can be written with ".." in place of the end date. For example, "2015-11/.." indicates a range beginning in November 2015 and with no specified final date. This is tentative and might be updated in future when ISO 8601 is officially updated.

rangeIncludes.label: thumbnailUrl
rangeIncludes.comment: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.

rangeIncludes.label: trackingUrl
rangeIncludes.comment: Tracking url for the parcel delivery.

rangeIncludes.label: unitCode
rangeIncludes.comment: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

rangeIncludes.label: url
rangeIncludes.comment: URL of the item.

rangeIncludes.label: ticketToken
rangeIncludes.comment: Reference to an asset (e.g., Barcode, QR code image or PDF) usable for entrance.

rangeIncludes.label: namedPosition
rangeIncludes.comment: A position played, performed or filled by a person or organization, as part of an organization. For example, an athlete in a SportsTeam might play in the position named 'Quarterback'.

rangeIncludes.label: roleName
rangeIncludes.comment: A role played, performed or filled by a person or organization. For example, the team of creators for a comic book might fill the roles named 'inker', 'penciller', and 'letterer'; or an athlete in a SportsTeam might play in the position named 'Quarterback'.

rangeIncludes.label: gamePlatform
rangeIncludes.comment: The electronic systems used to play video games.

rangeIncludes.label: gameLocation
rangeIncludes.comment: Real or fictional location of the game (or part of game).

rangeIncludes.label: sport
rangeIncludes.comment: A type of sport (e.g. Baseball).

rangeIncludes.label: artform
rangeIncludes.comment: e.g. Painting, Drawing, Sculpture, Print, Photograph, Assemblage, Collage, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: material
rangeIncludes.comment: A material that something is made from, e.g. leather, wool, cotton, paper.

rangeIncludes.label: artMedium
rangeIncludes.comment: The material used. (e.g. Oil, Watercolour, Acrylic, Linoprint, Marble, Cyanotype, Digital, Lithograph, DryPoint, Intaglio, Pastel, Woodcut, Pencil, Mixed Media, etc.)

rangeIncludes.label: surface
rangeIncludes.comment: A material used as a surface in some artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: artworkSurface
rangeIncludes.comment: The supporting materials for the artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: propertyID
rangeIncludes.comment:
A commonly used identifier for the characteristic represented by the property, e.g. a manufacturer or a standard code for a property. propertyID can be
(1) a prefixed string, mainly meant to be used with standards for product properties; (2) a site-specific, non-prefixed string (e.g. the primary key of the property or the vendor-specific id of the property), or (3)
a URL indicating the type of the property, either pointing to an external vocabulary, or a Web resource that describes the property (e.g. a glossary entry).
Standards bodies should promote a standard prefix for the identifiers of properties from their standards.

rangeIncludes.label: fuelType
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

rangeIncludes.label: vehicleTransmission
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of component used for transmitting the power from a rotating power source to the wheels or other relevant component(s) ("gearbox" for cars).

rangeIncludes.label: feesAndCommissionsSpecification
rangeIncludes.comment: Description of fees, commissions, and other terms applied either to a class of financial product, or by a financial service organization.

rangeIncludes.label: afterMedia
rangeIncludes.comment: A media object representing the circumstances after performing this direction.

rangeIncludes.label: beforeMedia
rangeIncludes.comment: A media object representing the circumstances before performing this direction.

rangeIncludes.label: duringMedia
rangeIncludes.comment: A media object representing the circumstances while performing this direction.

rangeIncludes.label: courseMode
rangeIncludes.comment: The medium or means of delivery of the course instance or the mode of study, either as a text label (e.g. "online", "onsite" or "blended"; "synchronous" or "asynchronous"; "full-time" or "part-time") or as a URL reference to a term from a controlled vocabulary (e.g. https://ceds.ed.gov/element/001311#Asynchronous ).

rangeIncludes.label: identifier
rangeIncludes.comment: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of [[Thing]], such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#identifierBg) for more details.

rangeIncludes.label: speakable
rangeIncludes.comment:
Indicates sections of a Web page that are particularly 'speakable' in the sense of being highlighted as being especially appropriate for text-to-speech conversion. Other sections of a page may also be usefully spoken in particular circumstances; the 'speakable' property serves to indicate the parts most likely to be generally useful for speech.

The *speakable* property can be repeated an arbitrary number of times, with three kinds of possible 'content-locator' values:

1.) *id-value* URL references - uses *id-value* of an element in the page being annotated. The simplest use of *speakable* has (potentially relative) URL values, referencing identified sections of the document concerned.

2.) CSS Selectors - addresses content in the annotated page, eg. via class attribute. Use the [[cssSelector]] property.

3.)  XPaths - addresses content via XPaths (assuming an XML view of the content). Use the [[xpath]] property.


For more sophisticated markup of speakable sections beyond simple ID references, either CSS selectors or XPath expressions to pick out document section(s) as speakable. For this
we define a supporting type, [[SpeakableSpecification]]  which is defined to be a possible value of the *speakable* property.

UserInteraction.comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

UserBlocks.comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

UserCheckins.comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

UserComments.comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

domainIncludes.label: commentText
domainIncludes.comment: The text of the UserComment.

domainIncludes.label: commentTime
domainIncludes.comment: The time at which the UserComment was made.

domainIncludes.label: creator
domainIncludes.comment: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

domainIncludes.label: discusses
domainIncludes.comment: Specifies the CreativeWork associated with the UserComment.

domainIncludes.label: replyToUrl
domainIncludes.comment: The URL at which a reply may be posted to the specified UserComment.

UserDownloads.comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

UserLikes.comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

UserPageVisits.comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

UserPlays.comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

UserPlusOnes.comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

UserTweets.comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

VideoGallery.comment: Web page type: Video gallery page.

domainIncludes.label: actor
domainIncludes.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: actors
domainIncludes.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: caption
domainIncludes.comment: The caption for this object. For downloadable machine formats (closed caption, subtitles etc.) use MediaObject and indicate the [[encodingFormat]].

domainIncludes.label: director
domainIncludes.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: directors
domainIncludes.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: musicBy
domainIncludes.comment: The composer of the soundtrack.

domainIncludes.label: thumbnail
domainIncludes.comment: Thumbnail image for an image or video.

domainIncludes.label: transcript
domainIncludes.comment: If this MediaObject is an AudioObject or VideoObject, the transcript of that object.

domainIncludes.label: videoFrameSize
domainIncludes.comment: The frame size of the video.

domainIncludes.label: videoQuality
domainIncludes.comment: The quality of the video.

rangeIncludes.label: trailer
rangeIncludes.comment: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: video
rangeIncludes.comment: An embedded video object.

ExhibitionEvent.comment: Event type: Exhibition event, e.g. at a museum, library, archive, tradeshow, ...

WPAdBlock.comment: An advertising section of the page.

WPFooter.comment: The footer section of the page.

WPHeader.comment: The header section of the page.

WPSideBar.comment: A sidebar section of the page.

domainIncludes.label: browserRequirements
domainIncludes.comment: Specifies browser requirements in human-readable text. For example, 'requires HTML5 support'.

Brand.comment: A brand is a name used by an organization or business person for labeling a product, product group, or similar.

domainIncludes.label: aggregateRating
domainIncludes.comment: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

domainIncludes.label: logo
domainIncludes.comment: An associated logo.

domainIncludes.label: review
domainIncludes.comment: A review of the item.

domainIncludes.label: slogan
domainIncludes.comment: A slogan or motto associated with the item.

rangeIncludes.label: brand
rangeIncludes.comment: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

BusinessEntityType.comment:
A business entity type is a conceptual entity representing the legal form, the size, the main line of business, the position in the value chain, or any combination thereof, of an organization or business person.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Business
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Enduser
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PublicInstitution
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Reseller

rangeIncludes.label: eligibleCustomerType
rangeIncludes.comment: The type(s) of customers for which the given offer is valid.

CreditCard.comment:
A card payment method of a particular brand or name.  Used to mark up a particular payment method and/or the financial product/service that supplies the card account.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#AmericanExpress
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DinersClub
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Discover
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#JCB
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#MasterCard
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#VISA

BusinessFunction.comment:
The business function specifies the type of activity or access (i.e., the bundle of rights) offered by the organization or business person through the offer. Typical are sell, rental or lease, maintenance or repair, manufacture / produce, recycle / dispose, engineering / construction, or installation. Proprietary specifications of access rights are also instances of this class.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ConstructionInstallation
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Dispose
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#LeaseOut
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Maintain
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ProvideService
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Repair
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Buy

rangeIncludes.label: businessFunction
rangeIncludes.comment: The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.

PaymentMethod.comment:
A payment method is a standardized procedure for transferring the monetary amount for a purchase. Payment methods are characterized by the legal and technical structures used, and by the organization or group carrying out the transaction.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ByBankTransferInAdvance
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ByInvoice
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Cash
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#CheckInAdvance
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#COD
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DirectDebit
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#GoogleCheckout
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PayPal
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PaySwarm

rangeIncludes.label: acceptedPaymentMethod
rangeIncludes.comment: The payment method(s) accepted by seller for this offer.

rangeIncludes.label: appliesToPaymentMethod
rangeIncludes.comment: The payment method(s) to which the payment charge specification applies.

rangeIncludes.label: paymentMethod
rangeIncludes.comment: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

rangeIncludes.label: paymentMethod
rangeIncludes.comment: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

DayOfWeek.comment:
The day of the week, e.g. used to specify to which day the opening hours of an OpeningHoursSpecification refer.

Originally, URLs from [GoodRelations](http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1) were used (for [[Monday]], [[Tuesday]], [[Wednesday]], [[Thursday]], [[Friday]], [[Saturday]], [[Sunday]] plus a special entry for [[PublicHolidays]]); these have now been integrated directly into schema.org.

rangeIncludes.label: dayOfWeek
rangeIncludes.comment: The day of the week for which these opening hours are valid.

PriceSpecification.comment: A structured value representing a price or price range. Typically, only the subclasses of this type are used for markup. It is recommended to use [[MonetaryAmount]] to describe independent amounts of money such as a salary, credit card limits, etc.

domainIncludes.label: eligibleQuantity
domainIncludes.comment: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

domainIncludes.label: eligibleTransactionVolume
domainIncludes.comment: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

domainIncludes.label: maxPrice
domainIncludes.comment: The highest price if the price is a range.

domainIncludes.label: minPrice
domainIncludes.comment: The lowest price if the price is a range.

domainIncludes.label: price
domainIncludes.comment:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

* Use the [[priceCurrency]] property (with standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR") instead of including [ambiguous symbols](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollar_sign#Currencies_that_use_the_dollar_or_peso_sign) such as '$' in the value.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
* Note that both [RDFa](http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-rdfa-primer/#using-the-content-attribute) and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

domainIncludes.label: validFrom
domainIncludes.comment: The date when the item becomes valid.

domainIncludes.label: validFrom
domainIncludes.comment: The date when the item becomes valid.

domainIncludes.label: validThrough
domainIncludes.comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

domainIncludes.label: validThrough
domainIncludes.comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

domainIncludes.label: valueAddedTaxIncluded
domainIncludes.comment: Specifies whether the applicable value-added tax (VAT) is included in the price specification or not.

domainIncludes.label: priceCurrency
domainIncludes.comment: The currency of the price, or a price component when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

rangeIncludes.label: baseSalary
rangeIncludes.comment: The base salary of the job or of an employee in an EmployeeRole.

rangeIncludes.label: eligibleTransactionVolume
rangeIncludes.comment: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

rangeIncludes.label: netWorth
rangeIncludes.comment: The total financial value of the person as calculated by subtracting assets from liabilities.

rangeIncludes.label: priceSpecification
rangeIncludes.comment: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

rangeIncludes.label: totalPrice
rangeIncludes.comment:
The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

rangeIncludes.label: totalPaymentDue
rangeIncludes.comment: The total amount due.

rangeIncludes.label: minimumPaymentDue
rangeIncludes.comment: The minimum payment required at this time.

DeliveryChargeSpecification.comment: The price for the delivery of an offer using a particular delivery method.

domainIncludes.label: appliesToDeliveryMethod
domainIncludes.comment: The delivery method(s) to which the delivery charge or payment charge specification applies.

domainIncludes.label: areaServed
domainIncludes.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

domainIncludes.label: eligibleRegion
domainIncludes.comment: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.\n\nSee also [[ineligibleRegion]].

domainIncludes.label: ineligibleRegion
domainIncludes.comment: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

DeliveryMethod.comment:
A delivery method is a standardized procedure for transferring the product or service to the destination of fulfillment chosen by the customer. Delivery methods are characterized by the means of transportation used, and by the organization or group that is the contracting party for the sending organization or person.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeDirectDownload
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeFreight
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeMail
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeOwnFleet
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModePickUp
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DHL
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#FederalExpress
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#UPS

rangeIncludes.label: appliesToDeliveryMethod
rangeIncludes.comment: The delivery method(s) to which the delivery charge or payment charge specification applies.

rangeIncludes.label: availableDeliveryMethod
rangeIncludes.comment: The delivery method(s) available for this offer.

rangeIncludes.label: deliveryMethod
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. The method of delivery.

rangeIncludes.label: hasDeliveryMethod
rangeIncludes.comment: Method used for delivery or shipping.

Demand.comment: A demand entity represents the public, not necessarily binding, not necessarily exclusive, announcement by an organization or person to seek a certain type of goods or services. For describing demand using this type, the very same properties used for Offer apply.

domainIncludes.label: acceptedPaymentMethod
domainIncludes.comment: The payment method(s) accepted by seller for this offer.

domainIncludes.label: advanceBookingRequirement
domainIncludes.comment: The amount of time that is required between accepting the offer and the actual usage of the resource or service.

domainIncludes.label: areaServed
domainIncludes.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

domainIncludes.label: availability
domainIncludes.comment: The availability of this item—for example In stock, Out of stock, Pre-order, etc.

domainIncludes.label: availabilityEnds
domainIncludes.comment: The end of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

domainIncludes.label: availabilityStarts
domainIncludes.comment: The beginning of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

domainIncludes.label: availableAtOrFrom
domainIncludes.comment: The place(s) from which the offer can be obtained (e.g. store locations).

domainIncludes.label: availableDeliveryMethod
domainIncludes.comment: The delivery method(s) available for this offer.

domainIncludes.label: businessFunction
domainIncludes.comment: The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.

domainIncludes.label: deliveryLeadTime
domainIncludes.comment: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods either leaving the warehouse or being prepared for pickup, in case the delivery method is on site pickup.

domainIncludes.label: eligibleCustomerType
domainIncludes.comment: The type(s) of customers for which the given offer is valid.

domainIncludes.label: eligibleDuration
domainIncludes.comment: The duration for which the given offer is valid.

domainIncludes.label: eligibleQuantity
domainIncludes.comment: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

domainIncludes.label: eligibleRegion
domainIncludes.comment: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.\n\nSee also [[ineligibleRegion]].

domainIncludes.label: ineligibleRegion
domainIncludes.comment: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

domainIncludes.label: eligibleTransactionVolume
domainIncludes.comment: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

domainIncludes.label: gtin12
domainIncludes.comment: The GTIN-12 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: gtin13
domainIncludes.comment: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: gtin14
domainIncludes.comment: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: gtin8
domainIncludes.comment: The [GTIN-8](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-8.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: includesObject
domainIncludes.comment: This links to a node or nodes indicating the exact quantity of the products included in the offer.

domainIncludes.label: inventoryLevel
domainIncludes.comment: The current approximate inventory level for the item or items.

domainIncludes.label: itemCondition
domainIncludes.comment: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition or a textual description of the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer.

domainIncludes.label: itemOffered
domainIncludes.comment: The item being offered.

domainIncludes.label: mpn
domainIncludes.comment: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

domainIncludes.label: priceSpecification
domainIncludes.comment: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

domainIncludes.label: seller
domainIncludes.comment: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.

domainIncludes.label: serialNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.

domainIncludes.label: sku
domainIncludes.comment: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

domainIncludes.label: validFrom
domainIncludes.comment: The date when the item becomes valid.

domainIncludes.label: validThrough
domainIncludes.comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

domainIncludes.label: warranty
domainIncludes.comment: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

rangeIncludes.label: seeks
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

IndividualProduct.comment: A single, identifiable product instance (e.g. a laptop with a particular serial number).

domainIncludes.label: serialNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.

OpeningHoursSpecification.comment:
A structured value providing information about the opening hours of a place or a certain service inside a place.


The place is __open__ if the [[opens]] property is specified, and __closed__ otherwise.

If the value for the [[closes]] property is less than the value for the [[opens]] property then the hour range is assumed to span over the next day.

domainIncludes.label: closes
domainIncludes.comment: The closing hour of the place or service on the given day(s) of the week.

domainIncludes.label: dayOfWeek
domainIncludes.comment: The day of the week for which these opening hours are valid.

domainIncludes.label: opens
domainIncludes.comment: The opening hour of the place or service on the given day(s) of the week.

domainIncludes.label: validFrom
domainIncludes.comment: The date when the item becomes valid.

domainIncludes.label: validThrough
domainIncludes.comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

rangeIncludes.label: hoursAvailable
rangeIncludes.comment: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

rangeIncludes.label: openingHoursSpecification
rangeIncludes.comment: The opening hours of a certain place.

rangeIncludes.label: specialOpeningHoursSpecification
rangeIncludes.comment: The special opening hours of a certain place.\n\nUse this to explicitly override general opening hours brought in scope by [[openingHoursSpecification]] or [[openingHours]].

OwnershipInfo.comment: A structured value providing information about when a certain organization or person owned a certain product.

domainIncludes.label: acquiredFrom
domainIncludes.comment: The organization or person from which the product was acquired.

domainIncludes.label: ownedFrom
domainIncludes.comment: The date and time of obtaining the product.

domainIncludes.label: ownedThrough
domainIncludes.comment: The date and time of giving up ownership on the product.

domainIncludes.label: typeOfGood
domainIncludes.comment: The product that this structured value is referring to.

rangeIncludes.label: owns
rangeIncludes.comment: Products owned by the organization or person.

ParcelService.comment:
A private parcel service as the delivery mode available for a certain offer.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DHL
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#FederalExpress
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#UPS

PaymentChargeSpecification.comment: The costs of settling the payment using a particular payment method.

domainIncludes.label: appliesToDeliveryMethod
domainIncludes.comment: The delivery method(s) to which the delivery charge or payment charge specification applies.

domainIncludes.label: appliesToPaymentMethod
domainIncludes.comment: The payment method(s) to which the payment charge specification applies.

ProductModel.comment: A datasheet or vendor specification of a product (in the sense of a prototypical description).

domainIncludes.label: isVariantOf
domainIncludes.comment: A pointer to a base product from which this product is a variant. It is safe to infer that the variant inherits all product features from the base model, unless defined locally. This is not transitive.

domainIncludes.label: predecessorOf
domainIncludes.comment: A pointer from a previous, often discontinued variant of the product to its newer variant.

domainIncludes.label: successorOf
domainIncludes.comment: A pointer from a newer variant of a product  to its previous, often discontinued predecessor.

rangeIncludes.label: isVariantOf
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer to a base product from which this product is a variant. It is safe to infer that the variant inherits all product features from the base model, unless defined locally. This is not transitive.

rangeIncludes.label: model
rangeIncludes.comment: The model of the product. Use with the URL of a ProductModel or a textual representation of the model identifier. The URL of the ProductModel can be from an external source. It is recommended to additionally provide strong product identifiers via the gtin8/gtin13/gtin14 and mpn properties.

rangeIncludes.label: predecessorOf
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer from a previous, often discontinued variant of the product to its newer variant.

rangeIncludes.label: successorOf
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer from a newer variant of a product  to its previous, often discontinued predecessor.

QualitativeValue.comment: A predefined value for a product characteristic, e.g. the power cord plug type 'US' or the garment sizes 'S', 'M', 'L', and 'XL'.

domainIncludes.label: equal
domainIncludes.comment: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is equal to the object.

domainIncludes.label: greater
domainIncludes.comment: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is greater than the object.

domainIncludes.label: greaterOrEqual
domainIncludes.comment: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is greater than or equal to the object.

domainIncludes.label: lesser
domainIncludes.comment: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is lesser than the object.

domainIncludes.label: lesserOrEqual
domainIncludes.comment: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is lesser than or equal to the object.

domainIncludes.label: nonEqual
domainIncludes.comment: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is not equal to the object.

domainIncludes.label: valueReference
domainIncludes.comment: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.

domainIncludes.label: additionalProperty
domainIncludes.comment: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. width, color, gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

rangeIncludes.label: equal
rangeIncludes.comment: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is equal to the object.

rangeIncludes.label: greater
rangeIncludes.comment: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is greater than the object.

rangeIncludes.label: greaterOrEqual
rangeIncludes.comment: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is greater than or equal to the object.

rangeIncludes.label: lesser
rangeIncludes.comment: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is lesser than the object.

rangeIncludes.label: lesserOrEqual
rangeIncludes.comment: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is lesser than or equal to the object.

rangeIncludes.label: nonEqual
rangeIncludes.comment: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is not equal to the object.

rangeIncludes.label: valueReference
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.

rangeIncludes.label: seatingType
rangeIncludes.comment: The type/class of the seat.

rangeIncludes.label: passengerPriorityStatus
rangeIncludes.comment: The priority status assigned to a passenger for security or boarding (e.g. FastTrack or Priority).

rangeIncludes.label: lodgingUnitType
rangeIncludes.comment: Textual description of the unit type (including suite vs. room, size of bed, etc.).

rangeIncludes.label: fuelType
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

rangeIncludes.label: vehicleTransmission
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of component used for transmitting the power from a rotating power source to the wheels or other relevant component(s) ("gearbox" for cars).

QuantitativeValue.comment: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

domainIncludes.label: maxValue
domainIncludes.comment: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

domainIncludes.label: minValue
domainIncludes.comment: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

domainIncludes.label: unitCode
domainIncludes.comment: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

domainIncludes.label: value
domainIncludes.comment:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

domainIncludes.label: valueReference
domainIncludes.comment: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.

domainIncludes.label: additionalProperty
domainIncludes.comment: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. width, color, gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

domainIncludes.label: unitText
domainIncludes.comment: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

rangeIncludes.label: advanceBookingRequirement
rangeIncludes.comment: The amount of time that is required between accepting the offer and the actual usage of the resource or service.

rangeIncludes.label: deliveryLeadTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods either leaving the warehouse or being prepared for pickup, in case the delivery method is on site pickup.

rangeIncludes.label: depth
rangeIncludes.comment: The depth of the item.

rangeIncludes.label: durationOfWarranty
rangeIncludes.comment: The duration of the warranty promise. Common unitCode values are ANN for year, MON for months, or DAY for days.

rangeIncludes.label: eligibleDuration
rangeIncludes.comment: The duration for which the given offer is valid.

rangeIncludes.label: eligibleQuantity
rangeIncludes.comment: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

rangeIncludes.label: height
rangeIncludes.comment: The height of the item.

rangeIncludes.label: inventoryLevel
rangeIncludes.comment: The current approximate inventory level for the item or items.

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfEmployees
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of employees in an organization e.g. business.

rangeIncludes.label: valueReference
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.

rangeIncludes.label: weight
rangeIncludes.comment: The weight of the product or person.

rangeIncludes.label: width
rangeIncludes.comment: The width of the item.

rangeIncludes.label: yearlyRevenue
rangeIncludes.comment: The size of the business in annual revenue.

rangeIncludes.label: yearsInOperation
rangeIncludes.comment: The age of the business.

rangeIncludes.label: partySize
rangeIncludes.comment: Number of people the reservation should accommodate.

rangeIncludes.label: numAdults
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of adults staying in the unit.

rangeIncludes.label: numChildren
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of children staying in the unit.

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfPlayers
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicate how many people can play this game (minimum, maximum, or range).

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfDoors
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of doors.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfAxles
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of axles.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

rangeIncludes.label: fuelConsumption
rangeIncludes.comment:
The amount of fuel consumed for traveling a particular distance or temporal duration with the given vehicle (e.g. liters per 100 km).

* Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for liters per 100 km.  Use [[unitText]] to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. L/100 km.
* Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, [[fuelConsumption]] (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and [[fuelEfficiency]] (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
* Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use [[valueReference]] to link the value for the fuel consumption to another value.

rangeIncludes.label: fuelEfficiency
rangeIncludes.comment:
The distance traveled per unit of fuel used; most commonly miles per gallon (mpg) or kilometers per liter (km/L).

* Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for miles per gallon or kilometers per liter. Use [[unitText]] to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. mpg or km/L.
* Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, [[fuelConsumption]] (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and [[fuelEfficiency]] (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
* Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use [[valueReference]] to link the value for the fuel economy to another value.

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfForwardGears
rangeIncludes.comment: The total number of forward gears available for the transmission system of the vehicle.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

rangeIncludes.label: cargoVolume
rangeIncludes.comment:
The available volume for cargo or luggage. For automobiles, this is usually the trunk volume.

Typical unit code(s): LTR for liters, FTQ for cubic foot/feet

Note: You can use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate ranges.

rangeIncludes.label: mileageFromOdometer
rangeIncludes.comment: The total distance travelled by the particular vehicle since its initial production, as read from its odometer.\n\nTypical unit code(s): KMT for kilometers, SMI for statute miles

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfPreviousOwners
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of owners of the vehicle, including the current one.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

rangeIncludes.label: vehicleSeatingCapacity
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of passengers that can be seated in the vehicle, both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62 for persons.

rangeIncludes.label: recipeYield
rangeIncludes.comment: The quantity produced by the recipe (for example, number of people served, number of servings, etc).

rangeIncludes.label: referenceQuantity
rangeIncludes.comment: The reference quantity for which a certain price applies, e.g. 1 EUR per 4 kWh of electricity. This property is a replacement for unitOfMeasurement for the advanced cases where the price does not relate to a standard unit.

rangeIncludes.label: annualPercentageRate
rangeIncludes.comment: The annual rate that is charged for borrowing (or made by investing), expressed as a single percentage number that represents the actual yearly cost of funds over the term of a loan. This includes any fees or additional costs associated with the transaction.

rangeIncludes.label: interestRate
rangeIncludes.comment: The interest rate, charged or paid, applicable to the financial product. Note: This is different from the calculated annualPercentageRate.

rangeIncludes.label: loanTerm
rangeIncludes.comment: The duration of the loan or credit agreement.

rangeIncludes.label: referenceQuantity
rangeIncludes.comment: The reference quantity for which a certain price applies, e.g. 1 EUR per 4 kWh of electricity. This property is a replacement for unitOfMeasurement for the advanced cases where the price does not relate to a standard unit.

rangeIncludes.label: numberOfRooms
rangeIncludes.comment:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

rangeIncludes.label: floorSize
rangeIncludes.comment:
The size of the accommodation, e.g. in square meter or squarefoot.
Typical unit code(s): MTK for square meter, FTK for square foot, or YDK for square yard

rangeIncludes.label: occupancy
rangeIncludes.comment:
The allowed total occupancy for the accommodation in persons (including infants etc). For individual accommodations, this is not necessarily the legal maximum but defines the permitted usage as per the contractual agreement (e.g. a double room used by a single person).
Typical unit code(s): C62 for person

rangeIncludes.label: yield
rangeIncludes.comment: The quantity that results by performing instructions. For example, a paper airplane, 10 personalized candles.

rangeIncludes.label: requiredQuantity
rangeIncludes.comment: The required quantity of the item(s).

rangeIncludes.label: broadcastFrequencyValue
rangeIncludes.comment: The frequency in MHz for a particular broadcast.

SomeProducts.comment: A placeholder for multiple similar products of the same kind.

domainIncludes.label: inventoryLevel
domainIncludes.comment: The current approximate inventory level for the item or items.

TypeAndQuantityNode.comment: A structured value indicating the quantity, unit of measurement, and business function of goods included in a bundle offer.

domainIncludes.label: amountOfThisGood
domainIncludes.comment: The quantity of the goods included in the offer.

domainIncludes.label: businessFunction
domainIncludes.comment: The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.

domainIncludes.label: typeOfGood
domainIncludes.comment: The product that this structured value is referring to.

domainIncludes.label: unitCode
domainIncludes.comment: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

domainIncludes.label: unitText
domainIncludes.comment: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

rangeIncludes.label: includesObject
rangeIncludes.comment: This links to a node or nodes indicating the exact quantity of the products included in the offer.

UnitPriceSpecification.comment: The price asked for a given offer by the respective organization or person.

domainIncludes.label: billingIncrement
domainIncludes.comment: This property specifies the minimal quantity and rounding increment that will be the basis for the billing. The unit of measurement is specified by the unitCode property.

domainIncludes.label: priceType
domainIncludes.comment: A short text or acronym indicating multiple price specifications for the same offer, e.g. SRP for the suggested retail price or INVOICE for the invoice price, mostly used in the car industry.

domainIncludes.label: unitCode
domainIncludes.comment: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

domainIncludes.label: unitText
domainIncludes.comment: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

domainIncludes.label: referenceQuantity
domainIncludes.comment: The reference quantity for which a certain price applies, e.g. 1 EUR per 4 kWh of electricity. This property is a replacement for unitOfMeasurement for the advanced cases where the price does not relate to a standard unit.

domainIncludes.label: referenceQuantity
domainIncludes.comment: The reference quantity for which a certain price applies, e.g. 1 EUR per 4 kWh of electricity. This property is a replacement for unitOfMeasurement for the advanced cases where the price does not relate to a standard unit.

rangeIncludes.label: priceComponent
rangeIncludes.comment: This property links to all [[UnitPriceSpecification]] nodes that apply in parallel for the [[CompoundPriceSpecification]] node.

WarrantyPromise.comment: A structured value representing the duration and scope of services that will be provided to a customer free of charge in case of a defect or malfunction of a product.

domainIncludes.label: durationOfWarranty
domainIncludes.comment: The duration of the warranty promise. Common unitCode values are ANN for year, MON for months, or DAY for days.

domainIncludes.label: warrantyScope
domainIncludes.comment: The scope of the warranty promise.

rangeIncludes.label: warranty
rangeIncludes.comment: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

rangeIncludes.label: warrantyPromise
rangeIncludes.comment: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

WarrantyScope.comment:
A range of of services that will be provided to a customer free of charge in case of a defect or malfunction of a product.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Labor-BringIn
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-BringIn
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-PickUp

rangeIncludes.label: warrantyScope
rangeIncludes.comment: The scope of the warranty promise.

TechArticle.comment: A technical article - Example: How-to (task) topics, step-by-step, procedural troubleshooting, specifications, etc.

domainIncludes.label: dependencies
domainIncludes.comment: Prerequisites needed to fulfill steps in article.

domainIncludes.label: proficiencyLevel
domainIncludes.comment: Proficiency needed for this content; expected values: 'Beginner', 'Expert'.

APIReference.comment: Reference documentation for application programming interfaces (APIs).

domainIncludes.label: assembly
domainIncludes.comment: Library file name e.g., mscorlib.dll, system.web.dll.

domainIncludes.label: executableLibraryName
domainIncludes.comment: Library file name e.g., mscorlib.dll, system.web.dll.

domainIncludes.label: assemblyVersion
domainIncludes.comment: Associated product/technology version. e.g., .NET Framework 4.5.

domainIncludes.label: programmingModel
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates whether API is managed or unmanaged.

domainIncludes.label: targetPlatform
domainIncludes.comment: Type of app development: phone, Metro style, desktop, XBox, etc.

Code.comment: Computer programming source code. Example: Full (compile ready) solutions, code snippet samples, scripts, templates.

SoftwareSourceCode.comment: Computer programming source code. Example: Full (compile ready) solutions, code snippet samples, scripts, templates.

domainIncludes.label: codeRepository
domainIncludes.comment: Link to the repository where the un-compiled, human readable code and related code is located (SVN, github, CodePlex).

domainIncludes.label: programmingLanguage
domainIncludes.comment: The computer programming language.

domainIncludes.label: runtime
domainIncludes.comment: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (Example - Java v1, Python2.3, .Net Framework 3.0).

domainIncludes.label: runtimePlatform
domainIncludes.comment: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (Example - Java v1, Python2.3, .Net Framework 3.0).

domainIncludes.label: sampleType
domainIncludes.comment: What type of code sample: full (compile ready) solution, code snippet, inline code, scripts, template.

domainIncludes.label: codeSampleType
domainIncludes.comment: What type of code sample: full (compile ready) solution, code snippet, inline code, scripts, template.

domainIncludes.label: targetProduct
domainIncludes.comment: Target Operating System / Product to which the code applies.  If applies to several versions, just the product name can be used.

ParentAudience.comment: A set of characteristics describing parents, who can be interested in viewing some content.

domainIncludes.label: childMaxAge
domainIncludes.comment: Maximal age of the child.

domainIncludes.label: childMinAge
domainIncludes.comment: Minimal age of the child.

AlignmentObject.comment: An intangible item that describes an alignment between a learning resource and a node in an educational framework.

domainIncludes.label: alignmentType
domainIncludes.comment: A category of alignment between the learning resource and the framework node. Recommended values include: 'assesses', 'teaches', 'requires', 'textComplexity', 'readingLevel', 'educationalSubject', and 'educationalLevel'.

domainIncludes.label: educationalFramework
domainIncludes.comment: The framework to which the resource being described is aligned.

domainIncludes.label: targetDescription
domainIncludes.comment: The description of a node in an established educational framework.

domainIncludes.label: targetName
domainIncludes.comment: The name of a node in an established educational framework.

domainIncludes.label: targetUrl
domainIncludes.comment: The URL of a node in an established educational framework.

rangeIncludes.label: educationalAlignment
rangeIncludes.comment: An alignment to an established educational framework.

rangeIncludes.label: coursePrerequisites
rangeIncludes.comment: Requirements for taking the Course. May be completion of another [[Course]] or a textual description like "permission of instructor". Requirements may be a pre-requisite competency, referenced using [[AlignmentObject]].

domainIncludes.label: educationalRole
domainIncludes.comment: An educationalRole of an EducationalAudience.

domainIncludes.label: dataset
domainIncludes.comment: A dataset contained in this catalog.

rangeIncludes.label: catalog
rangeIncludes.comment: A data catalog which contains this dataset.

rangeIncludes.label: includedDataCatalog
rangeIncludes.comment: A data catalog which contains this dataset (this property was previously 'catalog', preferred name is now 'includedInDataCatalog').

rangeIncludes.label: includedInDataCatalog
rangeIncludes.comment: A data catalog which contains this dataset.

rangeIncludes.label: distribution
rangeIncludes.comment: A downloadable form of this dataset, at a specific location, in a specific format.

Dataset.comment: A body of structured information describing some topic(s) of interest.

domainIncludes.label: catalog
domainIncludes.comment: A data catalog which contains this dataset.

domainIncludes.label: includedDataCatalog
domainIncludes.comment: A data catalog which contains this dataset (this property was previously 'catalog', preferred name is now 'includedInDataCatalog').

domainIncludes.label: includedInDataCatalog
domainIncludes.comment: A data catalog which contains this dataset.

domainIncludes.label: distribution
domainIncludes.comment: A downloadable form of this dataset, at a specific location, in a specific format.

domainIncludes.label: datasetTimeInterval
domainIncludes.comment: The range of temporal applicability of a dataset, e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 (in ISO 8601 time interval format).

domainIncludes.label: issn
domainIncludes.comment: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

rangeIncludes.label: dataset
rangeIncludes.comment: A dataset contained in this catalog.

PublicationEvent.comment: A PublicationEvent corresponds indifferently to the event of publication for a CreativeWork of any type e.g. a broadcast event, an on-demand event, a book/journal publication via a variety of delivery media.

domainIncludes.label: free
domainIncludes.comment: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

domainIncludes.label: isAccessibleForFree
domainIncludes.comment: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

domainIncludes.label: publishedOn
domainIncludes.comment: A broadcast service associated with the publication event.

rangeIncludes.label: publication
rangeIncludes.comment: A publication event associated with the item.

rangeIncludes.label: releasedEvent
rangeIncludes.comment: The place and time the release was issued, expressed as a PublicationEvent.

BroadcastEvent.comment: An over the air or online broadcast event.

domainIncludes.label: videoFormat
domainIncludes.comment: The type of screening or video broadcast used (e.g. IMAX, 3D, SD, HD, etc.).

domainIncludes.label: broadcastOfEvent
domainIncludes.comment: The event being broadcast such as a sporting event or awards ceremony.

domainIncludes.label: isLiveBroadcast
domainIncludes.comment: True is the broadcast is of a live event.

BroadcastService.comment: A delivery service through which content is provided via broadcast over the air or online.

domainIncludes.label: area
domainIncludes.comment: The area within which users can expect to reach the broadcast service.

domainIncludes.label: broadcaster
domainIncludes.comment: The organization owning or operating the broadcast service.

domainIncludes.label: parentService
domainIncludes.comment: A broadcast service to which the broadcast service may belong to such as regional variations of a national channel.

domainIncludes.label: videoFormat
domainIncludes.comment: The type of screening or video broadcast used (e.g. IMAX, 3D, SD, HD, etc.).

domainIncludes.label: broadcastAffiliateOf
domainIncludes.comment: The media network(s) whose content is broadcast on this station.

domainIncludes.label: broadcastDisplayName
domainIncludes.comment: The name displayed in the channel guide. For many US affiliates, it is the network name.

domainIncludes.label: broadcastTimezone
domainIncludes.comment: The timezone in [ISO 8601 format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) for which the service bases its broadcasts

domainIncludes.label: broadcastFrequency
domainIncludes.comment: The frequency used for over-the-air broadcasts. Numeric values or simple ranges e.g. 87-99. In addition a shortcut idiom is supported for frequences of AM and FM radio channels, e.g. "87 FM".

domainIncludes.label: hasBroadcastChannel
domainIncludes.comment: A broadcast channel of a broadcast service.

rangeIncludes.label: parentService
rangeIncludes.comment: A broadcast service to which the broadcast service may belong to such as regional variations of a national channel.

rangeIncludes.label: publishedOn
rangeIncludes.comment: A broadcast service associated with the publication event.

rangeIncludes.label: providesBroadcastService
rangeIncludes.comment: The BroadcastService offered on this channel.

Clip.comment: A short TV or radio program or a segment/part of a program.

domainIncludes.label: actor
domainIncludes.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: actors
domainIncludes.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: clipNumber
domainIncludes.comment: Position of the clip within an ordered group of clips.

domainIncludes.label: director
domainIncludes.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: directors
domainIncludes.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: musicBy
domainIncludes.comment: The composer of the soundtrack.

domainIncludes.label: partOfEpisode
domainIncludes.comment: The episode to which this clip belongs.

domainIncludes.label: partOfSeason
domainIncludes.comment: The season to which this episode belongs.

domainIncludes.label: partOfSeries
domainIncludes.comment: The series to which this episode or season belongs.

rangeIncludes.label: audio
rangeIncludes.comment: An embedded audio object.

rangeIncludes.label: video
rangeIncludes.comment: An embedded video object.

OnDemandEvent.comment: A publication event e.g. catch-up TV or radio podcast, during which a program is available on-demand.

RadioClip.comment: A short radio program or a segment/part of a radio program.

RadioEpisode.comment: A radio episode which can be part of a series or season.

RadioSeason.comment: Season dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

RadioSeries.comment: CreativeWorkSeries dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

domainIncludes.label: actor
domainIncludes.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: actors
domainIncludes.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: director
domainIncludes.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: directors
domainIncludes.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: episode
domainIncludes.comment: An episode of a tv, radio or game media within a series or season.

domainIncludes.label: episodes
domainIncludes.comment: An episode of a TV/radio series or season.

domainIncludes.label: musicBy
domainIncludes.comment: The composer of the soundtrack.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfEpisodes
domainIncludes.comment: The number of episodes in this season or series.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfSeasons
domainIncludes.comment: The number of seasons in this series.

domainIncludes.label: productionCompany
domainIncludes.comment: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

domainIncludes.label: productionCompany
domainIncludes.comment: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

domainIncludes.label: season
domainIncludes.comment: A season in a media series.

domainIncludes.label: containsSeason
domainIncludes.comment: A season that is part of the media series.

domainIncludes.label: seasons
domainIncludes.comment: A season in a media series.

domainIncludes.label: trailer
domainIncludes.comment: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.

TVClip.comment: A short TV program or a segment/part of a TV program.

domainIncludes.label: partOfTVSeries
domainIncludes.comment: The TV series to which this episode or season belongs.

BusinessAudience.comment: A set of characteristics belonging to businesses, e.g. who compose an item's target audience.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfEmployees
domainIncludes.comment: The number of employees in an organization e.g. business.

domainIncludes.label: yearlyRevenue
domainIncludes.comment: The size of the business in annual revenue.

domainIncludes.label: yearsInOperation
domainIncludes.comment: The age of the business.

ContactPointOption.comment: Enumerated options related to a ContactPoint.

rangeIncludes.label: contactOption
rangeIncludes.comment: An option available on this contact point (e.g. a toll-free number or support for hearing-impaired callers).

Permit.comment: A permit issued by an organization, e.g. a parking pass.

domainIncludes.label: issuedThrough
domainIncludes.comment: The service through with the permit was granted.

domainIncludes.label: permitAudience
domainIncludes.comment: The target audience for this permit.

domainIncludes.label: validFor
domainIncludes.comment: The duration of validity of a permit or similar thing.

domainIncludes.label: validFrom
domainIncludes.comment: The date when the item becomes valid.

domainIncludes.label: validIn
domainIncludes.comment: The geographic area where a permit or similar thing is valid.

domainIncludes.label: validUntil
domainIncludes.comment: The date when the item is no longer valid.

domainIncludes.label: issuedBy
domainIncludes.comment: The organization issuing the ticket or permit.

GovernmentPermit.comment: A permit issued by a government agency.

GovernmentService.comment: A service provided by a government organization, e.g. food stamps, veterans benefits, etc.

domainIncludes.label: serviceOperator
domainIncludes.comment: The operating organization, if different from the provider.  This enables the representation of services that are provided by an organization, but operated by another organization like a subcontractor.

ServiceChannel.comment: A means for accessing a service, e.g. a government office location, web site, or phone number.

domainIncludes.label: availableLanguage
domainIncludes.comment: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]]

domainIncludes.label: processingTime
domainIncludes.comment: Estimated processing time for the service using this channel.

domainIncludes.label: providesService
domainIncludes.comment: The service provided by this channel.

domainIncludes.label: serviceLocation
domainIncludes.comment: The location (e.g. civic structure, local business, etc.) where a person can go to access the service.

domainIncludes.label: servicePhone
domainIncludes.comment: The phone number to use to access the service.

domainIncludes.label: servicePostalAddress
domainIncludes.comment: The address for accessing the service by mail.

domainIncludes.label: serviceSmsNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The number to access the service by text message.

domainIncludes.label: serviceUrl
domainIncludes.comment: The website to access the service.

rangeIncludes.label: availableChannel
rangeIncludes.comment: A means of accessing the service (e.g. a phone bank, a web site, a location, etc.).

EventStatusType.comment: EventStatusType is an enumeration type whose instances represent several states that an Event may be in.

rangeIncludes.label: eventStatus
rangeIncludes.comment: An eventStatus of an event represents its status; particularly useful when an event is cancelled or rescheduled.

DeliveryEvent.comment: An event involving the delivery of an item.

domainIncludes.label: accessCode
domainIncludes.comment: Password, PIN, or access code needed for delivery (e.g. from a locker).

domainIncludes.label: availableFrom
domainIncludes.comment: When the item is available for pickup from the store, locker, etc.

domainIncludes.label: availableThrough
domainIncludes.comment: After this date, the item will no longer be available for pickup.

domainIncludes.label: hasDeliveryMethod
domainIncludes.comment: Method used for delivery or shipping.

rangeIncludes.label: deliveryStatus
rangeIncludes.comment: New entry added as the package passes through each leg of its journey (from shipment to final delivery).

LockerDelivery.comment: A DeliveryMethod in which an item is made available via locker.

Order.comment: An order is a confirmation of a transaction (a receipt), which can contain multiple line items, each represented by an Offer that has been accepted by the customer.

domainIncludes.label: orderDelivery
domainIncludes.comment: The delivery of the parcel related to this order or order item.

domainIncludes.label: acceptedOffer
domainIncludes.comment: The offer(s) -- e.g., product, quantity and price combinations -- included in the order.

domainIncludes.label: billingAddress
domainIncludes.comment: The billing address for the order.

domainIncludes.label: confirmationNumber
domainIncludes.comment: A number that confirms the given order or payment has been received.

domainIncludes.label: customer
domainIncludes.comment: Party placing the order or paying the invoice.

domainIncludes.label: discount
domainIncludes.comment: Any discount applied (to an Order).

domainIncludes.label: discountCode
domainIncludes.comment: Code used to redeem a discount.

domainIncludes.label: discountCurrency
domainIncludes.comment: The currency of the discount.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

domainIncludes.label: isGift
domainIncludes.comment: Was the offer accepted as a gift for someone other than the buyer.

domainIncludes.label: merchant
domainIncludes.comment: 'merchant' is an out-dated term for 'seller'.

domainIncludes.label: orderDate
domainIncludes.comment: Date order was placed.

domainIncludes.label: orderedItem
domainIncludes.comment: The item ordered.

domainIncludes.label: orderNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The identifier of the transaction.

domainIncludes.label: orderStatus
domainIncludes.comment: The current status of the order.

domainIncludes.label: partOfInvoice
domainIncludes.comment: The order is being paid as part of the referenced Invoice.

domainIncludes.label: paymentDue
domainIncludes.comment: The date that payment is due.

domainIncludes.label: paymentMethod
domainIncludes.comment: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

domainIncludes.label: paymentMethodId
domainIncludes.comment: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

domainIncludes.label: paymentUrl
domainIncludes.comment: The URL for sending a payment.

domainIncludes.label: seller
domainIncludes.comment: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.

domainIncludes.label: paymentDue
domainIncludes.comment: The date that payment is due.

domainIncludes.label: paymentDueDate
domainIncludes.comment: The date that payment is due.

domainIncludes.label: paymentMethod
domainIncludes.comment: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

domainIncludes.label: paymentMethodId
domainIncludes.comment: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

domainIncludes.label: broker
domainIncludes.comment: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

rangeIncludes.label: partOfOrder
rangeIncludes.comment: The overall order the items in this delivery were included in.

rangeIncludes.label: referencesOrder
rangeIncludes.comment: The Order(s) related to this Invoice. One or more Orders may be combined into a single Invoice.

rangeIncludes.label: orderItemStatus
rangeIncludes.comment: The current status of the order item.

rangeIncludes.label: orderStatus
rangeIncludes.comment: The current status of the order.

ParcelDelivery.comment: The delivery of a parcel either via the postal service or a commercial service.

domainIncludes.label: carrier
domainIncludes.comment: 'carrier' is an out-dated term indicating the 'provider' for parcel delivery and flights.

domainIncludes.label: deliveryAddress
domainIncludes.comment: Destination address.

domainIncludes.label: deliveryStatus
domainIncludes.comment: New entry added as the package passes through each leg of its journey (from shipment to final delivery).

domainIncludes.label: expectedArrivalFrom
domainIncludes.comment: The earliest date the package may arrive.

domainIncludes.label: expectedArrivalUntil
domainIncludes.comment: The latest date the package may arrive.

domainIncludes.label: hasDeliveryMethod
domainIncludes.comment: Method used for delivery or shipping.

domainIncludes.label: itemShipped
domainIncludes.comment: Item(s) being shipped.

domainIncludes.label: originAddress
domainIncludes.comment: Shipper's address.

domainIncludes.label: partOfOrder
domainIncludes.comment: The overall order the items in this delivery were included in.

domainIncludes.label: trackingNumber
domainIncludes.comment: Shipper tracking number.

domainIncludes.label: trackingUrl
domainIncludes.comment: Tracking url for the parcel delivery.

domainIncludes.label: provider
domainIncludes.comment: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

rangeIncludes.label: orderDelivery
rangeIncludes.comment: The delivery of the parcel related to this order or order item.

OrderItem.comment: An order item is a line of an order. It includes the quantity and shipping details of a bought offer.

domainIncludes.label: orderQuantity
domainIncludes.comment: The number of the item ordered. If the property is not set, assume the quantity is one.

domainIncludes.label: orderItemStatus
domainIncludes.comment: The current status of the order item.

domainIncludes.label: orderItemNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The identifier of the order item.

domainIncludes.label: orderDelivery
domainIncludes.comment: The delivery of the parcel related to this order or order item.

domainIncludes.label: orderedItem
domainIncludes.comment: The item ordered.

rangeIncludes.label: orderedItem
rangeIncludes.comment: The item ordered.

Action.comment: An action performed by a direct agent and indirect participants upon a direct object. Optionally happens at a location with the help of an inanimate instrument. The execution of the action may produce a result. Specific action sub-type documentation specifies the exact expectation of each argument/role.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/04/announcing-schemaorg-actions.html) and [Actions overview document](docs/actions.html).

domainIncludes.label: agent
domainIncludes.comment: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). e.g. *John* wrote a book.

domainIncludes.label: endTime
domainIncludes.comment: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the end of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

domainIncludes.label: instrument
domainIncludes.comment: The object that helped the agent perform the action. e.g. John wrote a book with *a pen*.

domainIncludes.label: location
domainIncludes.comment: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

domainIncludes.label: object
domainIncludes.comment: The object upon which the action is carried out, whose state is kept intact or changed. Also known as the semantic roles patient, affected or undergoer (which change their state) or theme (which doesn't). e.g. John read *a book*.

domainIncludes.label: participant
domainIncludes.comment: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. e.g. John wrote a book with *Steve*.

domainIncludes.label: result
domainIncludes.comment: The result produced in the action. e.g. John wrote *a book*.

domainIncludes.label: startTime
domainIncludes.comment: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the start of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

domainIncludes.label: actionStatus
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates the current disposition of the Action.

domainIncludes.label: error
domainIncludes.comment: For failed actions, more information on the cause of the failure.

domainIncludes.label: target
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates a target EntryPoint for an Action.

rangeIncludes.label: potentialAction
