rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

rangeIncludes.label: interactionType
rangeIncludes.comment: The Action representing the type of interaction. For up votes, +1s, etc. use [[LikeAction]]. For down votes use [[DislikeAction]]. Otherwise, use the most specific Action.

OrganizeAction.comment: The act of manipulating/administering/supervising/controlling one or more objects.

AllocateAction.comment: The act of organizing tasks/objects/events by associating resources to it.

AcceptAction.comment:
The act of committing to/adopting an object.

Related actions:

* [[RejectAction]]: The antonym of AcceptAction.

AchieveAction.comment: The act of accomplishing something via previous efforts. It is an instantaneous action rather than an ongoing process.

UpdateAction.comment: The act of managing by changing/editing the state of the object.

domainIncludes.label: collection
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The collection target of the action.

domainIncludes.label: targetCollection
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The collection target of the action.

AddAction.comment: The act of editing by adding an object to a collection.

AssessAction.comment: The act of forming one's opinion, reaction or sentiment.

ReactAction.comment: The act of responding instinctively and emotionally to an object, expressing a sentiment.

AgreeAction.comment: The act of expressing a consistency of opinion with the object. An agent agrees to/about an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

InsertAction.comment: The act of adding at a specific location in an ordered collection.

domainIncludes.label: toLocation
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

AppendAction.comment: The act of inserting at the end if an ordered collection.

ApplyAction.comment:
The act of registering to an organization/service without the guarantee to receive it.

Related actions:

* [[RegisterAction]]: Unlike RegisterAction, ApplyAction has no guarantees that the application will be accepted.

MoveAction.comment:
The act of an agent relocating to a place.

Related actions:

* [[TransferAction]]: Unlike TransferAction, the subject of the move is a living Person or Organization rather than an inanimate object.

domainIncludes.label: fromLocation
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The original location of the object or the agent before the action.

domainIncludes.label: toLocation
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

ArriveAction.comment: The act of arriving at a place. An agent arrives at a destination from a fromLocation, optionally with participants.

InteractAction.comment: The act of interacting with another person or organization.

CommunicateAction.comment: The act of conveying information to another person via a communication medium (instrument) such as speech, email, or telephone conversation.

domainIncludes.label: about
domainIncludes.comment: The subject matter of the content.

domainIncludes.label: inLanguage
domainIncludes.comment: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

domainIncludes.label: language
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. The language used on this action.

domainIncludes.label: recipient
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

AskAction.comment:
The act of posing a question / favor to someone.

Related actions:

* [[ReplyAction]]: Appears generally as a response to AskAction.

domainIncludes.label: question
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. A question.

AssignAction.comment: The act of allocating an action/event/task to some destination (someone or something).

AuthorizeAction.comment: The act of granting permission to an object.

domainIncludes.label: recipient
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

BefriendAction.comment:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone (object) mutually/bidirectionally/symmetrically.

Related actions:

* [[FollowAction]]: Unlike FollowAction, BefriendAction implies that the connection is reciprocal.

TransferAction.comment: The act of transferring/moving (abstract or concrete) animate or inanimate objects from one place to another.

domainIncludes.label: fromLocation
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The original location of the object or the agent before the action.

domainIncludes.label: toLocation
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

BorrowAction.comment:
The act of obtaining an object under an agreement to return it at a later date. Reciprocal of LendAction.

Related actions:

* [[LendAction]]: Reciprocal of BorrowAction.

domainIncludes.label: lender
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The person that lends the object being borrowed.

TradeAction.comment: The act of participating in an exchange of goods and services for monetary compensation. An agent trades an object, product or service with a participant in exchange for a one time or periodic payment.

domainIncludes.label: price
domainIncludes.comment:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

* Use the [[priceCurrency]] property (with standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR") instead of including [ambiguous symbols](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollar_sign#Currencies_that_use_the_dollar_or_peso_sign) such as '$' in the value.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
* Note that both [RDFa](http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-rdfa-primer/#using-the-content-attribute) and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

domainIncludes.label: priceSpecification
domainIncludes.comment: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

domainIncludes.label: priceCurrency
domainIncludes.comment: The currency of the price, or a price component when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

BuyAction.comment: The act of giving money to a seller in exchange for goods or services rendered. An agent buys an object, product, or service from a seller for a price. Reciprocal of SellAction.

domainIncludes.label: seller
domainIncludes.comment: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.

domainIncludes.label: vendor
domainIncludes.comment: 'vendor' is an earlier term for 'seller'.

domainIncludes.label: warrantyPromise
domainIncludes.comment: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

PlanAction.comment: The act of planning the execution of an event/task/action/reservation/plan to a future date.

domainIncludes.label: scheduledTime
domainIncludes.comment: The time the object is scheduled to.

CancelAction.comment:
The act of asserting that a future event/action is no longer going to happen.

Related actions:

* [[ConfirmAction]]: The antonym of CancelAction.

FindAction.comment:
The act of finding an object.

Related actions:

* [[SearchAction]]: FindAction is generally lead by a SearchAction, but not necessarily.

CheckAction.comment: An agent inspects, determines, investigates, inquires, or examines an object's accuracy, quality, condition, or state.

CheckInAction.comment:
The act of an agent communicating (service provider, social media, etc) their arrival by registering/confirming for a previously reserved service (e.g. flight check in) or at a place (e.g. hotel), possibly resulting in a result (boarding pass, etc).

Related actions:

* [[CheckOutAction]]: The antonym of CheckInAction.
* [[ArriveAction]]: Unlike ArriveAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the start of a previously reserved service.
* [[ConfirmAction]]: Unlike ConfirmAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the *start* of a previously reserved service rather than its validity/existence.

CheckOutAction.comment:
The act of an agent communicating (service provider, social media, etc) their departure of a previously reserved service (e.g. flight check in) or place (e.g. hotel).

Related actions:

* [[CheckInAction]]: The antonym of CheckOutAction.
* [[DepartAction]]: Unlike DepartAction, CheckOutAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the end of a previously reserved service.
* [[CancelAction]]: Unlike CancelAction, CheckOutAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the end of a previously reserved service.

ChooseAction.comment: The act of expressing a preference from a set of options or a large or unbounded set of choices/options.

domainIncludes.label: option
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The options subject to this action.

domainIncludes.label: actionOption
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The options subject to this action.

CommentAction.comment: The act of generating a comment about a subject.

domainIncludes.label: resultComment
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of result. The Comment created or sent as a result of this action.

InformAction.comment: The act of notifying someone of information pertinent to them, with no expectation of a response.

domainIncludes.label: event
domainIncludes.comment: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

ConfirmAction.comment:
The act of notifying someone that a future event/action is going to happen as expected.

Related actions:

* [[CancelAction]]: The antonym of ConfirmAction.

domainIncludes.label: expectsAcceptanceOf
domainIncludes.comment: An Offer which must be accepted before the user can perform the Action. For example, the user may need to buy a movie before being able to watch it.

domainIncludes.label: actionAccessibilityRequirement
domainIncludes.comment: A set of requirements that a must be fulfilled in order to perform an Action. If more than one value is specied, fulfilling one set of requirements will allow the Action to be performed.

CreateAction.comment: The act of deliberately creating/producing/generating/building a result out of the agent.

domainIncludes.label: foodEvent
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The specific food event where the action occurred.

DeleteAction.comment: The act of editing a recipient by removing one of its objects.

DepartAction.comment: The act of  departing from a place. An agent departs from an fromLocation for a destination, optionally with participants.

DisagreeAction.comment: The act of expressing a difference of opinion with the object. An agent disagrees to/about an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

DiscoverAction.comment: The act of discovering/finding an object.

DislikeAction.comment: The act of expressing a negative sentiment about the object. An agent dislikes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

DonateAction.comment: The act of providing goods, services, or money without compensation, often for philanthropic reasons.

domainIncludes.label: recipient
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

DownloadAction.comment: The act of downloading an object.

DrawAction.comment: The act of producing a visual/graphical representation of an object, typically with a pen/pencil and paper as instruments.

EatAction.comment: The act of swallowing solid objects.

domainIncludes.label: endorsee
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The person/organization being supported.

ControlAction.comment: An agent controls a device or application.

ActivateAction.comment: The act of starting or activating a device or application (e.g. starting a timer or turning on a flashlight).

DeactivateAction.comment: The act of stopping or deactivating a device or application (e.g. stopping a timer or turning off a flashlight).

ResumeAction.comment: The act of resuming a device or application which was formerly paused (e.g. resume music playback or resume a timer).

SuspendAction.comment: The act of momentarily pausing a device or application (e.g. pause music playback or pause a timer).

PlayAction.comment:
The act of playing/exercising/training/performing for enjoyment, leisure, recreation, Competition or exercise.

Related actions:

* [[ListenAction]]: Unlike ListenAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to performing for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming music.
* [[WatchAction]]: Unlike WatchAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to showing/displaying for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming visual content.

domainIncludes.label: audience
domainIncludes.comment: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

domainIncludes.label: event
domainIncludes.comment: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

ExerciseAction.comment: The act of participating in exertive activity for the purposes of improving health and fitness.

domainIncludes.label: course
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The course where this action was taken.

domainIncludes.label: exerciseCourse
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The course where this action was taken.

domainIncludes.label: distance
domainIncludes.comment: The distance travelled, e.g. exercising or travelling.

domainIncludes.label: fromLocation
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The original location of the object or the agent before the action.

domainIncludes.label: opponent
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The opponent on this action.

domainIncludes.label: sportsActivityLocation
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The sports activity location where this action occurred.

domainIncludes.label: sportsEvent
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The sports event where this action occurred.

domainIncludes.label: sportsTeam
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The sports team that participated on this action.

domainIncludes.label: toLocation
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

FilmAction.comment: The act of capturing sound and moving images on film, video, or digitally.

FollowAction.comment:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates polled from.

Related actions:

* [[BefriendAction]]: Unlike BefriendAction, FollowAction implies that the connection is *not* necessarily reciprocal.
* [[SubscribeAction]]: Unlike SubscribeAction, FollowAction implies that the follower acts as an active agent constantly/actively polling for updates.
* [[RegisterAction]]: Unlike RegisterAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.
* [[JoinAction]]: Unlike JoinAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in getting updates from the object.
* [[TrackAction]]: Unlike TrackAction, FollowAction refers to the polling of updates of all aspects of animate objects rather than the location of inanimate objects (e.g. you track a package, but you don't follow it).

domainIncludes.label: followee
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The person or organization being followed.

GiveAction.comment:
The act of transferring ownership of an object to a destination. Reciprocal of TakeAction.

Related actions:

* [[TakeAction]]: Reciprocal of GiveAction.
* [[SendAction]]: Unlike SendAction, GiveAction implies that ownership is being transferred (e.g. I may send my laptop to you, but that doesn't mean I'm giving it to you).

domainIncludes.label: recipient
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

IgnoreAction.comment: The act of intentionally disregarding the object. An agent ignores an object.

InstallAction.comment: The act of installing an application.

InviteAction.comment: The act of asking someone to attend an event. Reciprocal of RsvpAction.

domainIncludes.label: event
domainIncludes.comment: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

JoinAction.comment:
An agent joins an event/group with participants/friends at a location.

Related actions:

* [[RegisterAction]]: Unlike RegisterAction, JoinAction refers to joining a group/team of people.
* [[SubscribeAction]]: Unlike SubscribeAction, JoinAction does not imply that you'll be receiving updates.
* [[FollowAction]]: Unlike FollowAction, JoinAction does not imply that you'll be polling for updates.

domainIncludes.label: event
domainIncludes.comment: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

LeaveAction.comment:
An agent leaves an event / group with participants/friends at a location.

Related actions:

* [[JoinAction]]: The antonym of LeaveAction.
* [[UnRegisterAction]]: Unlike UnRegisterAction, LeaveAction implies leaving a group/team of people rather than a service.

domainIncludes.label: event
domainIncludes.comment: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

LendAction.comment:
The act of providing an object under an agreement that it will be returned at a later date. Reciprocal of BorrowAction.

Related actions:

* [[BorrowAction]]: Reciprocal of LendAction.

domainIncludes.label: borrower
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The person that borrows the object being lent.

LikeAction.comment: The act of expressing a positive sentiment about the object. An agent likes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

ListenAction.comment: The act of consuming audio content.

LoseAction.comment: The act of being defeated in a competitive activity.

domainIncludes.label: winner
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The winner of the action.

MarryAction.comment: The act of marrying a person.

OrderAction.comment: An agent orders an object/product/service to be delivered/sent.

domainIncludes.label: deliveryMethod
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. The method of delivery.

PaintAction.comment: The act of producing a painting, typically with paint and canvas as instruments.

PayAction.comment: An agent pays a price to a participant.

domainIncludes.label: recipient
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

PerformAction.comment: The act of participating in performance arts.

domainIncludes.label: entertainmentBusiness
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The entertainment business where the action occurred.

PhotographAction.comment: The act of capturing still images of objects using a camera.

PrependAction.comment: The act of inserting at the beginning if an ordered collection.

QuoteAction.comment: An agent quotes/estimates/appraises an object/product/service with a price at a location/store.

ReadAction.comment: The act of consuming written content.

ReceiveAction.comment:
The act of physically/electronically taking delivery of an object thathas been transferred from an origin to a destination. Reciprocal of SendAction.

Related actions:

* [[SendAction]]: The reciprocal of ReceiveAction.
* [[TakeAction]]: Unlike TakeAction, ReceiveAction does not imply that the ownership has been transfered (e.g. I can receive a package, but it does not mean the package is now mine).

domainIncludes.label: deliveryMethod
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. The method of delivery.

domainIncludes.label: sender
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the sending end of the action.

RegisterAction.comment:
The act of registering to be a user of a service, product or web page.

Related actions:

* [[JoinAction]]: Unlike JoinAction, RegisterAction implies you are registering to be a user of a service, *not* a group/team of people.
* [FollowAction]]: Unlike FollowAction, RegisterAction doesn't imply that the agent is expecting to poll for updates from the object.
* [[SubscribeAction]]: Unlike SubscribeAction, RegisterAction doesn't imply that the agent is expecting updates from the object.

RejectAction.comment:
The act of rejecting to/adopting an object.

Related actions:

* [[AcceptAction]]: The antonym of RejectAction.

RentAction.comment: The act of giving money in return for temporary use, but not ownership, of an object such as a vehicle or property. For example, an agent rents a property from a landlord in exchange for a periodic payment.

domainIncludes.label: landlord
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The owner of the real estate property.

domainIncludes.label: realEstateAgent
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The real estate agent involved in the action.

ReplaceAction.comment: The act of editing a recipient by replacing an old object with a new object.

domainIncludes.label: replacee
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The object that is being replaced.

domainIncludes.label: replacer
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The object that replaces.

ReplyAction.comment:
The act of responding to a question/message asked/sent by the object. Related to [[AskAction]]

Related actions:

* [[AskAction]]: Appears generally as an origin of a ReplyAction.

domainIncludes.label: resultComment
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of result. The Comment created or sent as a result of this action.

ReserveAction.comment: Reserving a concrete object. Related actions: * [[ScheduleAction]]: Unlike ScheduleAction, ReserveAction reserves concrete objects (e.g. a table, a hotel) towards a time slot / spatial allocation.

ReturnAction.comment: The act of returning to the origin that which was previously received (concrete objects) or taken (ownership).

domainIncludes.label: recipient
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

ReviewAction.comment: The act of producing a balanced opinion about the object for an audience. An agent reviews an object with participants resulting in a review.

domainIncludes.label: resultReview
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of result. The review that resulted in the performing of the action.

RsvpAction.comment: The act of notifying an event organizer as to whether you expect to attend the event.

domainIncludes.label: additionalNumberOfGuests
domainIncludes.comment: If responding yes, the number of guests who will attend in addition to the invitee.

domainIncludes.label: rsvpResponse
domainIncludes.comment: The response (yes, no, maybe) to the RSVP.

domainIncludes.label: comment
domainIncludes.comment: Comments, typically from users.

rangeIncludes.label: rsvpResponse
rangeIncludes.comment: The response (yes, no, maybe) to the RSVP.

RsvpResponseType.comment: RsvpResponseType is an enumeration type whose instances represent responding to an RSVP request.

ScheduleAction.comment:
Scheduling future actions, events, or tasks.

Related actions:

* [[ReserveAction]]: Unlike ReserveAction, ScheduleAction allocates future actions (e.g. an event, a task, etc) towards a time slot / spatial allocation.

SearchAction.comment:
The act of searching for an object.

Related actions:

* [[FindAction]]: SearchAction generally leads to a FindAction, but not necessarily.

domainIncludes.label: query
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. The query used on this action.

SellAction.comment: The act of taking money from a buyer in exchange for goods or services rendered. An agent sells an object, product, or service to a buyer for a price. Reciprocal of BuyAction.

domainIncludes.label: buyer
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant/person/organization that bought the object.

domainIncludes.label: warrantyPromise
domainIncludes.comment: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

SendAction.comment:
The act of physically/electronically dispatching an object for transfer from an origin to a destination.Related actions:

* [[ReceiveAction]]: The reciprocal of SendAction.
* [[GiveAction]]: Unlike GiveAction, SendAction does not imply the transfer of ownership (e.g. I can send you my laptop, but I'm not necessarily giving it to you).

domainIncludes.label: deliveryMethod
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. The method of delivery.

domainIncludes.label: recipient
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

ShareAction.comment: The act of distributing content to people for their amusement or edification.

SubscribeAction.comment:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates pushed to.

Related actions:

* [[FollowAction]]: Unlike FollowAction, SubscribeAction implies that the subscriber acts as a passive agent being constantly/actively pushed for updates.
* [[RegisterAction]]: Unlike RegisterAction, SubscribeAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.
* [[JoinAction]]: Unlike JoinAction, SubscribeAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.

TakeAction.comment:
The act of gaining ownership of an object from an origin. Reciprocal of GiveAction.

Related actions:

* [[GiveAction]]: The reciprocal of TakeAction.
* [[ReceiveAction]]: Unlike ReceiveAction, TakeAction implies that ownership has been transfered.

TieAction.comment: The act of reaching a draw in a competitive activity.

TipAction.comment: The act of giving money voluntarily to a beneficiary in recognition of services rendered.

domainIncludes.label: recipient
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

TrackAction.comment:
An agent tracks an object for updates.

Related actions:

* [[FollowAction]]: Unlike FollowAction, TrackAction refers to the interest on the location of innanimates objects.
* [[SubscribeAction]]: Unlike SubscribeAction, TrackAction refers to  the interest on the location of innanimate objects.

domainIncludes.label: deliveryMethod
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. The method of delivery.

TravelAction.comment: The act of traveling from an fromLocation to a destination by a specified mode of transport, optionally with participants.

domainIncludes.label: distance
domainIncludes.comment: The distance travelled, e.g. exercising or travelling.

UnRegisterAction.comment:
The act of un-registering from a service.

Related actions:

* [[RegisterAction]]: antonym of UnRegisterAction.
* [[LeaveAction]]: Unlike LeaveAction, UnRegisterAction implies that you are unregistering from a service you werer previously registered, rather than leaving a team/group of people.

UseAction.comment: The act of applying an object to its intended purpose.

ViewAction.comment: The act of consuming static visual content.

VoteAction.comment: The act of expressing a preference from a fixed/finite/structured set of choices/options.

domainIncludes.label: candidate
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. The candidate subject of this action.

WantAction.comment: The act of expressing a desire about the object. An agent wants an object.

WatchAction.comment: The act of consuming dynamic/moving visual content.

WearAction.comment: The act of dressing oneself in clothing.

WinAction.comment: The act of achieving victory in a competitive activity.

domainIncludes.label: loser
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of participant. The loser of the action.

WriteAction.comment: The act of authoring written creative content.

domainIncludes.label: inLanguage
domainIncludes.comment: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

domainIncludes.label: language
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. The language used on this action.

rangeIncludes.label: acceptedPaymentMethod

rangeIncludes.label: acceptsReservations

rangeIncludes.label: free

rangeIncludes.label: representativeOfPage
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates whether this image is representative of the content of the page.

rangeIncludes.label: requiresSubscription
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates if use of the media require a subscription  (either paid or free). Allowed values are ```true``` or ```false``` (note that an earlier version had 'yes', 'no').

rangeIncludes.label: value
rangeIncludes.comment:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

rangeIncludes.label: valueAddedTaxIncluded
rangeIncludes.comment: Specifies whether the applicable value-added tax (VAT) is included in the price specification or not.

rangeIncludes.label: valueRequired
rangeIncludes.comment: Whether the property must be filled in to complete the action.  Default is false.

rangeIncludes.label: readonlyValue
rangeIncludes.comment: Whether or not a property is mutable.  Default is false. Specifying this for a property that also has a value makes it act similar to a "hidden" input in an HTML form.

rangeIncludes.label: multipleValues
rangeIncludes.comment: Whether multiple values are allowed for the property.  Default is false.

rangeIncludes.label: isLiveBroadcast
rangeIncludes.comment: True is the broadcast is of a live event.

rangeIncludes.label: petsAllowed

rangeIncludes.label: smokingAllowed
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates whether it is allowed to smoke in the place, e.g. in the restaurant, hotel or hotel room.

domainIncludes.label: actor

domainIncludes.label: actors

domainIncludes.label: directors

domainIncludes.label: playMode
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates whether this game is multi-player, co-op or single-player.  The game can be marked as multi-player, co-op and single-player at the same time.

domainIncludes.label: cheatCode
domainIncludes.comment: Cheat codes to the game.

domainIncludes.label: gameTip

domainIncludes.label: gamePlatform

domainIncludes.label: gameServer
domainIncludes.comment: The server on which  it is possible to play the game.

VideoGame.comment: A video game is an electronic game that involves human interaction with a user interface to generate visual feedback on a video device.

rangeIncludes.label: game
rangeIncludes.comment: Video game which is played on this server.

domainIncludes.label: actor
domainIncludes.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: actors
domainIncludes.comment: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.label: directors
domainIncludes.comment: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

domainIncludes.comment: The composer of the soundtrack.

domainIncludes.label: productionCompany
domainIncludes.comment: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

domainIncludes.label: trailer
domainIncludes.comment: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.

MovieSeries.comment: A series of movies. Included movies can be indicated with the hasPart property.

rangeIncludes.label: availabilityEnds
rangeIncludes.comment: The end of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

rangeIncludes.label: availabilityStarts

rangeIncludes.comment: When the item is available for pickup from the store, locker, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: availableThrough
rangeIncludes.comment: After this date, the item will no longer be available for pickup.

rangeIncludes.label: commentTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The time at which the UserComment was made.

rangeIncludes.label: dateCreated
rangeIncludes.comment: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

rangeIncludes.label: dateDeleted
rangeIncludes.comment: The datetime the item was removed from the DataFeed.

rangeIncludes.label: dateModified
rangeIncludes.comment: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

rangeIncludes.label: doorTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The time admission will commence.

rangeIncludes.label: endTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the end of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

rangeIncludes.label: expectedArrivalFrom
rangeIncludes.comment: The earliest date the package may arrive.

rangeIncludes.label: expectedArrivalUntil
rangeIncludes.comment: The latest date the package may arrive.

rangeIncludes.label: orderDate

rangeIncludes.label: ownedFrom

rangeIncludes.label: ownedThrough

rangeIncludes.label: paymentDue
rangeIncludes.comment: The date that payment is due.

rangeIncludes.label: scheduledTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The time the object is scheduled to.

rangeIncludes.label: startDate
rangeIncludes.comment: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

rangeIncludes.label: startTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the start of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

rangeIncludes.label: temporalCoverage
rangeIncludes.comment:
The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a DateTime or as a textual string indicating a time period in [ISO 8601 time interval format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Time_intervals). In
      the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written "2011/2012"). Other forms of content e.g. ScholarlyArticle, Book, TVSeries or TVEpisode may indicate their temporalCoverage in broader terms - textually or via well-known URL.
      Written works such as books may sometimes have precise temporal coverage too, e.g. a work set in 1939 - 1945 can be indicated in ISO 8601 interval format format via "1939/1945".

Open-ended date ranges can be written with ".." in place of the end date. For example, "2015-11/.." indicates a range beginning in November 2015 and with no specified final date. This is tentative and might be updated in future when ISO 8601 is officially updated.

rangeIncludes.label: temporal
rangeIncludes.comment:
The "temporal" property can be used in cases where more specific properties
(e.g. [[temporalCoverage]], [[dateCreated]], [[dateModified]], [[datePublished]]) are not known to be appropriate.

rangeIncludes.label: datasetTimeInterval
rangeIncludes.comment: The range of temporal applicability of a dataset, e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 (in ISO 8601 time interval format).

rangeIncludes.label: validFrom
rangeIncludes.comment: The date when the item becomes valid.

rangeIncludes.label: validThrough
rangeIncludes.comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

rangeIncludes.label: paymentDue
rangeIncludes.comment: The date that payment is due.

rangeIncludes.label: paymentDueDate
rangeIncludes.comment: The date that payment is due.

rangeIncludes.label: modifiedTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The date and time the reservation was modified.

rangeIncludes.label: dateIssued
rangeIncludes.comment: The date the ticket was issued.

rangeIncludes.label: arrivalTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The expected arrival time.

rangeIncludes.comment: The time when a passenger can check into the flight online.

rangeIncludes.label: pickupTime
rangeIncludes.comment: When a taxi will pickup a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

rangeIncludes.label: dropoffTime
rangeIncludes.comment: When a rental car can be dropped off.

rangeIncludes.label: checkinTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The earliest someone may check into a lodging establishment.

rangeIncludes.label: checkoutTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The latest someone may check out of a lodging establishment.

rangeIncludes.label: coverageStartTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The time when the live blog will begin covering the Event. Note that coverage may begin before the Event's start time. The LiveBlogPosting may also be created before coverage begins.

rangeIncludes.label: coverageEndTime
rangeIncludes.comment: The time when the live blog will stop covering the Event. Note that coverage may continue after the Event concludes.

rangeIncludes.label: dateRead
rangeIncludes.comment: The date/time at which the message has been read by the recipient if a single recipient exists.

rangeIncludes.label: dateReceived
rangeIncludes.comment: The date/time the message was received if a single recipient exists.

rangeIncludes.label: dateSent
rangeIncludes.comment: The date/time at which the message was sent.

domainIncludes.label: baseSalary
domainIncludes.comment: The base salary of the job or of an employee in an EmployeeRole.

domainIncludes.label: salaryCurrency
domainIncludes.comment: The currency (coded using [ISO 4217](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) ) used for the main salary information in this job posting or for this employee.

EmployeeRole.comment: A subclass of OrganizationRole used to describe employee relationships.

rangeIncludes.label: baseSalary
rangeIncludes.comment: The base salary of the job or of an employee in an EmployeeRole.

rangeIncludes.label: netWorth
rangeIncludes.comment: The total financial value of the person as calculated by subtracting assets from liabilities.

rangeIncludes.label: amount
rangeIncludes.comment: The amount of money.

rangeIncludes.comment: The total amount due.

rangeIncludes.label: minimumPaymentDue
rangeIncludes.comment: The minimum payment required at this time.

rangeIncludes.label: estimatedCost

domainIncludes.label: maxValue
domainIncludes.comment: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

domainIncludes.label: minValue
domainIncludes.comment: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

domainIncludes.label: value
domainIncludes.comment:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

domainIncludes.label: currency
domainIncludes.comment: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

MonetaryAmount.comment: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use [[PriceSpecification]] Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

domainIncludes.label: bccRecipient
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of recipient. The recipient blind copied on a message.

domainIncludes.label: ccRecipient
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of recipient. The recipient copied on a message.

domainIncludes.label: sender

domainIncludes.label: toRecipient

Message.comment: A single message from a sender to one or more organizations or people.

rangeIncludes.label: birthDate

rangeIncludes.comment: The time at which the UserComment was made.

rangeIncludes.label: dateCreated
rangeIncludes.comment: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

rangeIncludes.label: dateModified

For rescheduled events, the startDate property should be used for the newly scheduled start date. In the (rare) case of an event that has been postponed and rescheduled multiple times, this field may be repeated.

rangeIncludes.label: uploadDate

domainIncludes.label: arrivalTerminal
domainIncludes.comment: Identifier of the flight's arrival terminal.

domainIncludes.label: customer
domainIncludes.comment: Party placing the order or paying the invoice.

domainIncludes.label: paymentDue
domainIncludes.comment: The date that payment is due.

domainIncludes.label: paymentMethod
domainIncludes.comment: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

domainIncludes.label: paymentMethodId
domainIncludes.comment: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

domainIncludes.label: paymentDue
domainIncludes.comment: The date that payment is due.

domainIncludes.label: paymentDueDate
domainIncludes.comment: The date that payment is due.

domainIncludes.label: paymentMethod
domainIncludes.comment: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

domainIncludes.label: paymentMethodId
domainIncludes.comment: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

domainIncludes.label: provider
domainIncludes.comment: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

domainIncludes.label: broker
domainIncludes.comment: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

domainIncludes.label: totalPaymentDue
domainIncludes.comment: The total amount due.

domainIncludes.label: minimumPaymentDue
domainIncludes.comment: The minimum payment required at this time.

domainIncludes.label: accountId

domainIncludes.label: scheduledPaymentDate

domainIncludes.label: billingPeriod

domainIncludes.label: paymentStatus
domainIncludes.comment: The status of payment; whether the invoice has been paid or not.

domainIncludes.label: referencesOrder
domainIncludes.comment: The Order(s) related to this Invoice. One or more Orders may be combined into a single Invoice.

rangeIncludes.label: partOfInvoice
rangeIncludes.comment: The order is being paid as part of the referenced Invoice.

Invoice.comment: A statement of the money due for goods or services; a bill.

rangeIncludes.label: closes
rangeIncludes.comment: The closing hour of the place or service on the given day(s) of the week.

rangeIncludes.label: opens

domainIncludes.label: dateCreated
domainIncludes.comment: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

domainIncludes.label: dateDeleted
domainIncludes.comment: The datetime the item was removed from the DataFeed.

domainIncludes.label: dateModified
domainIncludes.comment: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

domainIncludes.label: item
domainIncludes.comment: An entity represented by an entry in a list or data feed (e.g. an 'artist' in a list of 'artists')’.

rangeIncludes.label: dataFeedElement
rangeIncludes.comment: An item within in a data feed. Data feeds may have many elements.

DataFeedItem.comment: A single item within a larger data feed.

domainIncludes.label: endDate
domainIncludes.comment: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

domainIncludes.label: startDate
domainIncludes.comment: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

domainIncludes.label: namedPosition
domainIncludes.comment: A position played, performed or filled by a person or organization, as part of an organization. For example, an athlete in a SportsTeam might play in the position named 'Quarterback'.

domainIncludes.label: roleName
domainIncludes.comment: A role played, performed or filled by a person or organization. For example, the team of creators for a comic book might fill the roles named 'inker', 'penciller', and 'letterer'; or an athlete in a SportsTeam might play in the position named 'Quarterback'.

Role.comment: Represents additional information about a relationship or property. For example a Role can be used to say that a 'member' role linking some SportsTeam to a player occurred during a particular time period. Or that a Person's 'actor' role in a Movie was for some particular characterName. Such properties can be attached to a Role entity, which is then associated with the main entities using ordinary properties like 'member' or 'actor'.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/06/introducing-role.html).

domainIncludes.label: endTime
domainIncludes.comment: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the end of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

domainIncludes.label: startTime
domainIncludes.comment: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the start of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

domainIncludes.label: partySize
domainIncludes.comment: Number of people the reservation should accommodate.

FoodEstablishmentReservation.comment: A reservation to dine at a food-related business.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

rangeIncludes.label: exifData
rangeIncludes.comment: exif data for this object.

rangeIncludes.label: valueReference
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.

rangeIncludes.label: additionalProperty
rangeIncludes.comment: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. width, color, gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

rangeIncludes.label: identifier
rangeIncludes.comment: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of [[Thing]], such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#identifierBg) for more details.

domainIncludes.label: maxValue
domainIncludes.comment: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

domainIncludes.label: minValue
domainIncludes.comment: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

domainIncludes.label: unitCode
domainIncludes.comment: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

domainIncludes.label: value
domainIncludes.comment:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

domainIncludes.label: valueReference
domainIncludes.comment: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.

domainIncludes.label: unitText
domainIncludes.comment: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

domainIncludes.label: propertyID
domainIncludes.comment:
A commonly used identifier for the characteristic represented by the property, e.g. a manufacturer or a standard code for a property. propertyID can be
(1) a prefixed string, mainly meant to be used with standards for product properties; (2) a site-specific, non-prefixed string (e.g. the primary key of the property or the vendor-specific id of the property), or (3)
a URL indicating the type of the property, either pointing to an external vocabulary, or a Web resource that describes the property (e.g. a glossary entry).
Standards bodies should promote a standard prefix for the identifiers of properties from their standards.

PropertyValue.comment: A property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of a product or place. Use the 'name' property for the name of the property. If there is an additional human-readable version of the value, put that into the 'description' property.\n\n Always use specific schema.org properties when a) they exist and b) you can populate them. Using PropertyValue as a substitute will typically not trigger the same effect as using the original, specific property.

rangeIncludes.label: gender
rangeIncludes.comment: Gender of the person. While Male and Female may be used, text strings are also acceptable for people who do not identify as a binary gender.

domainIncludes.label: genre
domainIncludes.comment: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

domainIncludes.label: broadcastChannelId
domainIncludes.comment: The unique address by which the BroadcastService can be identified in a provider lineup. In US, this is typically a number.

domainIncludes.label: inBroadcastLineup
domainIncludes.comment: The CableOrSatelliteService offering the channel.

domainIncludes.label: broadcastServiceTier
domainIncludes.comment: The type of service required to have access to the channel (e.g. Standard or Premium).

domainIncludes.label: providesBroadcastService
domainIncludes.comment: The BroadcastService offered on this channel.

domainIncludes.label: broadcastFrequency
domainIncludes.comment: The frequency used for over-the-air broadcasts. Numeric values or simple ranges e.g. 87-99. In addition a shortcut idiom is supported for frequences of AM and FM radio channels, e.g. "87 FM".

BroadcastChannel.comment: A unique instance of a BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

rangeIncludes.label: hasBroadcastChannel
rangeIncludes.comment: A broadcast channel of a broadcast service.

domainIncludes.label: hoursAvailable
domainIncludes.comment: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

domainIncludes.label: validFrom
domainIncludes.comment: The date when the item becomes valid.

domainIncludes.label: validThrough
domainIncludes.comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

LocationFeatureSpecification.comment: Specifies a location feature by providing a structured value representing a feature of an accommodation as a property-value pair of varying degrees of formality.

rangeIncludes.label: amenityFeature
rangeIncludes.comment: An amenity feature (e.g. a characteristic or service) of the Accommodation. This generic property does not make a statement about whether the feature is included in an offer for the main accommodation or available at extra costs.

rangeIncludes.label: itemListOrder
rangeIncludes.comment: Type of ordering (e.g. Ascending, Descending, Unordered).

ItemListOrderType.comment: Enumerated for values for itemListOrder for indicating how an ordered ItemList is organized.

domainIncludes.label: maxValue
domainIncludes.comment: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

domainIncludes.label: minValue
domainIncludes.comment: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

domainIncludes.label: valueName
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates the name of the PropertyValueSpecification to be used in URL templates and form encoding in a manner analogous to HTML's input@name.

domainIncludes.label: valueRequired
domainIncludes.comment: Whether the property must be filled in to complete the action.  Default is false.

domainIncludes.label: defaultValue
domainIncludes.comment: The default value of the input.  For properties that expect a literal, the default is a literal value, for properties that expect an object, it's an ID reference to one of the current values.

domainIncludes.label: readonlyValue
domainIncludes.comment: Whether or not a property is mutable.  Default is false. Specifying this for a property that also has a value makes it act similar to a "hidden" input in an HTML form.

domainIncludes.label: multipleValues
domainIncludes.comment: Whether multiple values are allowed for the property.  Default is false.

domainIncludes.label: valueMinLength
domainIncludes.comment: Specifies the minimum allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

domainIncludes.label: valueMaxLength
domainIncludes.comment: Specifies the allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

domainIncludes.label: valuePattern
domainIncludes.comment: Specifies a regular expression for testing literal values according to the HTML spec.

domainIncludes.label: stepValue
domainIncludes.comment: The stepValue attribute indicates the granularity that is expected (and required) of the value in a PropertyValueSpecification.

domainIncludes.label: member
domainIncludes.comment: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals.

domainIncludes.label: members
domainIncludes.comment: A member of this organization.

domainIncludes.label: membershipNumber
domainIncludes.comment: A unique identifier for the membership.

domainIncludes.label: programName
domainIncludes.comment: The program providing the membership.

domainIncludes.label: hostingOrganization
domainIncludes.comment: The organization (airline, travelers' club, etc.) the membership is made with.

rangeIncludes.label: memberOf
rangeIncludes.comment: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs.

rangeIncludes.label: programMembershipUsed
rangeIncludes.comment: Any membership in a frequent flyer, hotel loyalty program, etc. being applied to the reservation.

ProgramMembership.comment: Used to describe membership in a loyalty programs (e.g. "StarAliance"), traveler clubs (e.g. "AAA"), purchase clubs ("Safeway Club"), etc.

rangeIncludes.label: hasMenu
rangeIncludes.comment: Either the actual menu as a structured representation, as text, or a URL of the menu.

rangeIncludes.label: menu
rangeIncludes.comment: Either the actual menu as a structured representation, as text, or a URL of the menu.

Menu.comment: A structured representation of food or drink items available from a FoodEstablishment.

domainIncludes.label: hasMenuItem
domainIncludes.comment: A food or drink item contained in a menu or menu section.

domainIncludes.label: hasMenuSection
domainIncludes.comment: A subgrouping of the menu (by dishes, course, serving time period, etc.).

domainIncludes.label: offers
domainIncludes.comment: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

domainIncludes.label: suitableForDiet
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates a dietary restriction or guideline for which this recipe or menu item is suitable, e.g. diabetic, halal etc.

domainIncludes.label: nutrition
domainIncludes.comment: Nutrition information about the recipe or menu item.

domainIncludes.label: menuAddOn
domainIncludes.comment: Additional menu item(s) such as a side dish of salad or side order of fries that can be added to this menu item. Additionally it can be a menu section containing allowed add-on menu items for this menu item.

MenuItem.comment: A food or drink item listed in a menu or menu section.

rangeIncludes.label: menuAddOn
rangeIncludes.comment: Additional menu item(s) such as a side dish of salad or side order of fries that can be added to this menu item. Additionally it can be a menu section containing allowed add-on menu items for this menu item.

domainIncludes.label: offers
domainIncludes.comment: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

domainIncludes.label: provider
domainIncludes.comment: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

domainIncludes.label: departureTime
domainIncludes.comment: The expected departure time.

domainIncludes.label: arrivalTime
domainIncludes.comment: The expected arrival time.

Trip.comment: A trip or journey. An itinerary of visits to one or more places.

domainIncludes.label: position
domainIncludes.comment: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

domainIncludes.label: item
domainIncludes.comment: An entity represented by an entry in a list or data feed (e.g. an 'artist' in a list of 'artists')’.

domainIncludes.label: previousItem
domainIncludes.comment: A link to the ListItem that preceeds the current one.

domainIncludes.label: nextItem
domainIncludes.comment: A link to the ListItem that follows the current one.

rangeIncludes.label: itemListElement
rangeIncludes.comment:
For itemListElement values, you can use simple strings (e.g. "Peter", "Paul", "Mary"), existing entities, or use ListItem.

Text values are best if the elements in the list are plain strings. Existing entities are best for a simple, unordered list of existing things in your data. ListItem is used with ordered lists when you want to provide additional context about the element in that list or when the same item might be in different places in different lists.

Note: The order of elements in your mark-up is not sufficient for indicating the order or elements.  Use ListItem with a 'position' property in such cases.

rangeIncludes.label: previousItem
rangeIncludes.comment: A link to the ListItem that preceeds the current one.

rangeIncludes.label: nextItem
rangeIncludes.comment: A link to the ListItem that follows the current one.

ListItem.comment: An list item, e.g. a step in a checklist or how-to description.

rangeIncludes.label: question
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of object. A question.

rangeIncludes.label: parentItem
rangeIncludes.comment: The parent of a question, answer or item in general.

Question.comment: A specific question - e.g. from a user seeking answers online, or collected in a Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) document.

domainIncludes.label: upvoteCount
domainIncludes.comment: The number of upvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

domainIncludes.label: downvoteCount
domainIncludes.comment: The number of downvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

domainIncludes.label: answerCount
domainIncludes.comment: The number of answers this question has received.

domainIncludes.label: acceptedAnswer
domainIncludes.comment: The answer(s) that has been accepted as best, typically on a Question/Answer site. Sites vary in their selection mechanisms, e.g. drawing on community opinion and/or the view of the Question author.

domainIncludes.label: suggestedAnswer
domainIncludes.comment: An answer (possibly one of several, possibly incorrect) to a Question, e.g. on a Question/Answer site.

domainIncludes.label: suitableForDiet
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates a dietary restriction or guideline for which this recipe or menu item is suitable, e.g. diabetic, halal etc.

domainIncludes.label: cookTime
domainIncludes.comment: The time it takes to actually cook the dish, in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

domainIncludes.label: recipeCategory
domainIncludes.comment: The category of the recipe—for example, appetizer, entree, etc.

domainIncludes.label: ingredients
domainIncludes.comment: A single ingredient used in the recipe, e.g. sugar, flour or garlic.

Recipe.comment: A recipe. For dietary restrictions covered by the recipe, a few common restrictions are enumerated via [[suitableForDiet]]. The [[keywords]] property can also be used to add more detail.

rangeIncludes.label: supportingData
rangeIncludes.comment: Supporting data for a SoftwareApplication.

DataFeed.comment: A single feed providing structured information about one or more entities or topics.

domainIncludes.label: dataFeedElement
domainIncludes.comment: An item within in a data feed. Data feeds may have many elements.

rangeIncludes.label: valueReference
rangeIncludes.comment: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.

Enumeration.comment: Lists or enumerations—for example, a list of cuisines or music genres, etc.

Reservation.comment: Describes a reservation for travel, dining or an event. Some reservations require tickets. \n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, restaurant reservations, flights, or rental cars, use [[Offer]].

domainIncludes.label: reservationId
domainIncludes.comment: A unique identifier for the reservation.

domainIncludes.label: reservationStatus
domainIncludes.comment: The current status of the reservation.

domainIncludes.label: reservationFor
domainIncludes.comment: The thing -- flight, event, restaurant,etc. being reserved.

domainIncludes.label: underName
domainIncludes.comment: The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.

domainIncludes.label: provider
domainIncludes.comment: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

domainIncludes.label: bookingAgent
domainIncludes.comment: 'bookingAgent' is an out-dated term indicating a 'broker' that serves as a booking agent.

domainIncludes.label: bookingTime
domainIncludes.comment: The date and time the reservation was booked.

domainIncludes.label: modifiedTime
domainIncludes.comment: The date and time the reservation was modified.

domainIncludes.label: programMembershipUsed
domainIncludes.comment: Any membership in a frequent flyer, hotel loyalty program, etc. being applied to the reservation.

domainIncludes.label: reservedTicket
domainIncludes.comment: A ticket associated with the reservation.

domainIncludes.label: totalPrice
domainIncludes.comment:
The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

domainIncludes.label: priceCurrency
domainIncludes.comment: The currency of the price, or a price component when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

domainIncludes.label: broker
domainIncludes.comment: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

rangeIncludes.label: subReservation
rangeIncludes.comment: The individual reservations included in the package. Typically a repeated property.

BusReservation.comment: A reservation for bus travel. \n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

EventReservation.comment: A reservation for an event like a concert, sporting event, or lecture.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

FlightReservation.comment: A reservation for air travel.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

domainIncludes.label: passengerSequenceNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The passenger's sequence number as assigned by the airline.

domainIncludes.label: securityScreening
domainIncludes.comment: The type of security screening the passenger is subject to.

domainIncludes.label: passengerPriorityStatus
domainIncludes.comment: The priority status assigned to a passenger for security or boarding (e.g. FastTrack or Priority).

LodgingReservation.comment: A reservation for lodging at a hotel, motel, inn, etc.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

domainIncludes.label: checkinTime
domainIncludes.comment: The earliest someone may check into a lodging establishment.

domainIncludes.label: checkoutTime
domainIncludes.comment: The latest someone may check out of a lodging establishment.

domainIncludes.label: lodgingUnitType
domainIncludes.comment: Textual description of the unit type (including suite vs. room, size of bed, etc.).

domainIncludes.label: lodgingUnitDescription
domainIncludes.comment: A full description of the lodging unit.

domainIncludes.label: numAdults
domainIncludes.comment: The number of adults staying in the unit.

domainIncludes.label: numChildren
domainIncludes.comment: The number of children staying in the unit.

RentalCarReservation.comment: A reservation for a rental car.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

domainIncludes.label: pickupLocation
domainIncludes.comment: Where a taxi will pick up a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

domainIncludes.label: dropoffLocation
domainIncludes.comment: Where a rental car can be dropped off.

domainIncludes.label: pickupTime
domainIncludes.comment: When a taxi will pickup a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

domainIncludes.label: dropoffTime
domainIncludes.comment: When a rental car can be dropped off.

TaxiReservation.comment: A reservation for a taxi.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

domainIncludes.label: partySize
domainIncludes.comment: Number of people the reservation should accommodate.

domainIncludes.label: pickupLocation
domainIncludes.comment: Where a taxi will pick up a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

domainIncludes.label: pickupTime
domainIncludes.comment: When a taxi will pickup a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

TrainReservation.comment: A reservation for train travel.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

ReservationPackage.comment: A group of multiple reservations with common values for all sub-reservations.

domainIncludes.label: subReservation
domainIncludes.comment: The individual reservations included in the package. Typically a repeated property.

domainIncludes.label: boardingGroup
domainIncludes.comment: The airline-specific indicator of boarding order / preference.

rangeIncludes.label: reservationStatus
rangeIncludes.comment: The current status of the reservation.

BusTrip.comment: A trip on a commercial bus line.

domainIncludes.label: busNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The unique identifier for the bus.

domainIncludes.label: busName
domainIncludes.comment: The name of the bus (e.g. Bolt Express).

domainIncludes.label: departureBusStop
domainIncludes.comment: The stop or station from which the bus departs.

domainIncludes.label: arrivalBusStop
domainIncludes.comment: The stop or station from which the bus arrives.

TrainTrip.comment: A trip on a commercial train line.

domainIncludes.label: trainNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The unique identifier for the train.

domainIncludes.label: trainName
domainIncludes.comment: The name of the train (e.g. The Orient Express).

domainIncludes.label: departureStation
domainIncludes.comment: The station from which the train departs.

domainIncludes.label: arrivalStation
domainIncludes.comment: The station where the train trip ends.

domainIncludes.label: departurePlatform
domainIncludes.comment: The platform from which the train departs.

domainIncludes.label: arrivalPlatform
domainIncludes.comment: The platform where the train arrives.

Airline.comment: An organization that provides flights for passengers.

domainIncludes.label: boardingPolicy
domainIncludes.comment: The type of boarding policy used by the airline (e.g. zone-based or group-based).

domainIncludes.label: iataCode
domainIncludes.comment: IATA identifier for an airline or airport.

Ticket.comment: Used to describe a ticket to an event, a flight, a bus ride, etc.

domainIncludes.label: underName
domainIncludes.comment: The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.

domainIncludes.label: totalPrice
domainIncludes.comment:
The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

domainIncludes.label: priceCurrency
domainIncludes.comment: The currency of the price, or a price component when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

domainIncludes.label: issuedBy
domainIncludes.comment: The organization issuing the ticket or permit.

domainIncludes.label: dateIssued
domainIncludes.comment: The date the ticket was issued.

domainIncludes.label: ticketedSeat
domainIncludes.comment: The seat associated with the ticket.

domainIncludes.label: ticketNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The unique identifier for the ticket.

domainIncludes.label: ticketToken
domainIncludes.comment: Reference to an asset (e.g., Barcode, QR code image or PDF) usable for entrance.

rangeIncludes.label: reservedTicket
rangeIncludes.comment: A ticket associated with the reservation.

Seat.comment: Used to describe a seat, such as a reserved seat in an event reservation.

domainIncludes.label: seatNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The location of the reserved seat (e.g., 27).

domainIncludes.label: seatRow
domainIncludes.comment: The row location of the reserved seat (e.g., B).

domainIncludes.label: seatSection
domainIncludes.comment: The section location of the reserved seat (e.g. Orchestra).

domainIncludes.label: seatingType
domainIncludes.comment: The type/class of the seat.

rangeIncludes.label: ticketedSeat
rangeIncludes.comment: The seat associated with the ticket.

TaxiService.comment: A service for a vehicle for hire with a driver for local travel. Fares are usually calculated based on distance traveled.

Vehicle.comment: A vehicle is a device that is designed or used to transport people or cargo over land, water, air, or through space.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfDoors
domainIncludes.comment: The number of doors.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

domainIncludes.label: numberOfAirbags
domainIncludes.comment: The number or type of airbags in the vehicle.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfAxles
domainIncludes.comment: The number of axles.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

domainIncludes.label: vehicleEngine
domainIncludes.comment: Information about the engine or engines of the vehicle.

domainIncludes.label: fuelConsumption
domainIncludes.comment:
The amount of fuel consumed for traveling a particular distance or temporal duration with the given vehicle (e.g. liters per 100 km).

* Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for liters per 100 km.  Use [[unitText]] to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. L/100 km.
* Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, [[fuelConsumption]] (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and [[fuelEfficiency]] (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
* Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use [[valueReference]] to link the value for the fuel consumption to another value.

domainIncludes.label: fuelEfficiency
domainIncludes.comment:
The distance traveled per unit of fuel used; most commonly miles per gallon (mpg) or kilometers per liter (km/L).

* Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for miles per gallon or kilometers per liter. Use [[unitText]] to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. mpg or km/L.
* Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, [[fuelConsumption]] (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and [[fuelEfficiency]] (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
* Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use [[valueReference]] to link the value for the fuel economy to another value.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfForwardGears
domainIncludes.comment: The total number of forward gears available for the transmission system of the vehicle.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

domainIncludes.label: vehicleIdentificationNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) is a unique serial number used by the automotive industry to identify individual motor vehicles.

domainIncludes.label: cargoVolume
domainIncludes.comment:
The available volume for cargo or luggage. For automobiles, this is usually the trunk volume.

Typical unit code(s): LTR for liters, FTQ for cubic foot/feet

Note: You can use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate ranges.

domainIncludes.label: vehicleConfiguration
domainIncludes.comment: A short text indicating the configuration of the vehicle, e.g. '5dr hatchback ST 2.5 MT 225 hp' or 'limited edition'.

domainIncludes.label: knownVehicleDamages
domainIncludes.comment: A textual description of known damages, both repaired and unrepaired.

domainIncludes.label: dateVehicleFirstRegistered
