domainIncludes.comment: The date of the first registration of the vehicle with the respective public authorities.

domainIncludes.label: driveWheelConfiguration
domainIncludes.comment: The drive wheel configuration, i.e. which roadwheels will receive torque from the vehicle's engine via the drivetrain.

domainIncludes.label: fuelType
domainIncludes.comment: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

domainIncludes.label: vehicleInteriorColor
domainIncludes.comment: The color or color combination of the interior of the vehicle.

domainIncludes.label: vehicleInteriorType
domainIncludes.comment: The type or material of the interior of the vehicle (e.g. synthetic fabric, leather, wood, etc.). While most interior types are characterized by the material used, an interior type can also be based on vehicle usage or target audience.

domainIncludes.label: mileageFromOdometer
domainIncludes.comment: The total distance travelled by the particular vehicle since its initial production, as read from its odometer.\n\nTypical unit code(s): KMT for kilometers, SMI for statute miles

domainIncludes.label: vehicleModelDate
domainIncludes.comment: The release date of a vehicle model (often used to differentiate versions of the same make and model).

domainIncludes.label: numberOfPreviousOwners
domainIncludes.comment: The number of owners of the vehicle, including the current one.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

domainIncludes.label: productionDate
domainIncludes.comment: The date of production of the item, e.g. vehicle.

domainIncludes.label: purchaseDate
domainIncludes.comment: The date the item e.g. vehicle was purchased by the current owner.

domainIncludes.label: vehicleSeatingCapacity
domainIncludes.comment: The number of passengers that can be seated in the vehicle, both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62 for persons.

domainIncludes.label: vehicleTransmission
domainIncludes.comment: The type of component used for transmitting the power from a rotating power source to the wheels or other relevant component(s) ("gearbox" for cars).

domainIncludes.label: steeringPosition
domainIncludes.comment: The position of the steering wheel or similar device (mostly for cars).

domainIncludes.label: vehicleSpecialUsage
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates whether the vehicle has been used for special purposes, like commercial rental, driving school, or as a taxi. The legislation in many countries requires this information to be revealed when offering a car for sale.

rangeIncludes.label: aircraft
rangeIncludes.comment: The kind of aircraft (e.g., "Boeing 747").

Car.comment: A car is a wheeled, self-powered motor vehicle used for transportation.

rangeIncludes.label: boardingPolicy
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of boarding policy used by the airline (e.g. zone-based or group-based).

BoardingPolicyType.comment: A type of boarding policy used by an airline.

QAPage.comment: A QAPage is a WebPage focussed on a specific Question and its Answer(s), e.g. in a question answering site or documenting Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs).

rangeIncludes.label: acceptedAnswer
rangeIncludes.comment: The answer(s) that has been accepted as best, typically on a Question/Answer site. Sites vary in their selection mechanisms, e.g. drawing on community opinion and/or the view of the Question author.

rangeIncludes.label: suggestedAnswer
rangeIncludes.comment: An answer (possibly one of several, possibly incorrect) to a Question, e.g. on a Question/Answer site.

Answer.comment: An answer offered to a question; perhaps correct, perhaps opinionated or wrong.

rangeIncludes.label: actionStatus
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates the current disposition of the Action.

EntryPoint.comment: An entry point, within some Web-based protocol.

domainIncludes.label: actionPlatform
domainIncludes.comment: The high level platform(s) where the Action can be performed for the given URL. To specify a specific application or operating system instance, use actionApplication.

domainIncludes.label: httpMethod
domainIncludes.comment: An HTTP method that specifies the appropriate HTTP method for a request to an HTTP EntryPoint. Values are capitalized strings as used in HTTP.

domainIncludes.label: encodingType
domainIncludes.comment: The supported encoding type(s) for an EntryPoint request.

domainIncludes.label: contentType
domainIncludes.comment: The supported content type(s) for an EntryPoint response.

domainIncludes.label: application
domainIncludes.comment: An application that can complete the request.

domainIncludes.label: actionApplication
domainIncludes.comment: An application that can complete the request.

domainIncludes.label: urlTemplate
domainIncludes.comment: An url template (RFC6570) that will be used to construct the target of the execution of the action.

rangeIncludes.label: target
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates a target EntryPoint for an Action.

rangeIncludes.label: actionPlatform
rangeIncludes.comment: The high level platform(s) where the Action can be performed for the given URL. To specify a specific application or operating system instance, use actionApplication.

rangeIncludes.label: actionPlatform
rangeIncludes.comment: The high level platform(s) where the Action can be performed for the given URL. To specify a specific application or operating system instance, use actionApplication.

PerformanceRole.comment: A PerformanceRole is a Role that some entity places with regard to a theatrical performance, e.g. in a Movie, TVSeries etc.

domainIncludes.label: characterName
domainIncludes.comment: The name of a character played in some acting or performing role, i.e. in a PerformanceRole.

OrganizationRole.comment: A subclass of Role used to describe roles within organizations.

domainIncludes.label: numberedPosition
domainIncludes.comment: A number associated with a role in an organization, for example, the number on an athlete's jersey.

WebSite.comment: A WebSite is a set of related web pages and other items typically served from a single web domain and accessible via URLs.

domainIncludes.label: issn
domainIncludes.comment: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

rangeIncludes.label: interactionService
rangeIncludes.comment: The WebSite or SoftwareApplication where the interactions took place.

Periodical.comment: A publication in any medium issued in successive parts bearing numerical or chronological designations and intended, such as a magazine, scholarly journal, or newspaper to continue indefinitely.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

PublicationVolume.comment:
A part of a successively published publication such as a periodical or multi-volume work, often numbered. It may represent a time span, such as a year.

See also blog post.

domainIncludes.label: pageEnd
domainIncludes.comment: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

domainIncludes.label: pageStart
domainIncludes.comment: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

domainIncludes.label: pagination
domainIncludes.comment: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

domainIncludes.label: volumeNumber
domainIncludes.comment: Identifies the volume of publication or multi-part work; for example, "iii" or "2".

PublicationIssue.comment: A part of a successively published publication such as a periodical or publication volume, often numbered, usually containing a grouping of works such as articles.\n\n[blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

domainIncludes.label: issueNumber
domainIncludes.comment: Identifies the issue of publication; for example, "iii" or "2".

domainIncludes.label: pageEnd
domainIncludes.comment: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

domainIncludes.label: pageStart
domainIncludes.comment: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

domainIncludes.label: pagination
domainIncludes.comment: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

BookSeries.comment: A series of books. Included books can be indicated with the hasPart property.

VideoGameClip.comment: A short segment/part of a video game.

GameServer.comment: Server that provides game interaction in a multiplayer game.

domainIncludes.label: serverStatus
domainIncludes.comment: Status of a game server.

domainIncludes.label: playersOnline
domainIncludes.comment: Number of players on the server.

domainIncludes.label: game
domainIncludes.comment: Video game which is played on this server.

rangeIncludes.label: gameServer
rangeIncludes.comment: The server on which  it is possible to play the game.

Game.comment: The Game type represents things which are games. These are typically rule-governed recreational activities, e.g. role-playing games in which players assume the role of characters in a fictional setting.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfPlayers
domainIncludes.comment: Indicate how many people can play this game (minimum, maximum, or range).

domainIncludes.label: quest
domainIncludes.comment: The task that a player-controlled character, or group of characters may complete in order to gain a reward.

domainIncludes.label: gameItem
domainIncludes.comment: An item is an object within the game world that can be collected by a player or, occasionally, a non-player character.

domainIncludes.label: characterAttribute
domainIncludes.comment: A piece of data that represents a particular aspect of a fictional character (skill, power, character points, advantage, disadvantage).

domainIncludes.label: gameLocation
domainIncludes.comment: Real or fictional location of the game (or part of game).

GamePlayMode.comment: Indicates whether this game is multi-player, co-op or single-player.

rangeIncludes.label: playMode
rangeIncludes.comment: Indicates whether this game is multi-player, co-op or single-player.  The game can be marked as multi-player, co-op and single-player at the same time.

rangeIncludes.label: serverStatus
rangeIncludes.comment: Status of a game server.

rangeIncludes.label: albumProductionType
rangeIncludes.comment: Classification of the album by it's type of content: soundtrack, live album, studio album, etc.

MusicAlbumProductionType.comment: Classification of the album by it's type of content: soundtrack, live album, studio album, etc.

rangeIncludes.label: albumReleaseType
rangeIncludes.comment: The kind of release which this album is: single, EP or album.

MusicAlbumReleaseType.comment: The kind of release which this album is: single, EP or album.

rangeIncludes.label: albumRelease
rangeIncludes.comment: A release of this album.

MusicRelease.comment: A MusicRelease is a specific release of a music album.

domainIncludes.label: catalogNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The catalog number for the release.

domainIncludes.label: creditedTo
domainIncludes.comment: The group the release is credited to if different than the byArtist. For example, Red and Blue is credited to "Stefani Germanotta Band", but by Lady Gaga.

domainIncludes.label: musicReleaseFormat
domainIncludes.comment: Format of this release (the type of recording media used, ie. compact disc, digital media, LP, etc.).

domainIncludes.label: recordLabel
domainIncludes.comment: The label that issued the release.

domainIncludes.label: releaseOf
domainIncludes.comment: The album this is a release of.

domainIncludes.label: musicArrangement
domainIncludes.comment: An arrangement derived from the composition.

domainIncludes.label: composer
domainIncludes.comment: The person or organization who wrote a composition, or who is the composer of a work performed at some event.

domainIncludes.label: firstPerformance
domainIncludes.comment: The date and place the work was first performed.

domainIncludes.label: includedComposition
domainIncludes.comment: Smaller compositions included in this work (e.g. a movement in a symphony).

domainIncludes.label: iswcCode
domainIncludes.comment: The International Standard Musical Work Code for the composition.

domainIncludes.label: lyricist
domainIncludes.comment: The person who wrote the words.

domainIncludes.label: musicCompositionForm
domainIncludes.comment: The type of composition (e.g. overture, sonata, symphony, etc.).

domainIncludes.label: musicalKey
domainIncludes.comment: The key, mode, or scale this composition uses.

domainIncludes.label: recordedAs
domainIncludes.comment: An audio recording of the work.

domainIncludes.label: lyrics
domainIncludes.comment: The words in the song.

rangeIncludes.label: musicArrangement
rangeIncludes.comment: An arrangement derived from the composition.

rangeIncludes.label: includedComposition
rangeIncludes.comment: Smaller compositions included in this work (e.g. a movement in a symphony).

rangeIncludes.label: recordingOf
rangeIncludes.comment: The composition this track is a recording of.

rangeIncludes.label: musicReleaseFormat
rangeIncludes.comment: Format of this release (the type of recording media used, ie. compact disc, digital media, LP, etc.).

MusicReleaseFormatType.comment: Format of this release (the type of recording media used, ie. compact disc, digital media, LP, etc.).

SportsOrganization.comment: Represents the collection of all sports organizations, including sports teams, governing bodies, and sports associations.

domainIncludes.label: sport
domainIncludes.comment: A type of sport (e.g. Baseball).

DatedMoneySpecification.comment: A DatedMoneySpecification represents monetary values with optional start and end dates. For example, this could represent an employee's salary over a specific period of time. __Note:__ This type has been superseded by [[MonetaryAmount]] use of that type is recommended

domainIncludes.label: amount
domainIncludes.comment: The amount of money.

domainIncludes.label: currency
domainIncludes.comment: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

domainIncludes.label: amount
domainIncludes.comment: The amount of money.

InvestmentOrDeposit.comment: A type of financial product that typically requires the client to transfer funds to a financial service in return for potential beneficial financial return.

domainIncludes.label: currency
domainIncludes.comment: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

rangeIncludes.label: estimatedSalary
rangeIncludes.comment: An estimated salary for a job posting or occupation, based on a variety of variables including, but not limited to industry, job title, and location. Estimated salaries  are often computed by outside organizations rather than the hiring organization, who may not have committed to the estimated value.

MonetaryAmountDistribution.comment: A statistical distribution of monetary amounts.

VisualArtwork.comment: A work of art that is primarily visual in character.

domainIncludes.label: artform
domainIncludes.comment: e.g. Painting, Drawing, Sculpture, Print, Photograph, Assemblage, Collage, etc.

domainIncludes.label: artMedium
domainIncludes.comment: The material used. (e.g. Oil, Watercolour, Acrylic, Linoprint, Marble, Cyanotype, Digital, Lithograph, DryPoint, Intaglio, Pastel, Woodcut, Pencil, Mixed Media, etc.)

domainIncludes.label: surface
domainIncludes.comment: A material used as a surface in some artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc.

domainIncludes.label: artworkSurface
domainIncludes.comment: The supporting materials for the artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc.

domainIncludes.label: artEdition
domainIncludes.comment: The number of copies when multiple copies of a piece of artwork are produced - e.g. for a limited edition of 20 prints, 'artEdition' refers to the total number of copies (in this example "20").

rangeIncludes.label: paymentStatus
rangeIncludes.comment: The status of payment; whether the invoice has been paid or not.

PaymentStatusType.comment: A specific payment status. For example, PaymentDue, PaymentComplete, etc.

CableOrSatelliteService.comment: A service which provides access to media programming like TV or radio. Access may be via cable or satellite.

rangeIncludes.label: inBroadcastLineup
rangeIncludes.comment: The CableOrSatelliteService offering the channel.

TelevisionChannel.comment: A unique instance of a television BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

RadioChannel.comment: A unique instance of a radio BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

EngineSpecification.comment: Information about the engine of the vehicle. A vehicle can have multiple engines represented by multiple engine specification entities.

domainIncludes.label: fuelType
domainIncludes.comment: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

rangeIncludes.label: vehicleEngine
rangeIncludes.comment: Information about the engine or engines of the vehicle.

rangeIncludes.label: driveWheelConfiguration
rangeIncludes.comment: The drive wheel configuration, i.e. which roadwheels will receive torque from the vehicle's engine via the drivetrain.

DriveWheelConfigurationValue.comment: A value indicating which roadwheels will receive torque.

rangeIncludes.label: steeringPosition
rangeIncludes.comment: The position of the steering wheel or similar device (mostly for cars).

SteeringPositionValue.comment: A value indicating a steering position.

InteractionCounter.comment: A summary of how users have interacted with this CreativeWork. In most cases, authors will use a subtype to specify the specific type of interaction.

domainIncludes.label: interactionType
domainIncludes.comment: The Action representing the type of interaction. For up votes, +1s, etc. use [[LikeAction]]. For down votes use [[DislikeAction]]. Otherwise, use the most specific Action.

rangeIncludes.label: interactionStatistic
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.

domainIncludes.label: interactionService
domainIncludes.comment: The WebSite or SoftwareApplication where the interactions took place.

domainIncludes.label: userInteractionCount
domainIncludes.comment: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication.

SocialMediaPosting.comment: A post to a social media platform, including blog posts, tweets, Facebook posts, etc.

domainIncludes.label: sharedContent
domainIncludes.comment: A CreativeWork such as an image, video, or audio clip shared as part of this posting.

DiscussionForumPosting.comment: A posting to a discussion forum.

LiveBlogPosting.comment: A blog post intended to provide a rolling textual coverage of an ongoing event through continuous updates.

domainIncludes.label: coverageStartTime
domainIncludes.comment: The time when the live blog will begin covering the Event. Note that coverage may begin before the Event's start time. The LiveBlogPosting may also be created before coverage begins.

domainIncludes.label: coverageEndTime
domainIncludes.comment: The time when the live blog will stop covering the Event. Note that coverage may continue after the Event concludes.

domainIncludes.label: liveBlogUpdate
domainIncludes.comment: An update to the LiveBlog.

Report.comment: A Report generated by governmental or non-governmental organization.

domainIncludes.label: reportNumber
domainIncludes.comment: The number or other unique designator assigned to a Report by the publishing organization.

domainIncludes.label: calories
domainIncludes.comment: The number of calories.

domainIncludes.label: carbohydrateContent
domainIncludes.comment: The number of grams of carbohydrates.

domainIncludes.label: cholesterolContent
domainIncludes.comment: The number of milligrams of cholesterol.

domainIncludes.label: fiberContent
domainIncludes.comment: The number of grams of fiber.

domainIncludes.label: proteinContent
domainIncludes.comment: The number of grams of protein.

domainIncludes.label: saturatedFatContent
domainIncludes.comment: The number of grams of saturated fat.

domainIncludes.label: servingSize
domainIncludes.comment: The serving size, in terms of the number of volume or mass.

domainIncludes.label: sodiumContent
domainIncludes.comment: The number of milligrams of sodium.

domainIncludes.label: sugarContent
domainIncludes.comment: The number of grams of sugar.

domainIncludes.label: fatContent
domainIncludes.comment: The number of grams of fat.

domainIncludes.label: transFatContent
domainIncludes.comment: The number of grams of trans fat.

domainIncludes.label: unsaturatedFatContent
domainIncludes.comment: The number of grams of unsaturated fat.

rangeIncludes.label: carbohydrateContent
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of grams of carbohydrates.

rangeIncludes.label: cholesterolContent
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of milligrams of cholesterol.

rangeIncludes.label: fiberContent
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of grams of fiber.

rangeIncludes.label: proteinContent
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of grams of protein.

rangeIncludes.label: saturatedFatContent
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of grams of saturated fat.

rangeIncludes.label: sodiumContent
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of milligrams of sodium.

rangeIncludes.label: sugarContent
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of grams of sugar.

rangeIncludes.label: nutrition
rangeIncludes.comment: Nutrition information about the recipe or menu item.

domainIncludes.label: cookingMethod
domainIncludes.comment: The method of cooking, such as Frying, Steaming, ...

domainIncludes.label: nutrition
domainIncludes.comment: Nutrition information about the recipe or menu item.

domainIncludes.label: recipeCuisine
domainIncludes.comment: The cuisine of the recipe (for example, French or Ethiopian).

domainIncludes.label: recipeIngredient
domainIncludes.comment: A single ingredient used in the recipe, e.g. sugar, flour or garlic.

domainIncludes.label: recipeInstructions
domainIncludes.comment: A step in making the recipe, in the form of a single item (document, video, etc.) or an ordered list with HowToStep and/or HowToSection items.

domainIncludes.label: recipeYield
domainIncludes.comment: The quantity produced by the recipe (for example, number of people served, number of servings, etc).

rangeIncludes.label: recipe
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. The recipe/instructions used to perform the action.

rangeIncludes.label: cookingMethod
rangeIncludes.comment: The method of cooking, such as Frying, Steaming, ...

rangeIncludes.label: recipeCuisine
rangeIncludes.comment: The cuisine of the recipe (for example, French or Ethiopian).

rangeIncludes.label: recipeIngredient
rangeIncludes.comment: A single ingredient used in the recipe, e.g. sugar, flour or garlic.

rangeIncludes.label: recipeYield
rangeIncludes.comment: The quantity produced by the recipe (for example, number of people served, number of servings, etc).

rangeIncludes.label: fatContent
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of grams of fat.

rangeIncludes.label: transFatContent
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of grams of trans fat.

rangeIncludes.label: unsaturatedFatContent
rangeIncludes.comment: The number of grams of unsaturated fat.

domainIncludes.label: foodEstablishment
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The specific food establishment where the action occurred.

domainIncludes.label: recipe
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. The recipe/instructions used to perform the action.

rangeIncludes.label: foodEstablishment
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The specific food establishment where the action occurred.

rangeIncludes.label: foodEstablishment
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of location. The specific food establishment where the action occurred.

CompoundPriceSpecification.comment: A compound price specification is one that bundles multiple prices that all apply in combination for different dimensions of consumption. Use the name property of the attached unit price specification for indicating the dimension of a price component (e.g. "electricity" or "final cleaning").

domainIncludes.label: priceComponent
domainIncludes.comment: This property links to all [[UnitPriceSpecification]] nodes that apply in parallel for the [[CompoundPriceSpecification]] node.

FinancialProduct.comment: A product provided to consumers and businesses by financial institutions such as banks, insurance companies, brokerage firms, consumer finance companies, and investment companies which comprise the financial services industry.

domainIncludes.label: annualPercentageRate
domainIncludes.comment: The annual rate that is charged for borrowing (or made by investing), expressed as a single percentage number that represents the actual yearly cost of funds over the term of a loan. This includes any fees or additional costs associated with the transaction.

domainIncludes.label: feesAndCommissionsSpecification
domainIncludes.comment: Description of fees, commissions, and other terms applied either to a class of financial product, or by a financial service organization.

domainIncludes.label: interestRate
domainIncludes.comment: The interest rate, charged or paid, applicable to the financial product. Note: This is different from the calculated annualPercentageRate.

BankAccount.comment: A product or service offered by a bank whereby one may deposit, withdraw or transfer money and in some cases be paid interest.

DepositAccount.comment: A type of Bank Account with a main purpose of depositing funds to gain interest or other benefits.

PaymentCard.comment: A payment method using a credit, debit, store or other card to associate the payment with an account.

PaymentService.comment: A Service to transfer funds from a person or organization to a beneficiary person or organization.

CurrencyConversionService.comment: A service to convert funds from one currency to another currency.

Conversation.comment: One or more messages between organizations or people on a particular topic. Individual messages can be linked to the conversation with isPartOf or hasPart properties.

domainIncludes.label: hasDigitalDocumentPermission
domainIncludes.comment: A permission related to the access to this document (e.g. permission to read or write an electronic document). For a public document, specify a grantee with an Audience with audienceType equal to "public".

PresentationDigitalDocument.comment: A file containing slides or used for a presentation.

TextDigitalDocument.comment: A file composed primarily of text.

NoteDigitalDocument.comment: A file containing a note, primarily for the author.

DigitalDocumentPermission.comment: A permission for a particular person or group to access a particular file.

domainIncludes.label: grantee
domainIncludes.comment: The person, organization, contact point, or audience that has been granted this permission.

domainIncludes.label: permissionType
domainIncludes.comment: The type of permission granted the person, organization, or audience.

rangeIncludes.label: hasDigitalDocumentPermission
rangeIncludes.comment: A permission related to the access to this document (e.g. permission to read or write an electronic document). For a public document, specify a grantee with an Audience with audienceType equal to "public".

DigitalDocumentPermissionType.comment: A type of permission which can be granted for accessing a digital document.

rangeIncludes.label: permissionType
rangeIncludes.comment: The type of permission granted the person, organization, or audience.

Resort.comment:
A resort is a place used for relaxation or recreation, attracting visitors for holidays or vacations. Resorts are places, towns or sometimes commercial establishment operated by a single company (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resort).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

Accommodation.comment:
An accommodation is a place that can accommodate human beings, e.g. a hotel room, a camping pitch, or a meeting room. Many accommodations are for overnight stays, but this is not a mandatory requirement. For more specific types of accommodations not defined in schema.org, one can use additionalType with external vocabularies.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

domainIncludes.label: amenityFeature
domainIncludes.comment: An amenity feature (e.g. a characteristic or service) of the Accommodation. This generic property does not make a statement about whether the feature is included in an offer for the main accommodation or available at extra costs.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfRooms
domainIncludes.comment:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

domainIncludes.label: floorSize
domainIncludes.comment:
The size of the accommodation, e.g. in square meter or squarefoot.
Typical unit code(s): MTK for square meter, FTK for square foot, or YDK for square yard

domainIncludes.label: permittedUsage
domainIncludes.comment: Indications regarding the permitted usage of the accommodation.

domainIncludes.label: petsAllowed
domainIncludes.comment: Indicates whether pets are allowed to enter the accommodation or lodging business. More detailed information can be put in a text value.

Room.comment:
A room is a distinguishable space within a structure, usually separated from other spaces by interior walls. (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Room).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

HotelRoom.comment:
A hotel room is a single room in a hotel.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

domainIncludes.label: bed
domainIncludes.comment:
The type of bed or beds included in the accommodation. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you use bed directly with a text.
      If you want to indicate the quantity of a certain kind of bed, use an instance of BedDetails. For more detailed information, use the amenityFeature property.

domainIncludes.label: occupancy
domainIncludes.comment:
The allowed total occupancy for the accommodation in persons (including infants etc). For individual accommodations, this is not necessarily the legal maximum but defines the permitted usage as per the contractual agreement (e.g. a double room used by a single person).
Typical unit code(s): C62 for person

MeetingRoom.comment:
A meeting room, conference room, or conference hall is a room provided for singular events such as business conferences and meetings (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conference_hall).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

CampingPitch.comment:
A [[CampingPitch]] is an individual place for overnight stay in the outdoors, typically being part of a larger camping site, or [[Campground]].\n\n      
In British English a campsite, or campground, is an area, usually divided into a number of pitches, where people can camp overnight using tents or camper vans or caravans; this British English use of the word is synonymous with the American English expression campground. In American English the term campsite generally means an area where an individual, family, group, or military unit can pitch a tent or park a camper; a campground may contain many campsites.
(Source: Wikipedia see [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campsite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campsite)).\n\n
See also the dedicated [document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations](/docs/hotels.html).

Suite.comment:
A suite in a hotel or other public accommodation, denotes a class of luxury accommodations, the key feature of which is multiple rooms (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suite_(hotel)).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

domainIncludes.label: bed
domainIncludes.comment:
The type of bed or beds included in the accommodation. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you use bed directly with a text.
      If you want to indicate the quantity of a certain kind of bed, use an instance of BedDetails. For more detailed information, use the amenityFeature property.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfRooms
domainIncludes.comment:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

domainIncludes.label: occupancy
domainIncludes.comment:
The allowed total occupancy for the accommodation in persons (including infants etc). For individual accommodations, this is not necessarily the legal maximum but defines the permitted usage as per the contractual agreement (e.g. a double room used by a single person).
Typical unit code(s): C62 for person

House.comment: A house is a building or structure that has the ability to be occupied for habitation by humans or other creatures (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House).

domainIncludes.label: numberOfRooms
domainIncludes.comment:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

Apartment.comment: An apartment (in American English) or flat (in British English) is a self-contained housing unit (a type of residential real estate) that occupies only part of a building (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apartment).

domainIncludes.label: numberOfRooms
domainIncludes.comment:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

domainIncludes.label: occupancy
domainIncludes.comment:
The allowed total occupancy for the accommodation in persons (including infants etc). For individual accommodations, this is not necessarily the legal maximum but defines the permitted usage as per the contractual agreement (e.g. a double room used by a single person).
Typical unit code(s): C62 for person

FoodService.comment: A food service, like breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

BedDetails.comment: An entity holding detailed information about the available bed types, e.g. the quantity of twin beds for a hotel room. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you can use bed directly with a text. See also [[BedType]] (under development).

domainIncludes.label: typeOfBed
domainIncludes.comment: The type of bed to which the BedDetail refers, i.e. the type of bed available in the quantity indicated by quantity.

domainIncludes.label: numberOfBeds
domainIncludes.comment: The quantity of the given bed type available in the HotelRoom, Suite, House, or Apartment.

rangeIncludes.label: bed
rangeIncludes.comment:
The type of bed or beds included in the accommodation. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you use bed directly with a text.
      If you want to indicate the quantity of a certain kind of bed, use an instance of BedDetails. For more detailed information, use the amenityFeature property.

HowTo.comment: Instructions that explain how to achieve a result by performing a sequence of steps.

domainIncludes.label: estimatedCost
domainIncludes.comment: The estimated cost of the supply or supplies consumed when performing instructions.

domainIncludes.label: performTime
domainIncludes.comment: The length of time it takes to perform instructions or a direction (not including time to prepare the supplies), in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

domainIncludes.label: prepTime
domainIncludes.comment: The length of time it takes to prepare the items to be used in instructions or a direction, in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

domainIncludes.label: supply
domainIncludes.comment: A sub-property of instrument. A supply consumed when performing instructions or a direction.

domainIncludes.label: step
domainIncludes.comment: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection.

domainIncludes.label: steps
domainIncludes.comment: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection (originally misnamed 'steps'; 'step' is preferred).

domainIncludes.label: tool
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. An object used (but not consumed) when performing instructions or a direction.

domainIncludes.label: totalTime
domainIncludes.comment: The total time required to perform instructions or a direction (including time to prepare the supplies), in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

domainIncludes.label: yield
domainIncludes.comment: The quantity that results by performing instructions. For example, a paper airplane, 10 personalized candles.

domainIncludes.label: estimatedCost
domainIncludes.comment: The estimated cost of the supply or supplies consumed when performing instructions.

rangeIncludes.label: supply
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub-property of instrument. A supply consumed when performing instructions or a direction.

HowToSupply.comment: A supply consumed when performing the instructions for how to achieve a result.

domainIncludes.label: performTime
domainIncludes.comment: The length of time it takes to perform instructions or a direction (not including time to prepare the supplies), in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

domainIncludes.label: prepTime
domainIncludes.comment: The length of time it takes to prepare the items to be used in instructions or a direction, in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

domainIncludes.label: supply
domainIncludes.comment: A sub-property of instrument. A supply consumed when performing instructions or a direction.

domainIncludes.label: tool
domainIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. An object used (but not consumed) when performing instructions or a direction.

domainIncludes.label: totalTime
domainIncludes.comment: The total time required to perform instructions or a direction (including time to prepare the supplies), in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

domainIncludes.label: afterMedia
domainIncludes.comment: A media object representing the circumstances after performing this direction.

domainIncludes.label: beforeMedia
domainIncludes.comment: A media object representing the circumstances before performing this direction.

domainIncludes.label: duringMedia
domainIncludes.comment: A media object representing the circumstances while performing this direction.

HowToDirection.comment: A direction indicating a single action to do in the instructions for how to achieve a result.

rangeIncludes.label: step
rangeIncludes.comment: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection.

domainIncludes.label: steps
domainIncludes.comment: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection (originally misnamed 'steps'; 'step' is preferred).

HowToSection.comment: A sub-grouping of steps in the instructions for how to achieve a result (e.g. steps for making a pie crust within a pie recipe).

rangeIncludes.label: step
rangeIncludes.comment: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection.

HowToStep.comment: A step in the instructions for how to achieve a result. It is an ordered list with HowToDirection and/or HowToTip items.

rangeIncludes.label: tool
rangeIncludes.comment: A sub property of instrument. An object used (but not consumed) when performing instructions or a direction.

HowToTool.comment: A tool used (but not consumed) when performing instructions for how to achieve a result.

HowToItem.comment: An item used as either a tool or supply when performing the instructions for how to to achieve a result.

domainIncludes.label: requiredQuantity
domainIncludes.comment: The required quantity of the item(s).

HowToTip.comment: An explanation in the instructions for how to achieve a result. It provides supplementary information about a technique, supply, author's preference, etc. It can explain what could be done, or what should not be done, but doesn't specify what should be done (see HowToDirection).

Course.comment: A description of an educational course which may be offered as distinct instances at which take place at different times or take place at different locations, or be offered through different media or modes of study. An educational course is a sequence of one or more educational events and/or creative works which aims to build knowledge, competence or ability of learners.

domainIncludes.label: courseCode
domainIncludes.comment: The identifier for the [[Course]] used by the course [[provider]] (e.g. CS101 or 6.001).

domainIncludes.label: coursePrerequisites
domainIncludes.comment: Requirements for taking the Course. May be completion of another [[Course]] or a textual description like "permission of instructor". Requirements may be a pre-requisite competency, referenced using [[AlignmentObject]].

domainIncludes.label: hasCourseInstance
domainIncludes.comment: An offering of the course at a specific time and place or through specific media or mode of study or to a specific section of students.

rangeIncludes.label: coursePrerequisites
rangeIncludes.comment: Requirements for taking the Course. May be completion of another [[Course]] or a textual description like "permission of instructor". Requirements may be a pre-requisite competency, referenced using [[AlignmentObject]].

rangeIncludes.label: hasCourseInstance
rangeIncludes.comment: An offering of the course at a specific time and place or through specific media or mode of study or to a specific section of students.

CourseInstance.comment: An instance of a [[Course]] which is distinct from other instances because it is offered at a different time or location or through different media or modes of study or to a specific section of students.

domainIncludes.label: courseMode
domainIncludes.comment: The medium or means of delivery of the course instance or the mode of study, either as a text label (e.g. "online", "onsite" or "blended"; "synchronous" or "asynchronous"; "full-time" or "part-time") or as a URL reference to a term from a controlled vocabulary (e.g. https://ceds.ed.gov/element/001311#Asynchronous ).

domainIncludes.label: instructor
domainIncludes.comment: A person assigned to instruct or provide instructional assistance for the [[CourseInstance]].

ClaimReview.comment: A fact-checking review of claims made (or reported) in some creative work (referenced via itemReviewed).

domainIncludes.label: claimReviewed
domainIncludes.comment: A short summary of the specific claims reviewed in a ClaimReview.

MenuSection.comment: A sub-grouping of food or drink items in a menu. E.g. courses (such as 'Dinner', 'Breakfast', etc.), specific type of dishes (such as 'Meat', 'Vegan', 'Drinks', etc.), or some other classification made by the menu provider.

domainIncludes.label: hasMenuItem
domainIncludes.comment: A food or drink item contained in a menu or menu section.

domainIncludes.label: hasMenuSection
domainIncludes.comment: A subgrouping of the menu (by dishes, course, serving time period, etc.).

rangeIncludes.label: hasMenuItem
rangeIncludes.comment: A food or drink item contained in a menu or menu section.

rangeIncludes.label: hasMenuSection
rangeIncludes.comment: A subgrouping of the menu (by dishes, course, serving time period, etc.).

rangeIncludes.label: menuAddOn
rangeIncludes.comment: Additional menu item(s) such as a side dish of salad or side order of fries that can be added to this menu item. Additionally it can be a menu section containing allowed add-on menu items for this menu item.

BroadcastFrequencySpecification.comment: The frequency in MHz and the modulation used for a particular BroadcastService.

domainIncludes.label: broadcastFrequencyValue
domainIncludes.comment: The frequency in MHz for a particular broadcast.

rangeIncludes.label: broadcastFrequency
rangeIncludes.comment: The frequency used for over-the-air broadcasts. Numeric values or simple ranges e.g. 87-99. In addition a shortcut idiom is supported for frequences of AM and FM radio channels, e.g. "87 FM".

FMRadioChannel.comment: A radio channel that uses FM.

AMRadioChannel.comment: A radio channel that uses AM.

PreOrderAction.comment: An agent orders a (not yet released) object/product/service to be delivered/sent.

BedType.comment: A type of bed. This is used for indicating the bed or beds available in an accommodation.

EndorsementRating.comment:
An EndorsementRating is a rating that expresses some level of endorsement, for example inclusion in a "critic's pick" blog, a
"Like" or "+1" on a social network. It can be considered the [[result]] of an [[EndorseAction]] in which the [[object]] of the action is rated positively by
some [[agent]]. As is common elsewhere in schema.org, it is sometimes more useful to describe the results of such an action without explicitly describing the [[Action]].

An [[EndorsementRating]] may be part of a numeric scale or organized system, but this is not required: having an explicit type for indicating a positive,
endorsement rating is particularly useful in the absence of numeric scales as it helps consumers understand that the rating is broadly positive.

rangeIncludes.label: speakable
rangeIncludes.comment:
Indicates sections of a Web page that are particularly 'speakable' in the sense of being highlighted as being especially appropriate for text-to-speech conversion. Other sections of a page may also be usefully spoken in particular circumstances; the 'speakable' property serves to indicate the parts most likely to be generally useful for speech.

The *speakable* property can be repeated an arbitrary number of times, with three kinds of possible 'content-locator' values:

1.) *id-value* URL references - uses *id-value* of an element in the page being annotated. The simplest use of *speakable* has (potentially relative) URL values, referencing identified sections of the document concerned.

2.) CSS Selectors - addresses content in the annotated page, eg. via class attribute. Use the [[cssSelector]] property.

3.)  XPaths - addresses content via XPaths (assuming an XML view of the content). Use the [[xpath]] property.


For more sophisticated markup of speakable sections beyond simple ID references, either CSS selectors or XPath expressions to pick out document section(s) as speakable. For this
we define a supporting type, [[SpeakableSpecification]]  which is defined to be a possible value of the *speakable* property.

SpeakableSpecification.comment: A SpeakableSpecification indicates (typically via [[xpath]] or [[cssSelector]]) sections of a document that are highlighted as particularly [[speakable]]. Instances of this type are expected to be used primarily as values of the [[speakable]] property.

domainIncludes.label: cssSelector
domainIncludes.comment: A CSS selector, e.g. of a [[SpeakableSpecification]] or [[WebPageElement]]. In the latter case, multiple matches within a page can constitute a single conceptual "Web page element".

domainIncludes.label: xpath
domainIncludes.comment: An XPath, e.g. of a [[SpeakableSpecification]] or [[WebPageElement]]. In the latter case, multiple matches within a page can constitute a single conceptual "Web page element".

rangeIncludes.label: cssSelector
rangeIncludes.comment: A CSS selector, e.g. of a [[SpeakableSpecification]] or [[WebPageElement]]. In the latter case, multiple matches within a page can constitute a single conceptual "Web page element".

rangeIncludes.label: xpath
rangeIncludes.comment: An XPath, e.g. of a [[SpeakableSpecification]] or [[WebPageElement]]. In the latter case, multiple matches within a page can constitute a single conceptual "Web page element".

EmployerAggregateRating.comment: An aggregate rating of an Organization related to its role as an employer.

Occupation.comment: A profession, may involve prolonged training and/or a formal qualification.

domainIncludes.label: educationRequirements
domainIncludes.comment: Educational background needed for the position or Occupation.

domainIncludes.label: estimatedSalary
domainIncludes.comment: An estimated salary for a job posting or occupation, based on a variety of variables including, but not limited to industry, job title, and location. Estimated salaries  are often computed by outside organizations rather than the hiring organization, who may not have committed to the estimated value.

domainIncludes.label: experienceRequirements
domainIncludes.comment: Description of skills and experience needed for the position or Occupation.

domainIncludes.label: occupationalCategory
domainIncludes.comment: Category or categories describing the job. Use BLS O*NET-SOC taxonomy: http://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy.html. Ideally includes textual label and formal code, with the property repeated for each applicable value.

domainIncludes.label: occupationLocation
domainIncludes.comment: The region/country for which this occupational description is appropriate. Note that educational requirements and qualifications can vary between jurisdictions.

domainIncludes.label: qualifications
domainIncludes.comment: Specific qualifications required for this role or Occupation.

domainIncludes.label: responsibilities
domainIncludes.comment: Responsibilities associated with this role or Occupation.

domainIncludes.label: skills
domainIncludes.comment: Skills required to fulfill this role or in this Occupation.

rangeIncludes.label: hasOccupation
rangeIncludes.comment: The Person's occupation. For past professions, use Role for expressing dates.

rangeIncludes.label: relevantOccupation
rangeIncludes.comment: The Occupation for the JobPosting.

domainIncludes.label: percentile10
domainIncludes.comment: The 10th percentile value.

domainIncludes.label: percentile25
domainIncludes.comment: The 25th percentile value.

domainIncludes.label: median
domainIncludes.comment: The median value.

domainIncludes.label: percentile75
domainIncludes.comment: The 75th percentile value.

domainIncludes.label: percentile90
domainIncludes.comment: The 90th percentile value.

FAQPage.comment: A [[FAQPage]] is a [[WebPage]] presenting one or more "[Frequently asked questions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FAQ)" (see also [[QAPage]]).

MediaSubscription.comment: A subscription which allows a user to access media including audio, video, books, etc.

domainIncludes.label: authenticator
domainIncludes.comment: The Organization responsible for authenticating the user's subscription. For example, many media apps require a cable/satellite provider to authenticate your subscription before playing media.

ActionAccessSpecification.comment: A set of requirements that a must be fulfilled in order to perform an Action.

rangeIncludes.label: actionAccessibilityRequirement
rangeIncludes.comment: A set of requirements that a must be fulfilled in order to perform an Action. If more than one value is specied, fulfilling one set of requirements will allow the Action to be performed.

WorkersUnion.comment: A Workers Union (also known as a Labor Union, Labour Union, or Trade Union) is an organization that promotes the interests of its worker members by collectively bargaining with management, organizing, and political lobbying.
